author: {'steamid': '76561197970469969', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572054377}
review:
This game has a lot of really smart design choices that make it the best Battle Royale game available. Having you pick a drop location in a specifically direct flight path, with everyone else in the map means in almost every round you are equally capable of being in a good position at the start of the game. In this sense the game is akin to playing Poker and making calls based on what you have in hand and what you think others will have.

It is in no way completely free of luck or some aspect of random nature that will help or imped your chances for winning. But at the main state of how it works, you are the one in control of your game and generally gamble the entire time to be in the best position to win.

The key to a good play is adapting yourself around what you have and what you are going to face. Both the environment you are going through or sitting inside. If you elect to stay still, you run the risk of lacking gear and other supplies for the increased chance of being in a better defensive position than others. Where as being aggressive and moving the entire round can net you more gear and equipment, but this can make you far more noticeable and generally easier to counter. This can also be the opposite for both instances as you can just as easily wait on people to loot and then ambush them for good rewards. The amount of options and strategies you can employ are very expansive, and makes each engagement really enjoyable.

The more you are able to think on your feet, or adapt to the current issue. The more likely you can overcome a disadvantage and pull out a win. In that way the game feeds into the ego and creates tension and risk/reward moments that can be utterly enjoyable or devastating. 

The games big downside is that in order to learn you must play for real. There is no practice range to learn the weapons characteristics, recoil patterns or even manage to practice item pick-up fundamentals like efficient looting or distribution of items. This often means your initial games will be met with trying to get quicker at looting and learning what you can use with each weapon and what you will prefer yourself. This is something I think it needs as a basis of being able to sharpen your base level skills and polish your reactions to better help when you are caught mid fight trying to react correctly and not accidentally miss critical shots or switch weapons by mistake.

If you enjoy the premise of this game you won't find a better game for it than this at the moment. It's core is well designed to give you the best realistic elements without overly complicating everything too much. It's simple enough that it won't take very long to learn or understand without constantly checking key-binds. But to master it all will take a good few rounds and to bring it all together in a way to net consistently high placements and wins may take a lot more losses than most are comfortable with.

But genuine wins without cheats will always be worth it. That first chicken dinner is always a brilliant moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347777874', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 36124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 244, 'last_played': 1575077671}
review:
A very fun game but today was one of the days where I couldn't take it anymore. Half of my games today my squad and I were killed by people using aimlock with crossbows and other weapons they were also moving incredibely fast. In one game 
 it happened after we looted two crate drops. We had great gear only to have our game ruined by a bunch of lowlife cheaters who aren't good at the game. If the developers ever read this please have a better anti cheat and regional locks so that the chinese people will stop coming to the North American servers and ruin the game for the rest of us. Overall I would recommend the game but that might change if they don't get a better anti cheat system.

review:

Looking forward to the next 6 months to see how the games progress with the optimization the devs will focus on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968700270', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 53521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 993, 'last_played': 1575053629}
review:
There are many negative reviews out there, but it seems to draw me in more than any other Battle Royale game out there. I am in the North America (NA) region.

Here is why:
1. Slow, methodical pace. 
2. Many types of weapons and attachments
3. Many players to play with
4. 3 good maps to play on
5. 15-30 min game
7. ping locked games 
8. very few hackers (only reported one in two years)

Where this games fails:
1. a little lag/stutter once in awhile
2. high system requirements, because it's beautiful and fat
3. difficult to land sniping shots, learning curve here
4. Little cosmetics, but they're having sales all the time
5. buggy trying to equip clothes on customization screen

FPS on Ultra - 70-80 @ 1440p.  This is what I get on BF V.

Just to be competitive, i turn some settings down to get my ideal 100+ fps @ 1440p.:
Ultra for AA, Textures, Effects, View distance. 
Low for everything else.

System Specs:
Nviia GTX 1070
Intel i5-8600k
16 GB RAM
Hybrid HDD

author: {'steamid': '76561198451998504', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 105336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573559752}
review:
Actually this is my second purchase of PUBG. 

What I really like about PUBG:

- i like the concept of the game "The last man standing"
- I like the environment and characters it is like your are playing inside the game
- i like the duo or squad option to play with my friends


What i really dont like about this game:

- My biggest issue is the Anti cheating system of Pubg it is not accurate! i dont use any cheat or hacks or any anomalies in the game but i got permanently banned for no reasons! I contacted Steam to appeal they say contact game developer, i contacted Pubg customer support they said contact Steam. WTH! I hope they offer me refund to my 1st account.

- As it said in the PUBG it is not Fully Optimized the game and i experienced shutter lag

- After many updates of this game, the door is so slow to open unlike before when you press F it open instantly.

- Lastly, sometimes they cannot accomodate millions of users to play their game. It always prompt "too many logins" and sometimes inside the lobby "server are too busy"

No hate just telling the truth. #RESPECT

author: {'steamid': '76561197999209563', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 38038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 387, 'last_played': 1575606550}
review:
With PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds (henceforth PUBG in this review), I am in a position I don’t think I have ever been in before. Going into this review, I have put well over 200 hours into the game, having picked it up shortly after it made its way onto Steam Early Access and played it semi-regularly ever since. Over this time my opinion of PUBG has fluctuated significantly, going from adoration to contempt and everything in between. At the end of the day, it is hard to deny the game has a strong pull and is very addictive, offering up some of the highest highs gaming has to offer, while also allowing for some spectacular personal failures that might cause you to lose some sleep.

[url=https://www.newgamenetwork.com/article/1836/playerunknowns-battlegrounds-review/] continue reading [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198119908880', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 38516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573292315}
review:
The game is awesome and full of adrenaline rush their mod was so good there is now a lot of battle royal game and yet PUBG is the best battle royal game. Now game has few bugs unlike before their full release time and most bugs that bothers are about vehicles and sometime stucking in some places.there is real issue with lag and server thing like I shoot them full mag and they kill me with one shot then I watch kill cam and see I am just looking them or not even looking at them and the shoot half their mag on me and kill me this thing made sniping almost impossible for me and another big problem i have which I think most games have is railings and some edges that even though I shoot between them or empty spaces my bullets hit invisible thing in air near railings and some edges. And my other problem is i have drop fps in almost all close combats. Well cheaters are almost everywhere and it seems developers are not doing any effective action against them.
I give score of 8.5/10 because the game is so much fun but ye has a lot of problems to fix

author: {'steamid': '76561198072090424', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 78654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1262, 'last_played': 1575768080}
review: I've been playing this game since March 2017, and I haven't been able to put it down since. It's been such a pleasure watching this game grow and evolve, and to be able to take part in the process. While many people get butt hurt over the occasional crashes or getting killed when "I totally got a headshot on that guy this is bs he didn't kill me," I honestly don't care about all that. Crashes happen and people can play games better than you. Shit happens. I couldn't be happier with where the game has come, they've really taken the battle royale concept and run with it, and even after bad days I'll always come back for more. I'll be playing this game for as long as the servers are supported!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962298460', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 38044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1538918235}
review:
[H1]Playerunknown’s Battlegrounds[/H1]

The decision to open my wallet and board that plane for the first time was one of zero regrets.
This is hands down the best multiplayer experience of last year. If I would exclude Rocket League, I haven’t been this excited when starting a match, since Call of Duty: Modern Warfare. PUBG breathes new life into a stale and predicting genre that often is most innovative in its modding scene.

The start of the match is always the same, boarding that plane. It’s loud and I grip my mouse firmly.
I am excited, the games can be unpredictable and crazy things happen on a regular basis, even more so when playing in a team of friends. Taking loot ratio and player density into account, I chose my destination on the huge map and jump. I free jump and plummet to the ground, the wind noise is numbing and in the corner of my eye I see my wife talking to me from the kitchen, thinking I can hear anything at all. The last stretch is reserved for a parachute-glide. Scanning my surroundings for enemies and possible an escape car. 

From the moment my feet touch the ground I am in a state of fear and adrenaline will drive most of my actions, for the next 20-30min. 

Minutes later, what seems like hours I lay covered in a wheatfield. There are only three of us now, three seasoned veterans, who survived 97 other people. Some were run over, one had his head burst open from a frying pan, others died of explosions, a few fell to their deaths fleeing, but most where just unlucky in the wrong place, at the wrong time. With heartbeats raised, we sneak closer to eachother, as the lethal force field that kept the match going, closes itself further, making the zone even smaller. Suddenly I hear them exchanging lead, not far from me. I take a risk, I stand up, I put my M4 rifle to my shoulder. As one of them falls to the ground, the other stands exposed, like a tree in the middle of the field. In what seems like a cloudy dream, I aim for his helmet and press the trigger. He falls unexpectedly fast to the ground and I am greeted with a chicken dinner at last. I burst out in a warcry! My wife is effortlessly trying to tell me to not scream like that, her words do not touch me. My hands are still shaking as the emotions flush over me.

Playerunknown’s Battlegrounds is a game that you cannot miss, you just can’t.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004053697', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1526860229}
review:
[b]Summary.[/b] If you like competative FPS game, then check this out. The game is a lot of fun!

[b]Details.[/b] You and 99 other players airdrop out of a C130 in to a huge abandoned landscape filled with derelict towns, prisons, powerplants, a slew of weapons, armor, and vehicles. As you scramble to gather gear [i]a la Hunger Games[/i] a timer counts down and a large white circle appears somewhere on the map. When the countdown hits zero a blue field starts closing in, threatening to slowly sap your HP away until you either die, or get yourself into the white circle. This mechanic continues over and over, further corraling the remaining players into a smaller and smaller zone in order to increase the occurance of confrontation. The game is over when only one person, duo, trio, or squad is left.

[b]Game Modes.[/b] Single: you and 99 others are put into a last man standing struggle of life and death. Duo: partner with your buddy (or a random) to take on 49 other teams. Trio: like Duo, but with two friends (or randoms). Squad: Trio +1. One Man Squad: you are such a BAMF that you are going to take on 25 teams of four... by yourself, it must be really hard to carry those balls of yours.

[b]Pros.[/b]
[*]The game is fun
[*]The game is more fun with friends
[*]Good assortment of weapons, armor, and vehicles

[b]Cons.[/b]
[*]Sometimes there are hackers, though this issue has dropped DRAMATICALLY within recent weeks
[*]You must be okay with losing... as this will happen a lot... seriously there are like... 99 other people who want to snipe your face off when you aren't looking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216827193', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1521580877}
review:
The game is great to play with friends, and it's been nice seeing the game grow throughout it's alpha & beta phases. It's a bit frustrating that the game only has 2 maps, considering its nearly 30 quid, but i feel i've gotten my money's worth. One day i would like to see the devs add a few more modes, maybe a team death match, capture the flag or even a battle royale, in the same vein as H1Z1, or potentially Fortnite (if that's even possible) considering the limitations at hand. Only an idea though, not expecting it to happen anytime soon given how lazy the devs are when it comes to adding new content. And responding to feedback. And actually developing the game. And fixing the servers. And making the game look like it didn't come out the rear end of my hamster. So yeah. 

Overall, great game, good community, and hardworking devs.

review: I can finally recommend PUBG after it has left Early Access. I was skeptical if it will ever leave Early Access, like many other games have been in early access for years (DayZ). But suprisingly they managed to push it out and we have full release this December (2017). Many things have changed, besides the optimisation they released new weapons and a new map. This is one of the most successful games this year and I'm glad I can recommend this to others. This is your ultimate Battle Royale experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119945144', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 70336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3518, 'last_played': 1575796778}
review:
This game has come a long way. I personally think that this is the best Battle Royale game out there no doubt. I have tried Apex, Blackout and Fortnite, and always came back to this. They have trimmed down majority of the bugs and glitches (some are still there, but not enough to affect gameplay). Desync is non-existent, unless you are facing a guy with like 200ms ping. Can't wait for the Erangel Remastered. 

The only downside to PUBG is that it is not ideal for casual players, unlike it's counterparts. The current player base are really good at the game, and new players might find it difficult to fit in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112815373', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 19214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565850735}
review:
Extremely enjoyable with friends. Still fun solo. 2 maps, a grass-land one and a desert based zone.

This game is basically if you took games like DayZ, H1Z1, or Rust, and actually made the movement and control scheme feel 100x more natural. I feel one of the most powerful plus sides to this game is that everything feels fluid to do and not some clunky mess of buttons. This just makes it feel less like a chore to learn and more instinctual.

Yes, there is an issue with players from countries far away from your server region joining your server ping wise.

I feel the new replay + report system will help with cleaning up any domestic or foreign cheaters found in your game.

Warning: Unless you have a powerful PC, the game may not run perfectly though they have made massive optimizations around the beginning of 2018 which make it run a lot smoother. I pull a constant 144 fps with recent updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136638460', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 55675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572794723}
review:
UPDATE 2: Uninstalled

UPDATE: Since I first posted this review, the game has improved drastically. The problem of cheaters has diminished a huge amount, and in general the game is just getting better and better. As much hate as it gets, I think this game is absolutely amazing and I still love it to bits. Every game has bugs and glitches, and honestly sometimes that can make them fun (of course, there are infuriating ones as well). Updating this review from negative to positive. Absolutely love this game.

It's a good game. A great game even, but it's getting far too much when every game you play you get into the top 5 players, only to get killed by a man who's shooting at the floor across the other side of the zone. Or to drop in perfectly at your destination, before everyone else, only for your parachute to get stuck in the air or taking half of your health from fall damage after dropping 2 feet. Or trying to vault over a wall and dying for no reason at all. Or the bloody awful desync, being behind cover then getting shot by a man who's seeing 10 seconds ago. I keep playing this game, it's actually incredibly fun and action packed, but there's a lot of stuff that needs to be fixed with it. The hackers are by far the worst thing at the moment, and more and more keep appearing by the day (most commonly, based on my experience, players from Asian servers who come to EU servers and cheat. I'm sure there are a heck of a lot of players who play on EU from Asia that don't cheat, it just seems suddenly that a lot more keep playing).

#RegionLockEveryRegion

author: {'steamid': '76561198142543149', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 33396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1571432300}
review:
This game is great. Yes, it's got its ups and downs, but that's expected from any game. Even the most advance games today have flaws. With that being said, I want to look at the good and the bad side of Player Unknown's Battle Grounds.

This game was the first smash-hit battle royal game I don't need to get into the backgrounds of this game, thought I do recommend you do it. It's a good read! This game basically introduced a whole new side to gaming. 100 players drop into an arena and it's survival of the fittest. The game itself is very fun. During the beginning stages of a match, you land in a zone and scrounge for items. Depending on what you get, (pistol, shotgun, rifle, sniper or a frying pan) could determine rather you end up on top of the world, or down in a hole were a 12-year-old kid triumphantly loots your decomposing corps. Things can go 2 ways, for a PUBG player. Either they want to be the Alpha wolf and go hunt its prey like sheep, or people act like the sheep and hide from those who hunt them down. Somewhere in between are the players who don't know the difference between a Flash Hider and a Compensator. 

Good aspects:
This game can and will give you an adrenaline rush. Probably not until you make it to the top 15, but you will get it sooner or later. The satisfactory of winning a shoot-out, landing a perfect headshot, looting an air drop and get the good weapons, or after hours and hours of playing and grinding, you finally earn that tasty chicken dinner. The feeling I had when I won my first solo game was fantastic, and I will never forget it.

This game is also very fun when it comes to playing with friends. Teaming up and going as a duo, or a 4-man squad can be an amazing experience and delivers a whole new set of challenges. Loot becomes more scarce between players and now killing someone isn't as easy as landing a perfect headshot. Make sure you finish off those who are knocked down or they'll bite you back later.

Another thing that I personally like is that there isn't a level-up system. Every single player has the same advantage as the other 99, unless you have the skills of a god (Talking about Shroud here). If you drop in a building with another guy, you'd better find something to finish him off before he does it to you. 

Bad aspects:
With every good, there is a bad. This game may be good, but there are the bads.

First off, there is only 1 game mode. I personally am not that good at the game. I've won some, but lost WAY more. It's difficult to practice learning the weapons because you need to be in a game, then you need to find them. Snipers, as you can imagine, are relatively rare. So practicing with one won't always happen.

Another thing is the sheer difficulty of the game. Now some people will disagree with me on this one (which is fine) but this game takes a lot of time, practice, patience, and anger management. This game WILL make you want to break something.

The loot system could be better. Personally, I don't think there should be a market for the items. I like games where you don't have to spend a fortune to get some of the coolest items in the game. Look at games like Overwatch, COD, and a few others. You earn credits in-game to buy specific items that look awesome. Despite the fact that there are ways to do this, it's nearly impossible to do it. I personally would love one of the new leather hoodies, but I will not be spending $800 to get one. I wish items were unlocked and not bought. If this were the case, I'd love this game even more. 

Next are the bugs/glitches. As I said earlier, every game has a few. However this game has way more than a few. I've lost games for dumb reasons (stuck in walls, fell down a hole and can't get out, or just dying for absolutely no reason) and it can be frustrating. This is where Early Access comes into place. This game was in it for a little less than a year and just recently came out of it. Was it ready for it? I cannot say that it was, and still is.

Last of all are the cheaters. Every game has them, no matter what. It's sad that people will always take a fantastic game and ruin it by making their odds of winning significantly higher than the other player. I cannot say that they're a horrific problem because I don't encounter them very often (Maybe 3-4 that are very obvious), but they're there nonetheless. So keep that in mind if you're thinking about buying this game.

PUBG is not a game for everyone. It's for those who like things intense, challenging, and strategic. You need to make smart moves in order to win, instead of going into a gun fight all willy-nilly hoping your random bullets make contact with someone. 

So do I recommend this game? Yes I do. It's got potential, even if its got its bugs. 

I give this game a 7/10. A few things need to be worked on, and I hope it becomes the game everyone wants to see!

review:
Granted the game can be frustrating, but which competitive online multiplayer isn't? The game runs much better since the 1.0 update.

Personally, this game with a squad of mates is second to none. Its probably the most addictive game I have played in a long time, really immersive and takes a good while to get the hang of, however it has been a learning curve I have enjoyed.

My only complaints really are: Cheaters/hackers, they're everywhere. You have to just hope you don't come up against one. Hopefully they will sort this out once and for all. 

My only other complaint is that I NEVER seem to get any loot when I land amongst enemies at the beginning of the game. Could be a ridiculously unlucky coincidence....

Its a great game, not without its flaws and frustrations, but play it with mates...

review:
After many of months of playing this game I found many things that people would end up loving from the game.

Meeting all sorts of different people; from the very toxic, to the very kind pasifists. One day you'll find yourself Solo queueing and when you're in an intense battle someone tries to befriend you and you become friends with them for a very long time. 

This game is great when wanting to play with friends. It brings you close, and brings out the WORST and also the best out of you and your friends.

Quick and Simple: Its super addicting, fun with or without friends, and is definetly worth paying the 30$ and waiting to see what these wonderful programmers can come up with next in this long journey of PLAYER UNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS.

review:
If you want a game where you can win often, go play something else.
If you want a game that is polished nicely, go play something else.
If you want a game that's thrilling, welcome to Player Unknown.

I thought after 1.0 came out people would stop complaining as the game feels amazing now (better optimizations, better maneuvering through the map, better sound design, etc.) yet I realize people are people and they'll always find something that bothers them. If you're one of those people that get upset easily don't waste your time with this game.

This is a game about having fun with your friends and eating some chicken while you're at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961147859', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 45409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1568963377}
review:
The negative reviews are ridiculous. The game at its core is worthy of a shot at Game of the Year. It is an endless amount of fun and even more fun when playing with friends. There are issues with the servers that have consistently been improved, there are issues with hackers that have been consistently dealt with, and there have been issues without a region lock which is partially on the way. Aside from that the game is great and easily deserves a no bullshit 9/10.

There is no reason this game should be Mixed Reviews.

2019 and I am still playing, but grow less and less impressed as time goes on. Still worth the price in my opinion but the game is technically broken in terms of combat mechanics and desync. It is hard to explain but getting shot after you've gone behind cover is commonly place as the server decides the other clients picture of the fight was the real one. 

It is tough to continue to recommend this game to people as I think there are much better games on the way *cough* Tarkov *cough* but it is worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119554542', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1543744475}
review:
PUBG is a fast paced arcade like Battle Royale game. It's a extremely appealing game with all ages playing and a fast growing community to back it up.

CORE GAMEPLAY

The game is a 100 player ffa but with a max of 4 people in a squad the game consists mainly of looting and is 50% looting and 50% fighting. The game begins with a plane flying over a island there are many spots to jump out into and once landed its a ffa. Whilst playing a blue barrier will in-circle the island and kill anything outside of it and it will result in players coming together.

COMMUNITY AND APPEAL

This games community is not an easy one to settle into it is 'toxic' and 'salty' and you will mainly be flamed. This game is extremely competitve (resulting in salt) and is great for anyone that is in to a competitive shooter like CSGO which is where I came from.

PERSONAL STORY AND REVIEW

I believe this is a very great game especially to play with friends and is a great game for only 30 AUD. With a strong, backing and growing player base PlayerUnknows Battlegrounds is a fantastic game and its position at #1 of the most players playing on steam is well deserved though the only problem I found is the computer system requirements which have since upgraded with frame drops though minor it is something to note

END REVIEW

8.5/10 Winner Winner Chicken Dinner

author: {'steamid': '76561198150935691', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572113487}
review: This game is great, it doesn't deserve all the bad reviews. It is in early access, just because a bunch of people are playing it doesn't mean it should be 10 times better than if it wasn't popular, just everyone calm down. With a 980ti, pentium g4560 and 8gb of ram, on all low, 120 screen scaling and using reshade to sharpen, I get around 60-90fps, which is fine. For me, this game doesn't need 300fps like csgo does, because it will probably never be able to do that unless you have a supercomputer. The game is fine, it's not that unoptimized if you change your settings around and play every newest version. Again, this is an EARLY ACCESS GAME. You bought this knowing that it was in this condition, and it's popularity does not change anything. Also if you are falling through buildings, I'm pretty sure that has to do with your computer, and not really the game, I think it may be internet issues. I have never had this issue, but some of my friends have had this. Overall, the great experiences I have had, and for me have had no cheaters, everybody looked fair and square, not just reporting people because they are better, like some people. Overall, this is one of the best games that I have ever played. I have had so many funny and crazy things happen in this game. So what if it is buggy, I love having some weird thing happen like a car randomly explode, and just everyone laughs. This is not a game to take fully seriously in this state everyone. I would rate this 10/10

review:
The Battle Royale genre is becoming inflated after H1Z1's release just as the Survival genre was inflated after Minecraft came out. H1Z1 held the crown for best BR game out there because.. Well, there wasn't any [b]real[/b] stand alone competition. PUBG has smashed all expectations of what I wanted from King of the Kill. (Because lets face it, the original premise of H1Z1 is long gone, I feel bad for even saying that name.)

I don't have much bad to say about this game? It's frustrating to go an entire twenty minutes without finding anyone and then get clipped by a sniper at 100+ meters and it was a complete waste of time.. But the game is solid. Good flow of updates and content, good communication with developers.. Blue Hole does seem to have let this whole popularity buzz go to their head, but I'm hoping they chill out and go back to normal once it all clears.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963515812', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 144986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1010, 'last_played': 1575767303}
review:
PuBg is a masterpiece!
I am a veteran FPS player coming from games like CS, Quake then a little bit through Battlefield, Modern Warfare etc.

The game is basically about you choosing where to land from the plane parachute drop and try to stay alive from 99 other oponents. As simple as that! You land with no gear and you can get gear from looting in buildings and from looting an oponent you kill. Gear gives you an advandage over other players but the biggest advantage you can get is from Personal Strategy and skill.

The concept is fantastic, great gameplay!
If you are into killing 20-30 people then this is not your average shoot-them-up game because you may be 10 minutes into the game without seeing a soul. Later stages of the game guarantee a kill or two, depending on your style.
A game lasts maximum of 30 minutes if you make it to the end. You can expect an average of 2-5 kills if you are playing safe or if you are really good you can even have an average of 7-10kills. If you are a beast then you may even do better than that.
Even if you are a newbie, you can still win the game if you play smart and stay alive. You just gotta take that last kill on the 1 vs 1. 
You can also play DUO with a random Teammate or a friend. You can also play Squad with a total of 4 to a team. (3 additional team members). They can be all friends of yours or you can go for random.

Althought it started out being laggy, demanding a high power gaming pc (just like all great games out there),  with sound needing a lot of improvement (footsteps, you din't know if they are above you or below you) and definitely needing a couple of more maps. All these issues were gradually addressed to and the Devs team really took the game to another level. It's constantly improving and to me, totally deserved the Best Game of the Year Award!!!

 Overall i believe it's a great game and week in week out it is still being improved.

Very good value for money too. 

Hope you find this helpful!

11/10

review: We are, after all, talking about a game that catapulted the battle royale genre from total obscurity into a genre that’s astronomically more popular than any other. A game doesn’t succeed in that without merit, and PUBG has it by offering a level of storytelling and gameplay intensity that is absolutely unmatched. PUBG is admittedly a game that’s poorly designed in many ways and sometimes even non-functional. It’s also admittedly one of the best gaming experiences I’ve ever had in my entire life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062358037', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1561679721}
review:
Is this a good game? No. But somehow, this glitchy, broken, poorly balanced mess of a game manages to elicit burning passion, positive or negative. PUBG is a story of an arguably great, maybe brilliant gameplay loop that manages to shine through the hectic and often frustrating issues the game has. PUBG has done the hardcore Battle Royale better and more efficiently than anyone else has been able to. The argument can be made for Arma BR, but PUBG, at least for the moment, has the playerbase to make it worthwhile to play. If you enjoy battle royale, definitely give PUBG a try. If you don't, it will likely be a miserable experience full of indiosyncracies that are funny to laugh at for the first 50 times, but quickly get old. Like most games, playing with friends can be a riot, and squad play is the only way to play if you don't want to spend most of your time frustrated at your bad luck.

I don't think PUBG is GoTY material, nor am I convinced that is can even be considered a good game, but the fact of the matter is that PUBG is the only game that can routinely provide the adrenaline and the blood rush that I've only ever felt in a 1 v 5 clutch situation in CSGO, or maybe RS6.

If you can look at the bugs as "features" and Bluehole continues to iterate and improve the game, it is definitely worth a try. But, if you are impatient or get frustrated at unfair and often random mechanics, you might want to try out a different game.

review:
Game is great. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes Battle Royale games as well as first/third person shooters. Has a decent amount of bugs, but most are fairly minor and don't affect gameplay too much.

I would say that it's a great game overall. It has potential, especially with the new snow map that will release in December. (Edited: Nov. 21, 2018)

------

Above were my previous thoughts on the game. I will say that I believe that it has improved massively. A lot of my major concerns from 2017 and 2018 have been solved. I believe the game is in a much better state than ever, and I believe that it is currently the best battle royale on the market. If you are considering getting it, go for it. It is incredibly addictive and is one of the best sub $30 games I have ever purchased.

I love the new update (7-24-19). It revamped Erangel, the original map, which is my favorite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081745230', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1517722141}
review:
PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a quality Battle Royale-style deathmatch that is good, but not great. It doesn't add much unique value to the genre, but game design at its core is simple which justifies its decent replayability. 

PROS: (+) Good developer-players interaction and feedback
(+) Graphics quality on Unreal Engine 4
(+) Large map and diverse terrains and towns
(+) Practical gunplay 
(+) No microtransactions or premium currency (purely cosmetical and largely irrelevant)
(+) Flow of gameplay is decently paced
(+) Speed of matchmaking is almost instantaneous 

NEUTRAL: (~) Customization could have more depth
(~) General structure of looting, fighting, and moving (adds capacity for competitive mechanics, but also for repetitive boredom)
(~) Loot drops can be inconsistent  

CONS: (-) Poor use of Battle Points currency (has no intrinsic value or purpose)
(-) Requires decent hardware to play effectively
(-) Lack of variety in weapon choice
(-) Constant server lag and frame rate issues
(-) Probably would not recommend duo or squad with randoms

The game is one of the most popular right now with good reason. It sets the standards and expectations for what a Battle Royale game should be. PLAYERUNKNOWN's combines high quality gunplay and brisk/simple game structure to separate itself from the rest of the pack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198386565073', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 83092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569949875}
review:
В общем. Игра сырая, с кучей багов и проседанием фпс - и, это все ее минусы. Но, как ни странно интересная и затягивающая. В нее вы можете поиграть с друзьями (пати может состоять только из 4-х человек. Возможно, это тоже стоило отнести в минусы). 
Лично мне читеры встречались крайне редко, а то и вообще не встречались. Если вы играете соло и ставите сквад, то в пати вам могут попасться неадекватные школьники, но бывают и исключения, поэтому интереснее играть с друзьями или просто соло. 
Также, если вы купите или получите PUBG, у вас будет абсолютная возможность окупить свое приобретение, продавая кейсы на площадке стим или на сторонних сайтах. Ну и, т.к игре всего год - в ней присутствует всего 3 карты на данный момент, они конечно малость надоедают, но это мелочи.
И хочу предупредить: если у вас интегрированная видеокарта с пеньком - ни в коем случае не покупайте данную игру, потому что очень сильно пожалеете.


Generally. The game is raw, with a bunch of bugs and sagging FPS - and it's all its cons. But, strangely enough interesting and addictive. In it you can play with your friends (the party can consist only of 4 people, maybe it's also worth attributing to the minuses).
Personally, I found cheaters very rare, and even never met. If you play solo and put squads, then in the party you may get inadequate schoolchildren, but there are exceptions, so it's more fun to play with friends or just solo.
Also, if you buy or receive PUBG, you will have an absolute opportunity to recoup your purchase by selling cases to the Steam platform or to third-party sites. 
Well, because the game only a year - it has only 3 cards at the moment, they certainly get a little boring, but it's trivia.
And I want to warn: if you have an integrated video card with hemp - in any case, do not buy this game, because you will very much regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312844967', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570889593}
review:
Before I start, I'll state this clearly. Yes this game is broken in a lot of ways, there's some optimization issues, there's a lot of server issues, there's a lot of things that need to be fixed. 

But here's the thing, when you actually play the game, you'll somehow overlook these flaws because of how fun the game actually is. I've had an absolute blast playing this game after getting it as a gift from my friend. Despite being from Asia I can play on NA servers with ease, however there is rubberbanding in the early game.
You'll see a shit ton of negative rewiews about how the game is broken, shitty, etc. But if you check out the people that typed the rewiews you'll see that they're still playing the game. That's just how fun it is. Even if you hate it, you won't stop playing it.

The developers are actually working hard on this game despite what people say. I've seen it with the 1.0 patch and the instant perfomance boost I got from it. I'm not kidding, it blew me away how much smoother the game ran for me with that update. The new map and other content with it was also amazing.

This game has exceeded my expectations since it didn't follow the early access death trap route.

But thanks Tencent( Although it doing gaming just a piece of s**t ), this situation might soon chang: most of only-PUBG-player will leave steam(also mean most of cheating will disappear), and the truely player will stay. author: {'steamid': '76561197987391209', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1530244952}
review:
Before you purchase this game, understand that clicking "Play" in PUBG does not mean you will get to play PUBG.
The game started out stable, fun, a great game. The biggest complaint I had was some fences and walls were difficult to jump over. SInce then, instability has continued to hack off limbs from the game. Crashes are to be expected at most every other game. Expect games to rubberband and lag for at least the first five minutes of every match. Don't expect it to get better after the first five minutes, but get excited because it -MIGHT- get more stable. 

This game started out as a full-bodied great game, with fixes incoming for the handle of frustrations. To me, it has now become the epitome of an Early Access Nightmare. Errors, crashes, and instabilities everywhere, with no reliable fixes in sight.

This game is incredibly fun to play, it's a great game - But right now, I have a hard time saying that purchasing this game equals playing it. I hope the official release and departure from Early Access will bring this game back to not being an Early Access experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992891947', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 12609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'last_played': 1575665345}
review:
A challenging multiplayer-only open world FPS with a high skill ceiling bringing it closer to Arma and CS than its "rival" Fortnite. 

Playing alone is fine but the experience is plain superior in a group. As always with any game popular with teenagers, you'd best turn off the in-game voice chat and use Discord, Skype or whatever to coordinate with your adult pals. 

The tech side is much more solid than what I was told (thank you Internet): so far I've neither experienced any meaningful lag nor seen any hacker while playing on the European server. I'll update this review if it changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139482778', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 23439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'last_played': 1575140758}
review:
PLAYERUNKNOWNS BATTLEGROUNDS

The name itself is epic, therefore explains one of the reasons why i love it.
This game was recommended to my by some of my friends, and i was instantly caught by it and now i can't stop playing it. PUBG, as it is called in short really started the Battle Royale genre and is a really good, and a high populated game and hella fun.

Optimization, and graphical demand.
The game is poorly omtimized, and even on pretty high end systems like mine (check my desc for specs) runs poorly on high graphic settings. I play on low to get the most fun out of the game and even then i find occational stutters. On the lowest settings the grapics are nothing to brag about and more looks like something that has been drawn by a child. Overall gameplay is really fun, but the glitches and stuff randomly not loading defintly has a downside to the games overall fun rating. 

[Potential spoilers below]
PUBG, an immersive and innovative 100 player battle royale game. Alone or with up to 3 friends, you fight for winning and/or getting the best loot posible in the game. Battle underground, on water, or on land with the many vihiceles that are currently in the game. 

The game has recently been launched on Xbox, and therefor the game was put out of early access. I think they could do so much for the optmization and for the current price it really isnt worth buying if you don't like potato graphics. 
In a total, 9,8/10 crayons because i love the game :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198063922075', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 27873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1555636254}
review:
Honestly....based of the game and everything that has to do with the game id say its a pretty fun and entertaining game. I think most players who buy the game and play it for an hour or so and then say how garbage it is dont realize that this game is NOT for everyone but if you do liike battle royale modes or last mand standing then give it a shot. Ignore all the players who give it bad reviews who have less than 5 hours...or even 10 hours of gameplay. Its a great game to play solo but its an even better game to play with friends. 
Now one thing that bothers me are the negative reviews that focus on the "invasion of chinese players" on the NA or OC servers. True, it is annoying but you shouldnt give a game a negative review based off of players choices. Now you could say "well I gave thema negative review because they are ignoring us on giving china the region lock" but thenwhat about the other player base? Should we get a region lock? Na goes over to AS servers every now and then I'm sure. But as far as i can rememeber i thank player unkown has said that there will be in fact NO region lock for china. That could change in the future but only time will tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150172978', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 32849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1574408291}
review:
This game is amazing!

The feeling of sneaking around the bushes, circle closing in, knowing that there is only one other person left...
For those who argue PUBG is a "bush simulator", or is too slow paced, there is always Sanhok, which is a quarter of the size of the other maps and the same amount of people.

Pros:
- Decent graphics
- Pretty easy to pick up
- LOTS of replayability, I have 500 hours and counting on it
- After region lock and the slowly evolving anti-cheat, not many hackers at all
- Tense gameplay
- Awesome firefights
- Team/trust-building
- Devs that are trying to fix it (Hence the "Fix PUBG" roadmap)
- A pan that blocks bullets
- Many, many guns
- An absence of Fortnite and its toxic, toxic little children
- Realistic, hardcore gameplay

Cons
- Sniped out of nowhere DayZ style (But not so much on the two latest maps, worst on Miramar)
- VERY difficult to win, unless you are a GOD.
- They've added crates, CS:GO style
- What is essentially a battle pass WHY :(

I... I can't think of any more cons, so that's it
Oh god please dont reply with your bad experiences

Anyway, overall this game is incredible and is a MUST BUY!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102754451', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 20764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572007852}
review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.
<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><
The Classic Chicken Pot Pie
<><><><><><><><><><><><><>
Ingredients.
1) box Pillsbury™ refrigerated pie crusts, softened as directed on box

Filling.
1/3
cup butter or margarine
1/3
cup chopped onion
1/3
cup all-purpose flour
1/2
teaspoon salt
1/4
teaspoon pepper
1 3/4
cups Progresso™ chicken broth (from 32-oz carton)
1/2
cup milk
2 1/2
cups shredded cooked chicken or turkey
2
cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed
<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>
Steps.
1
Heat oven to 425°F. Make pie crusts as directed on box for Two-Crust Pie using 9-inch glass pie pan.
2
In 2-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion; cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender. Stir in flour, salt and pepper until well blended. Gradually stir in broth and milk, cooking and stirring until bubbly and thickened.
3
Stir in chicken and mixed vegetables. Remove from heat. Spoon chicken mixture into crust-lined pan. Top with second crust; seal edge and flute. Cut slits in several places in top crust.
4
Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown. During last 15 to 20 minutes of baking, cover crust edge with strips of foil to prevent excessive browning. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><<>

I hope you guys will enjoy your fresh homemade chicken pot pie!
And have an nice day :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198162130230', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1556238653}
review:
Lot's of children here complaining about this game. Don't listen to them, PUBG is a wonderfull game wich I will be going to spend a LOT more hours into than I've already done.

Review:
PUBG is a thrilling and exciting battle royale shooter with some serious good mechanics. I've played this game since the first time you could buy it and I still really enjoy playing it casually or just hardcore sometimes. It's awesome playing with friends and even though solo play feels a bit lonely, it's still incredibly competetive and fun.

PRO'S:
- 60+FPS is the most wonderfull feeling when playing this game, wich can now be done even with a GTX 970.
- Bullet drops is f*ck*ng awesome and feels really realistic.
- You can honk in your car, buggy, truck or motorcycle, this is a serious +.
- Vaulting over objects make for fast and smooth gameplay.
- It's cheap compared to the amount of fun I am getting out of it (30 euros!).
- The reward system is really awesome and there is NO pay to win aspect.
- You can actually earn some serious cash playing this game and selling the items you win in-game (I've made 114 euros so far).
- Buy this game! It's good.

CONS:
- There's still some bugs here and there, nothing major and long lasting. Usually this only happens at the start.
- Motorcycles are 100x more dangerous than in real life, avoid these at all costs or be prepared to die.

Again, buy this game if you want to have some serious fun. I r8 this game 8/8 m8. If you do happen to buy this game and encounter me in-game, be prepared to battle, because I am starving and I'd like myself some chicken dinner.

review:
So, you might be thinking should you buy this game or not?
You definitely should!
why you ask?here we go.

Pros:
1)Very realistic and accurate phyics,where you bump into invisible textures and vehicles starts to spin above ground due to paranormal activities of the unseen.
2)Game sometimes randomly crashes to give you a small break between games.
3)Get killed by third-person campers who got whole day to camp behind walls(if you dont play Fpp).
4)Recoil control is very easy with the RNG randomness everytime.
5)You can pray to the RNG Gods for better circles(atleast you have hope,the Gods might listen to your prayers).
6)Best of all the servers might be busy to give you break from your lonely life.

Cons:
ABSOLUTELY NONE.

Even though things are much better than before now and changes are occuring but at a slower pace than expected.Anyways
THIS IS BATTLE ROYALE!
Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993589397', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572057077}
review:
Fun game but the hacking is a real issue. 

This game needs to be the best out there at preventing cheating because 100 players filter down to a handful and the hacker will likely survive to the end. That makes the probability to encounter a hacker in 1v1 combat much more likely than in any other shooting game out there. Experiencing a hacking encounter especially towards the end of the game is very demoralizing and makes playing the game a lot less fun. 

I am frustrated with the hacking issue but I enjoy playing this game and reccomend it. Perhaps console would be a better experience than pc in this case.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244411118', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 459, 'last_played': 1575384639}
review: Let me be clear: The game in its potential is one of the PC's greatest experiences you can get. But while the game is in Early Access, it gets ported to another console. The game if far from polished and with server spikes, bad optimalization and performance issues and a great deal of hackers and cheaters, it's hard to swallow that the game is considered good enough to make a move to Xbox. I just don't see enough stability on PC to make that move justified. Every update gives me sweaty hands; will my performance increase or will it get worse? I've had periods of time where I could play the game on High/Ultra on 60/70 FPS, and there were times where I had everyhting on Low and I could not reach 40 FPS for the life of me. Maybe that's part of the ingame tension, but I doubt it. The game has every right idea, the adrenaline rushes when you get to the end game are unmatched with any game I've ever played and makes your blood pump. If only I'd be sure that for bullshit reasons I'd end up dying. I'm not one to scream: Fix your game! The game is good. But focus on the important stuff. Make the game stable. In it's horrible state I've played it for almost 200 hours and lots of people tend to do the same, so that definetely gives away a sense of quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142755737', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572225050}
review:
Absolutely stunning, addictive, and competitive game that will have your heart racing.

When I first got the game, it was pretty fun. After a few 30 hours of gameplay, it got boring. I hated it. I felt like the game favored campers and it was laggy. I couldn't get better, and I felt like playing was just a waste of time. Get a gun, make it to the top 10, die, repeat. After a while, I was just sick of this. It encouraged me to build my own PC, so I did. And let me tell you, it was worth it.

With 70-100 FPS at ultra settings, the game looked absolutely stunning. I realized the game wasn't terribly optimized, but that I had a potato PC. Many will say the game is terribly optimized, which is only half true. It could be optimized a little better, but they have to realise it is a realistic looking game, not a cartoon like game. The graphics have to be solic to look realistic.

Now to the gameplay. I have realized that the game does not favor camping, but instead favors players who go out and play the game like it should be played: players who go out exploring, grabbing loot, and moving on. Camping may get you a very low amount of easy kills if at all any, but will almost guarantee a loss. After gaining faster reflexes and better game sense, defeating campers is a breeze. Trust me, the game will get much better if you just keep taking time into it. The game also has very large maps and they are THE BEST. You can tell the developers took time into making the maps instead of quickly adding a new, boring map. There is so much to explore in the maps. Quality over quantity, amitire?

TL;DR, this game takes serious time to get used to. The game may seem boring at first, but after taking time into it, the game gets extremely addictive and fun. Also maps are very fun to play on.

review:
I am a Chinese player, and I hope my words can be seen in the world.
Not every Chinese player is a cheater, a hacker. Most of us also want to play a game without cheating. I see many foreigners shouting REGION LOCK CHINA. Maybe you don't believe it, but my tears have been left. Yes, I didn't do anything. I followed every rule of the game. I even played with foreigners and talked about it. I found out that some people do not hate Chinese, but they hate cheaters. But because there are so many cheats in China, they sometimes think I'm a cheater. I agree with the strategy of REGION LOCK CHINA. But I hope that the majority of players will respect our Chinese players. Our honest players do not want to confuse with those cheaters. Maybe we can chat. I am good tempered and not easy to get angry. Maybe you can kill me for a joke. It's all right. It's just a game. The game is to enjoy it. It's you playing games instead of playing you.
I love this game,whatever it be,I will not change my mind.
I take it all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052050829', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 144278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2127, 'last_played': 1575735935}
review:
------Updated Review July/7/2019------
(PUBG, is somewhat resurrected. Not dead, yet. Neither is it dying as I once thought.)

I admit, I come from a bias point of view with regards to PUBG.
Yet, I cannot withhold my critique of the game and her flaws. 
Since the latest update (Ledge-grab & D-eagle), my squad and I have noticed something quite peculiar. There is more rubber-banding while in game. 
The hit-ratio is better for specific guns, while other guns, the hit-ratio does not seem to register. 

This may probably be my squad's end, and not the server; clarification would be helpful to the hit-ratio of the DP28. (Half drum into 1 guy, never down; Blood is seen, Flinch is seen) 

As a follow up, this latest update is a medley of new additions, (D-eagle -Status Gun-, Ledge Grab -Useful-, and Amphibious Assault Vehicle -PUBG Juggernaut-). On this front, PUBG never failed to deliver. 

The only problem is the constant rubber-banding and lag spikes I never received before this update. 



My shots, still register, but not as much as the previous update. (Still had room for improvement)

The occasional latency, pkt loss, rubber-banding and lag  are the determining factors in the game for my squad and I. If low ping, high fps, it's glorious. 

Another noticeable problem with the latest update, the frames actually drop whilst playing on Erangle, and Vikendi. Much more than what I had previously.

(Before I continue, I'd like to express my (hilarious disappointment) in PUBG for the low blow in terms of this season's pass. More scantly clad in nature, but, it will add to the humor further down the line.) - I'm still expecting for it to continue. 

This game still remains to test one's patience, and duly so. Also depending on one's graphics card, you can strategise on how you can get that chicken dinner. 

Rule of Thumb: [Know the rig's limit , adjust the graphics accordingly, play low-key stealth until you get a better graphics card]

If you want to know how to snag a steady FPS of 100 & above, I'm listing the settings down here for those who still wish to play. 

(Update: GTX1070) 

130-190 fps
[Personal]
Lobby FPS cap -30FPS
In-game FPS -Unlimited-
Anti-aliasing (Very Low)
Post Processing (Very Low)
Shadows (Very Low)
Nvidia Replay (Disabled)
Textures (Very Low)
Effects (Very Low - Low)
Foliage (Very Low)
V-sync (Disabled)
Sharpen  (Disabled)
Motion blur  (Disabled)
FPP-FOV (80-85)
Resolution Rendering (80)


(-This game is not meant to be played pretty-)
It is a game for the laughs, for cremating friends, and talking a load of shit towards one another. 


This game, though not meant to be played pretty is also not meant to be played in TPP. I notice whenever I play on TPP, and when my mates play on TPP, we lag more than we do on FPP.  

Those who wield a GTX 1060, 1070 or 1080, keep the graphics to a minimum, not to high if you want to maximize your performance in game. 

The novelty and originality of the game still has me hooked and coming back for more punishment. Many said I'm attracted to a corpse (PUBG), but, not really. Its still alive and kicking, but, it is somewhat abandoned. OC server is pretty much extinct. But EU & AS are alive and well.  


PROS of PUBG (30-march-2019)
1. Open World Concept 
2. Team Based
3. Can be used for sick comedy 
4. Rely on own style and tactics 
5. Great way to let off steam
6. Stealth
7. Action
8. Timing
9. As realistic as it gets
10. The rush of adrennaline you find in this game cannot be found elsewhere in others like (Fortnite & APEX) 
11. The kick in PUBG is now increased.

CONS of PUBG  (30-march-2019)
1. Bugs (Less so)
2. Hackers (Still an issue)
3. Anti-Cheat system not really working (Has been improved/ still needs work)
4. VPN Abusers rampant (Unsure)
5. Some random bastard you team with kills you without any repercussions
6. Salty ass community in terms of streamers, randoms, etc (Streamer community for this game is pretty much dead except for the few youtubers who still play PUBG)
7. Desync & Ping 

Improvements made
1. Shots register more 
2. Game feels smoother
3. Desync improved 




(Final Comments)
Personal recommendation:. 

GTX 
1060 (Minimum/Starting point) 115 - 140 FPS
1070
1080 (Medium-range budget -PC) [Higher FPS]

[Advice from my PC mate] 
[Dealing in hardware/graphics cards/CPU/Mother Boards and Ram]
RTX, though it is good, is not recommended for PUBG, due to the constant driver updates that is required before getting it steady.
The power consumption is high, (rack-up the electricity bill) [to each his own]
Over-heats easily. 

RTX (Pretty & Heavy duty performance)
2060 (Medium - high end budget) [Small Gas Guzzler] (Not as much)
2070 (High-end budget) [Queen Gas Guzzler]
2080 (Unnecessarily overpowered |wealth binge budget) [King Gas Guzzler]

If you want to upgrade a GTX to an RTX, make sure it is compatible with your rig's power supply before installing. 

Unfortunately, 1070 is running out of stock. 1080, where I'm at, barely exists.

_____________________________________________

(UPDATE)
-Fortnite, is still bullshit. Apex, mega bullshit. I tried a bit more Apex, clocked in 10 hours as of now, over the span of 6 days with utter disappointment. 
(Drop, die) [Overwatch-like heroes] 

PUBG still has that kick for me. Still pisses me off from time to time; still can't seem to stay away from it. 

Still a decent game where you can cremate your friends after a long day at work and at University. A good de-stress game, for the laughs, crazy shit and unpredictable nature.

[I do notice that the player-base in Apex & Fortnite are both extremely toxic] 
PUBG also has its fair share of toxicity, but not as much as Apex and Fortnite. 

[Reason for Bias in favor of PUBG]
Game-play- no two games are alike
Game forces you to rely on squad and gut instincts
Never ceases to amaze the player-base with new and OP weapons/features

It separates the players according to style [not heroes or pre-made juggernauts [apex reference) 

i.e. Some players make good medics and Support, others make better snipers while some are just good at breaching.
[the play-style is a determining factor, not predetermined by a hero] 

Critique: 
Need for improvements 
-Hit-ratio
-Latency issues
-Pkt Loss 
-Server issues
-Can be better optimized 


[Apex Legends / Overwatch-PUBG mutation] 
Heroes- gives the player a choice of character
-Gives players a certain ego in-game 
-Boosts ego, disregarding team-work based on abilities (predetermined)
-Lack of teamwork (hard to find unless you're with some close buddies of yours) 

[Fortnite]
-Hit ratios are decent
-Graphics and Bullets; unrealistic as..
-No Bullet Drop
-Can build own castle

author: {'steamid': '76561197991996057', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13, 'last_played': 1574964176}
review:
A milestone game for the genre and a rite of passage for Twitch-streamers which changed the platform almost over night. For that reason alone it might be worth a try. However, the game still suffers from some issues that are core to its gameplay and, at least to me, really impacts its enjoyability. At the top of the list is bad performance/fps even with minimal graphic settings on higher tier comps. Furthermore the balancing of gameplay with the punishing play zone dynamics, highly variable loot and extremely clunky/slow player movement gives it an aura of being dominated by randomness where it is often very hard to know what you could have done differently. Currently there are also no practice servers or ways to create empty servers or to play around with the guns in the spawn boxes outside normal games.

Can be lots of fun with friends in a relaxed atmosphere, but don't expect a competitive shooter. At least not yet.  It will be exciting to see what can come out of the competition between PUBG and a increasingly popular Fortnite.

At its current state and price tag I'm not sure I would recommend to pick this up unless for some reason you have been playing DayZ or H1Z1 all this time. CONCLUSION: Wait for a steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029020389', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 39494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'last_played': 1575467301}
review:
Okay, first of all, this game has it's moments of being a shitty broken game.
Desync, Lag, FPS drops etc. But recently, devs of the game have shifted the entire focus on it. Today was the first update which was released towards it. 
60hz, better frames, better anti cheat (Soon™), better hitreg.
And this is just the first patch, there is more to come. You can read everything in the Dev's blog a week ago. Yes, Locked lootboxes is a thing, even if you pay with Battle points. But it's only cosmetic and doesn't affect gameplay as such in any case. I have a gtx 1080 TI and a 8700k, game runs okayish for the hardware I have, but you'll get constant 80+ fps on a decent i5 now. I have been playing this game on off since alpha, the FPS is massively improved but nothing is perfect. Even Fortnite has frame drops(not like pubg) when you land in tilted towers. 

8/10 for me, slowly reaching 9/10 if the server update works. Recommended not just for the gameplay, but for the devs for having all this negetive stuff towards them, admitting it and providing fixes for it and also communicating with the players.

review: "intense" is a word that gets thrown around a lot. PUBG is the first game I've played that truly deserves that adjective. I like being stealthy and moving tactically, and PUBG hits those buttons. Far from a mindless shooter, PUBG is a game about making decisions under the guise of a TPS/FPS. I've gotten over 300 hours and counting of entertainment out of this game, and made back the $30 price point from selling crates on the steam marketplace. developers are continuing to make small tweaks to improve the experience, and I have no doubt it will continue to get even better over time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096327856', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 5449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1566540768}
review:
This game.

this ♥♥♥♥ing game.

I'm gonna talk about the story first so if you don't wanna be spoiled or anything like that don't read, but first a generalization of the story:

This games tells one of the most gripping and depressing stories I've ever expirienced in my life. It made me feel really depressed, then really happy, and letting it ferment in my mind just makes me really happy and sad at the same time. I'm on the brink of literal tears writing this review right now lol, it's kind of embarassing. I think this game is a masterpiece, having completing everything but the special ending, which I plan on getting when I have the time, I can safely say that this game is a 100% masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198382957117', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 67750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572286662}
review: i highly recommend this game. it is very fun, im new to pc gaming but i used to play COD and this game blows it out of the water. start off sky diving out of a plane, land and scramble for loot and kill as many people as you can. I have been playing for about a month and played the old map and the new desert map on the test server, both are amazing but i dont think the game is ready to be 1.0 yet. still alot of rubber banding in begging, and right now i cant even get into the game cant connect to either test server or regular. tried restarting everything and no dice. i am running an i7 core proseser and a gtx1070 geforce graphics card. game runs on ultra . and looks amazing so its no problems with that just alot i feel like need to be fixed in such a short period time

author: {'steamid': '76561198058090624', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 8758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1568915590}
review:
Aktualizuji svůj review z doby kdy jsem o hře ještě příliš nevěděl a byla ještě v early access...

Jelikož PUBG je již vypuštěná raketa tak k tomuto počinu nebudu příliš moc dodávat. Všichni už máme asi nějaký idea jaká ta hra asi je, ale z mého pohledu...

Grafika není nic extra, ale to ani není problém protože stejně 99.991% lidí hraje na Low-ish nastavení, ať už kvuli (btw) poor optimalizaci, nebo kvuli pushnutí maximálních fps.

Zvuky v PUBG jsou actually great, průstřely nad hlavou, z dálky, zvuky zbraní, vozidel, chůze, nemám s ničím problém. System slyšení střel může být trochu confusing nejdřív, ale je realisticky pojatý.

Gameplay je taky pojatý poměrně realisticky, od animací až po typ pohybu. Sice bych uvítal spíše víc "arcadish" movement, protože v něm se mi střílí a míří mnohem líp, ale je to takové jaké to je.

A co se týče celé té maškarády s fpskama, server lagama atp. Ta byla z větší stránky opravena. Už jen občas padnou servery (ne na moc dlouho). Ale fps či server lagging a rubber banding už nebývá potíž. Při nejhorším dveře se občas špatně registrují. 
K hitboxům řeknu akorát tak to, že když je můj aim v týhle hře tak mega thrash, tak nevím zda je trefuju nebo ne, takže nemůžu posoudit (lmao).

Ye dats it. Přes všechny svoje (teď už celkem drobné) flaws, je ta hra zábava, ikdyž je to takový ten recept "milion bolestivých momentů pro jeden absolutně úžasný", ale to se mění od hráče na hráče a opírá se to o jeho "skill". Have fun.

review: The game in general is very good. But as a partially deaf(only one ear functions properly) person, I feel like am too vulnerable in this game unlike in PUBG mobile. I am not able to enjoy this game fully. When something happens to my deaf side, I am just ignorant to it. So i would very much appreciate if the bullet/footprint signs are made available in the game just like in PUBG mobile. I know this game is about being somewhat realistic, but please consider my request for people like me. You could maybe give enable/disable option for it, if regular players are not fond of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092623369', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 13385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1561829245}
review: Starts que, gets Desert map, leaves, Sorry servers are buisy please reconnect in a moment..., ques again, gets Desert map. Leaves, game crashes. Made a billion in sales profit and they dont even have a map selection system let alone the fact that the desert map runs 40 frams slower then the old one (Old map I get 120 frams and on the new map I get 80 on high graphics, I also dont even load into the desert map sometimes but I will also always load into the old map) and is basiclly a giant hill making it a sniper battle all the time and impossible to drive any where without crashing or getting trapped in the blue for a long ass time. This game is both a horrible mess of developement and has some of the worst looting systems ive ever seen. If your getting this game becuase you think its "more competative then fortnight" then you are very mistaken becuase its also an RNG cluster fuck. On top of that if you dont have a nice PC your either stuck with every thing looking like bad CG pottery or you might not even be able to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153804506', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564867002}
review:
Watch the H3 Podcast on the creator of PUBG and show a little more sympathy for the game devs. Making a game on this scale is insanely hard, especially with a small team and limited time from the exploding popularity.

Please just think before you bitch and whine about the game being broken, don't call the developers lazy or idiotic, just point out the faults in the game as constructive criticism.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087255538', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 21319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572189621}
review: Recently i've read a lot of negative reviews about this game. However, i cannot confirm most of these reviews.. Most of the time, people talk about bugs and bad server tick rates.. i have not really experienced any of those. Of course, sometimes you're sitting in the plane and can't jump out, sometimes your car is doing weird things, but overall it's not as full of bugs as people say. I'm using a GTX 1060 (6GB Vram) and an Intel i5-8400, and most of the time i have more than 100 fps, except for big cities like Yasnaya or Poch1nki (edit: apparently this name is being censored by steam) ... And for those saying it was full of cheaters, well.. you're probably just bad or don't have enough experience with weapons. PUBG is permantly trying to get rid of cheaters, for instance you can't play PUBG with family-shared accounts anymore. On the other hand, its kinda true that it's still 30€ and they probably added weapons to make more profit, but this money can also be spend to reinvest on the game.. unlike fortnite, they only get money when people buy the game or when you sell/buy a weapon skin on the steam market (taxes). They are currently working on a new map which again requires money. Speaking about Fortnite.. it has become a competitor to PUBG, and therefore PUBG is constantly losing players, earning less money. If you're thinking about buying this game, you should only do it if you're certain about your CPU/GPU and believe in PUBG's developing progress. In my opinion, there are a lot of games on steam which are being improved all the time and are worth buying for they are being worked on all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068684521', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567028467}
review:
If you're considering buying this game, but are turned off by the reviews, then listen up.

All games have bugs, issues, glitches. People will find them and complain about them. This game in particular has a lot. And it has a lot of cheaters, but I don't run into them much. I still win games. Not super often, but hunting people is all the fun anyway. 

So yeah, it's far from perfect.
But here's why I like it.
Adrenaline.

If you're someone who considers themselves a thrill seeker or an adrenaline junky, then buy this game. Despite it's issues, it releases adrenaline into your body comparable to roller coasters. And that's the bottom line, cause stone cold said so.

As far as the chinese flooding the NA servers, just add some friends to your steam when you meet them in game.

Also it's only 30 bucks. You broke fam?

author: {'steamid': '76561198322167010', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570861304}
review:
PUBG is the type of game where it starts off with not caring too much if you die in the first few minutes (approx 90 players alive), after a little while and some reasonable loot and gear has been found, you would prefer not to die at this point but still not too fussed if you die (approx 60-70 players alive). After the 3rd/4th blue circle,You start to believe that you can achieve the impossible...you could possibly win...you'll taste the sweet fruits of victory...(10 players remaining)...you've made it to top 10....but you still want more....no more mistakes or joking around now...you're close....(last 2 players)...you believe in this...you can win! But alas...you make an idiotic mistake. You end as #2.....that moment will haunt you forever...

This is what will happen every game, you'll feel rage, anger and above all serenity when you die because you know that the game is over....until you start the next one. 

Welcome to the battleground!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073461552', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1566531426}
review: I am writing this review in U.S. and that's why I am using english instead of chinese. I am chinese and I like this game like others. I hate cheating and using bugs to win the game just like others. However, I don't like the way that bluehole did to asian server. It splits players based on ping which actually separate chinese players and other players such as korean and japaness. This region lock is kind of discrimination. No regions have players who are all positive. I have seen some south korean and american cheating too. Anyway, I hope this situation could be treated justly and everyone could have fun in the game!!! :)

let god aim vs god aim rank, which is nice
let potato aim vs potato aim rank, even better

this statement is my opinion, suggestion, for publisher and developer
