review:
PUBG, you haven't heard of it? What? Have you been living under a rock?

This is Battle Royal! Fight untill you're the last person standing. It's as easy as that. You pick the game up and exactly know what to do. 

Sometimes I spend 20 minutes of a game alone, with nobody in close proximity but it doesn't feel like that because there might just be someone around that corner

I know that this guide is short but now I gotta go play the game! No time for extensive reviews! Gotta get that chicken dinner!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071250362', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 78588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2903, 'last_played': 1575795824}
review:
The only thing i can say after 800+ hours that i'm completely sure about, having played almost every BR until now, is that the feeling of satisfaction one feels when you kill/win in this game is completely above the others BR.
The gunplay is just great (bullet drop, recoils, attachments).

Seriously, you have to give it a try to really understand.
One last advice, you need patience(for real xD), mostly on the first hours because while you are understanding the game no one will be merciful, it is not like you will be fighting every second but sometimes it's frustrating to die without shooting a single bullet, 
Who said this game is easy?

And it gets better and better every patch.

If you read until this line hope you enjoy the game as much as i do.

Also please add OCE servers back to pubg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011723145', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 11583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1539946272}
review:
This is a deeply flawed game with questionable weapons designs but can give you a pure adrenaline rush when taken seriously. Best to play with friends - exponentially magnifies and improves the experience. Most recent patch also updated with ping-based matchmaking which helps folks in their own regions play with each other. It's helped curb the cheaters (but hasn't gotten completely rid of them) and the biggest thing many, many people had issue with - the swarm of Chinese players in North American / EU servers - seems to be resolved for the time being.

Game is fun when played alone, but better when played with a group of close friends.

Has microtransactions in the form of loot crates. Some are earned through spending in-game currency earned through playing, others are opened in the same manner as CS:GO - they need keys that you have to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257764720', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 41840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572525320}
review:
Let's start off by saying, as much as I may or may not critisize this game in my review, I believe my purchase was well spent and I have definitely gotten my moneys worth.

The game started off extremely buggy, just like any early access game in it's early stages, yet BlueHole was very responsive and was constantly releasing patches. However, I definitely can't say that the game is recieving the same attention now, as it did a few months ago.

I believe that the creators do care about PUBG, and want it to progress, instead of being like many other early access scams like dayZ, but the main problem is that they arent following up on their promises. Honestly, I cant trust anything that comes out of Brendan Greene's mouth after BlueHole promisied to create extra measures to prevent Chinese players from playing on EU and NA servers with 200+ ping (Ping lock), and infesting TPP and alot of FPP games with cheats, yet havent followed up on that, and the community got called "Xenophobic" by Brendan Greene for suggesting region locking China, where an overwhealming amount of cheats come from. Right now, we need some updates to further prevent cheats, which will ultimately have to be region locking China.

Dont get me wrong, I absloutely love this game. I think its an awesome idea, executed perfectly. I really like the new gameplay updates coming out (The 2x is finally usable?!?!.) But I still feel like BlueHole may be catering to the Chinese audience instead of the rest of us because it brings in the most money. Hopefully we can get a ping lock sooner or later. 

Overall, I definitely do recommend this game, loads of fun with friends or alone, heck, even with randoms! The nostalgia of being in a top 10 position is insane, and getting kills and winning feels much more rewarding than games like Fortnite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198833274429', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 30822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1574570362}
review: This game, for me anyways, has been getting better and better since I started playing in July of 2018. The bug fixes, new weapons, and recently a new map called Vikendi make this game feel complete and thoughtout. There's really a map for every player here. Sanhok, being the smallest, is good for lots of action in a short span of time. Similar kind of thing for Vikendi. Erangel and Miramar, while lacking in pacing, allows for large scale fights and more room. I will say though, Miramar is by far my least favorite map. It's lacking in cover, so you end up crossing large expanses and get sniped. Micro Transactions are kind of ridiculous, being how expensive they are, but they aren't game changing so take that as you will. PUBG is definitely not perfect, servers are whacked and I find myself occasionally being kicked out of servers because they are "too busy". All in all, this game is worth a buy, and will be even better as more bug fixes and content are released.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995599214', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'last_played': 1575473606}
review:
PUBG is extremely fun and rewarding for some, and excrutiatingly painful for others.  From 600 hours of gameplay plus another 600 of watching people stream the game on Twitch, I believe I can pinpoint the type of person who would enjoy it.

PUBG is for gamers who enjoy: 
 - the thrill of an extremely hard-earned victory
 - the challenge of playing against other humans in PVP
 - the freedom to play as aggressively or passively as they prefer, and still be rewarded
 - the freedom to go anywhere you wish and try different strategies
And perhaps most importantly:
 - the chance to constantly improve and adapt after failure and defeat

There is a lot of failure and defeat in this game.  

There are some bugs too, but I personally am not bothered too much by the bugs.  I quit playing when the hacking was out of control, but it improved quickly.  The bugs are very annoying, but you can learn to play around them.  

If you are someone who rages when things do not go your way, do not play this game.  You will get beat a lot, mostly because of your own mistakes.  There are enough bugs that it is very easy to blame the bugs instead of your mistakes, and if you fall into that trap you will never get any  better.  So if you rage easily, don't waste your time.

A note on PUBG Corp and their failure to fix issues:  the game is most popular in China, and in China Third Person Perspective (TPP) is the most popular mode.  Players put a lot of stock in their appearance.  PUBG is filling this need through pay-to-look-good options.  Players who enjoy the more competitive FPP rarely see themselves and care much less about clothes and more about game performance.  PUBG has, predictably, focused more on the money than on optimization.  Like the many negative reviews on Steam, I agree that PUBG is making a mistake in this regard; however, unlike most of the reviews, I still enjoy playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051115981', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1546372784}
review:
Adrenaline filled, Action packed Masterpiece.

At release, I had overlooked this game heavily. All the reviews pointed me out of the direction of this game, as do most with early access titles. But PUBG was different...

After a few cocktails, I said screw it and picked up the title. BOYY! The heart renching adrenaline that I got while playing is what kept me addicted. Even with the heavy stress for mediocre graphics and the Pixelated late loading houses, I couldn't get enough! People is really what makes this game fun. Sure the map may be the same, but every game is different and depending on where you jump, options are endless.

Graphically, the game is decent. Well rounded and doesnt shy away from details. Although The memory tole that the game takes will have you wanting to get another 8 gigs of ram if your sitting on 8 already or god forbid 4. As with most games, loading time can be a pain if your running off of a HDD, but this can be heavily reduced by purchasing a SSD.

Bugs are not as big an issue as they were previously and the developers fix issues regularly. (With a flagship like PUBG why wouldn't you) Gameplay can feel choppy to anyone with a mediocre to sub-par PC, if trying to play on Med-High to Max settings. 

Verdict: 7.5/10 "Just One More Game"

author: {'steamid': '76561197961137547', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1221, 'last_played': 1575743317}
review: PUBG is probably the greatest game ever invented. I would totally recommend it, especially to players who are pretty good at Dota. Maps are consistently designed, weapons and gear are perfectly balanced and the game is bug free. The game also somehow has the perfect combination of no hackers whatsoever and a tiny learning curve so you can start pwning newbs in no time. Id say the plane ride, landing in the middle of nowhere and chasing the circle the entire game are the best parts; but especially the plane ride across the map. I like going on planes. You get free sodas and (sometimes) a snack. I dont like turbulence, though. That makes me a little nervous, but I always laugh it off and roll my eyes so the person next me doesnt know Im about to completely freak out. Overall though, PUBG is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177912715', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 53620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 963, 'last_played': 1575771685}
review:
I stuck with PUBG during the times when people thought the game had died, and I'm really happy that I did.  This game is my favorite shooter and battle royale game.  500 hours in, I feel like a lot of initial problems that plagued and haunted the game are gone.  It's optimized now, there is so much more content than before.  When this game came out, it was just the medium fries.  Now, it's the whole gawd dang meal.

Update 7/16/19
So I have completed all the achievements for PUBG, getting that 10th crossbow kill was a b****.  Here's the thing though.  The game is positively OVERRUN by hackers right now.  If you're looking for high quality PUBG gameplay, you should wait until you've seen another "30 million banned accounts" article online.  It's so bad right now, I caught two hackers today alone.

Update 9/12/19
I've reached 4,000 SP for the rank of Specialist.  I've written a guide on SP that has gotten over 40 reviews, and a 4 star rating.  I passed my 700 hour mark, and this game has largely replaced Rocket League as my most played game.  I'll likely put in another update at 1,000 hours, which I suspect will be before or near year end.
P.S., I've been steadily reporting people this whole time and the actual hacker bans are down.  I don't know if that's good or bad, but I'd like to think that means there are less hackers?

author: {'steamid': '76561198169249697', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1571529710}
review: Came late to the PUBG party.  Thankfully I had it smooth which made the transition easier.  I still get those fun little bugs that remind you where it all started. author: {'steamid': '76561197990136227', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 91664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567050919}
review:
Played the game professionally. Played on Space Station Gaming, Dare Rising and TriggerHappy. Played in GLL, PGL, PGI, First Blood tournaments, everything. This is only one of my accounts for the game.

I do recommend the game. It's far more difficult than any other current BR out there currently: Apex Legends, Fortnite, COD, even the new Firestorm in Battlefield. What this game has that those games don't is deep strategy in rotating. Knowing the maps inside and out, knowing when to rotate, HOW to rotate, etc. You live and die by rotations in this game and you don't do that in any other BR. 

Sadly the Viewership isn't there in the pro-scene, even though the money is. 

If you want a fun time with friends then go for it! I've retired out of it and went back to my normal career, but do I highly recommend this game.

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is a  very misunderstood game in many ways. The past year it has been scorched with negative reviews. However the new patches and the Vikendi update are making this game great again. If you wanted to try this game out, I suggest now because it is getting better from now on. Lootboxes are easy to ignore and the game's matchmaking (at least in north america) is great. I highly reccomend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072219777', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572948089}
review:
[b] Best Battle Royale Game! 	[/b]

Best battle royale game in my opinion, I love everything  with it.
They have some amazing maps, good graphics, good servers and good shooting mechanics etc.
It's a "must have" game, I don't play it often but sometimes I just crave it and need to play it.

I'm not saying that it's perfect, it do have some minor bugs but nothing that make you lose a whole match or something like that,

conclusion: Amazing battle royale game, highly recommended. Is it worth the full price you might ask, I would probably say yes, if you have some money to spend. It really is a good game.

I rate: 8/10

review: It's a game that lacks a significant amount of polish when compared to other BR games, but provides a different experience than the others offer. A more slower-paced, tactical and I guess closer to realism than you will get with say Fortnite or Blackout. Again, that lack of polish is rather frustrating but if you can get past the bugs, it can be an enjoyable experience albeit irritating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291831604', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 52183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573658315}
review:
The capability of this game is much higher than what it is right now. Maybe it is what the developers want, not sure but the fixes that are wanted by the community are not coming to this game. Currently in this state the game is playable but there still are some major issues and major RNG factors in this game. The game is very frustrating if you have a mid tier rig and the system requirements are much higher than mentioned.
Despite all this, this game is very fun to play with friends and also very competitive to play solo. The feeling you get when you are in the top 5 and you finally win the chicken dinner is too good but also goes away after a while.
Great Game CURRENTLY Bad Execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799354110', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 17634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570127920}
review:
The gameplay is crisp and smooth. The movement in this game is amazing when you've learnt how to use it. Gunplay is powerful and spicy, everything from spraying an AKM to sniping with an M24 is a joy. The maps are okay in general, but excluding Mirimar, which everyone pretty much hates, they are incredible. Every playstyle is viable, some more than others, if you are good enough, whether you want run around like rambo, or camp in a house like a skinny minecraft gamer. 

Highly recommend.

review: I don't have a lot of time in this game the only reason is because  the only time I was playing was on net stations because my pc was not that good....BUT the game is average maybe close to good the idea in papers was perfect the "perfect battle royale" In gameplay terms it didn't go that well...PUBG Corp (part of BlueHole) treats its players poorly.They are bringing new skins to the game instead of upgrading it so the mechanics and the optimization could get better and more and more players could play the game....The game is a really good time burner...If you are with friends you will have a great time...Although there are bugs and other stuff...This is what the game is known for though a buggy trashy fun "military" Battle Royale and that's what matters in the end...having fun...So YES I DO recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561197965091829', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1562570136}
review:
Не стоит думать что если вы хорошо играете в шутеры по типу CS:GO , Warface (стреляете из лука в minecraft хорошо :DDD) или какие либо другие , то и в Pubg будете хорошо играть . Н.Е.Т Это не так! 
Так что не стоит играть в него на "раслабоне" так вы не займёте топ 1 , да даже топ 10 не займёте .
Надо играть очень внимательно. Слушать каждый звук , смотреть в каждую щель .
Игра больше сделана не для того что бы вы играли и расслаблялись скорее наоборот что бы сконцентрировать ваше внимание на чём либо !

author: {'steamid': '76561198369196595', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570805048}
review:
PlayerUnknown's battelgrounds dont get me wrong it is a fun game with intense and stressful moments but then they are those times when you cant stand the game this game dosent support people with lower end pc's unless you love dramatic fps drops, and the dev's need to contact streamers,playtesters so they can figure out the problems with this game such as, fps drops, drop rates, hit boxes, weapon damage

ok so lets start with the big one {fps} this game would be fanfucking tastic if the fps was improved for example streamers like shroud dr.disrespect, tsm viss (just to name a few) have amazing rigs worth in the $1000
and yet they are getting 140 to 130 fps consistently this pc market is a wide market with high end rigs to low end most people dont have expensive rigs so they have to deal with 40 to at most 80fps which in this game is unplayable  i am a unreal engine user i am quite femilular with it if you want to improve the fps get rid of useless objects such as broken down cars, random boxes ect they dont give ciniemantic value to me to me they are useless and anoying stupid objects witch have no value in the first place 

Drop rates now this is one of the smaller issues but at this point it should be fixed if you want everyone to have a fair fight make stuff like adrenaline shots, kar98k,m24,awm i am not the only one thinking that awm is so rare at this point you barely even aquire it at all out of my 260.7hrs of playing this game i only had it once 

weapon damage now this sement is to do with shot guns mostly so digress with me shot guns are a huge topic with pubg they are common weapons but they are useless i would rather use a pistol than a shotgun they are way to under powerd and long range forget it by long range i mean 50 meters dose fuck all at most if you are lucky 2 dmg please fix this 

have you ever aimed derectly at a guys head and missed complitely yeah that happens way to often at this point its just porly game design it happens way to much  fix this by making the hit boxes bigger or clunckyer 

anyway it is fun but newer players are detererated from playing the game because you are matched up with people who are 6000x better than you and how are you suppose to learn if i where in your position i would implament a tutorial, training area where you can learn the basics of the weapons and train you aim movement ect 

but it is a good game dont get me wrong but they are just to many factors to save this game from dieing slowly i doubt that pubg with fix most of these issues 

overall i would rate it a solid 6.7/10
pubg please please please fix your game that all we want and then pubg will prosper once again



-Yours truley Anarchy

author: {'steamid': '76561198287020781', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 60368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'last_played': 1575580069}
review:
I enjoy playing the game as it is fun and brain stimulating. Having to use strategy and percision aim in a game is very nice and this game does it well. 

I do like the game but there are the occasional bugs. I you have a good pc I highly recommend. My game usually runs fine but sometimes it crashes. If you are considering on buying a game that is a clean e-sports finshed game this is not for you. I believe that the devs will eventually complete this game. If you dont mind the occasional lag but some great gameplay I recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105313960', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 31811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564450778}
review: Feels fine atm gunplay is good everything is good fixes are being added and you just need to keep rolling with the punches desync lag and other problems are being fixed and worked on. One thing that I would say is a must add and should not be to hard is the addition of a firing range, not only is it good to help with aim but it can help when waiting in the lobby for the queue to begin. It shouldn't be that hard you just hit tab or some other button and you are sent to it only a small portion of the map should have to be loaded in and you can pick up every weapon in the game, with every scope or just have a menu to select it. This could resemble the feature added in Call of Duty WWII or Advanced warfare, those are games with that feature which was very nice

author: {'steamid': '76561197984663649', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9, 'last_played': 1575407087}
review:
PUBG is a fun game to play and there are things I have noticed when playing it for awhile.

[list]
    [*] A bit laggy from time to time.
    [*] You can get bored if there is no action happening where you are.
    [*] Cars break easy if you drive fast enough and jump with them.
[/list]

That's some things I noticed but I really enjoy the game, the design and gameplay, You can play it alone or team up with your friends. You choose how you wanna play each match, if you wanna go all in or if you wanna be more sneaky. You choose your own playstyle. I recommend this game for anyone to wants a fun FPS / Battle Royal game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136426800', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 10174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1545023936}
review:
PUBG is a good game for a more mature public. I do not recommend it for a young gamer that plays Fortnite. Unlike Fortnite, PUBG has realistic physics. A bomb won‘t make you dance, it‘ll blow ya brain.

PUBG vs. Fortnite

Fortnite is more casual and laid back, while PUBG got a more serious gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096236165', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1566170458}
review:
Ok, i'm just gonna say this right now. To all of the new negative reviews, get the stick outta your bum right now.

Pros: PUBG has improved greatly since early access. They optimised it very well, to the point where i get simular frame rates as if I was in fortnite, and updated their servers from 32 tick to 64 tick. This greatly improved combat and feel of the game. They even added new grips, sights, customization for the sights, and new maps.  Compared to its F2P competitor, that only has a $0 price tag as a pro. 

Cons : But of course, there is cons to this game as there is to every game. One would be the crates. I auctually enjoyed unboxing the crates using the BP you get from matches, until the added crates that required keys. If you're gonna do that, then atleast give us an option to buy the keyless crates. Second, the parachuting. As you land above the crates in Novo or Georgopol, the parachute can get stuck or teleport you to the ground. 

Overall, pubg is an experience you will enjoy for many hours, unless you just don't like battle royal games. So stop with all these negative reviews complaing about server and performance jeez, it's your garbage pc and internet that's causing you these problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089973335', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564596975}
review:
Many compare this game to Fortnite however in my opinion they are 2 very different games. Yes Battle Royale concept is there however PUBG is much less forgiving than Fortnite. Positioning in this game is key, in Fortnite you can just build your way out of trouble. The feeling of being top 20 is very intense in this game, very good late game. However the mid game in PUBG is basically running/driving simulator. Half of your games you will chase the circle/ look for people but find none. The problem is that majority of the people in a game are COD fanboys who drop to hotspot areas such as Hacienda and in the first 5 minutes of the game, half the players are dead. This makes the player density quiet low in the mid game and can get boring unless. To get some action you have to drop in the same hotdrops as everyone else, so the problem repeats. PUBG should fix this.

Sound is absolute garbage in this game. VERY loud vehicles, guns and bombs. I have to set my volume to low in order to avoid hearing loss. It's that bad. However that makes footsteps almost impossible to hear. They should fix that.

VERY buggy, UNOPTIMISEd piece of crap. 1 year old bugs still arent fixed. PLENTY of Chinese hackers. Developers do nothing to ban them. 

Overall, i think this game is very much worth the price, however developers seem to be incompetent to fix their game.  GREAT concept and fun, but poor execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141200233', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 20583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564422208}
review:
I've seen that there have been a flood of negative reviews pointing out peer to peer trading. 
I can see why people are angry by this and sure it's not a great solution, but it is only temporary. They had said that it will be a while until it's back but so be it. Some of the people complaining about it also brought up the fact that there is nothing to do in PUBG, well, let me throw this at you. What's the point of CS:GO, H1Z1, Rainbow Six Siege, any other competitive shooter? What's that? To win? Nothing else? That's what I thought. It doesn't matter which competitive shooter it is, there is no "goal" other than to win each battle, play competitvely, or rank up. There is no "goal" in CS:GO other than a higher rank, which may I state PUBG also has a ranking system, Rainbow Six Siege has no "goal" and the said "goals" that were brought with Outbreak were only temporary and awarded you with cosmetic stuff. People are also complaining about the microtransactions. I've got something for you too: you realise that they are COSMETIC and have no real effect on the game itself? It's not Pay to Win, it's not going to change the game for you, so who gives a damn whether or not you buy crates or that the crates cost money to open? If you want skins, you can pay for them, they're cosmetic. 

That's the end of my rant, but for those of you wondering about the game, it does have its issues serverside, optimization wise, the physics are a little wonky, but considering it's based of its Arma 3 predecessor of the same developer it makes sense that some of the physics react similarily to how they do in Arma 3 (Occasionally you would drive into a tree and your tank would sommersault into the air and explode when landing back on the ground), if you have a decent computer that can run it though, it's a really enjoyable game. It's fun, fast paced, and after 200 hours I have the same, if not more, push to keep playing, it's pretty addictive. 

P.S It's also pretty fun with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198836428', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573154395}
review:
First of: This game is awesome, but if youre expecting a "better fortnite", this game is going to disappoint you since it is completely different. The game is not about blind berserk and endless stream of bullets, but about advanced tactics, waiting, sneaking and even camping.

But if you're okey with that, I highly recommend it. The game has got a very rich content of weapons, attachments and natural or urban structures which make many different tactical possibilies

A lot of people complain about the optimalization, but the point is, you cant play a late 2017 game on a potato. The real looking details are harder to process than cartoony grafics. Plus, frequent updates are present to even improve the performance, so more mid-low class gaming computers can run it.

The updates also very frequently bring more even new content (new guns, recent addition of many grips, vehicles, third map) and so there is always new and newer stuff added all the time

Also I highly recommend you play this with a friend (I dont have such luxury), since it realy improves the tactical side of the game.

Last word: Awesome, definitely worth those few bucks and highly recommended by me

author: {'steamid': '76561198060811536', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567881001}
review:
Pros :
_Realistic oriented battle royale game (with a maximum of 100 players per game)
_Multitude of weapons with different attributes (Assault rifles, sniper rifles, shotguns, ...) which are chambered in different ammunition calibers (5.56 ,7.62 ,.45 ACP, ...)
_Easy-to-use user interface with simplistic options
_Different time-limited event modes (Metal rain, Team Deathmatch, Tequila Sunrise, ...)
_Easy to learn, hard to master
_Not PayToWin, skins are only cosmetic and you can stop wearing them at any moment in the game
_Currently still developper supported (As of 4/22/2018)
_8 km² maps (with a new 4 km² upcoming)

Cons :
_Only 2 maps as of now
_Split up community (Newbies, Tryhards, Pros, ...)
_Bad vehicle control and optimization (seriously, bump at 5 kph into a rock and blow up)
_Bad optimization in general (Map not loading when landing, having trouble with older graphics cards, ...)
_Servers are often "Too busy"
_Most chinese cheaters come to EU/NA servers

Conclusion : If you do buy PUBG just to chill with friends, or to play to win, you're making the right decision. Although, the developpers are very active, the game is still quite buggy (vehicles freaking out, parachute sloppy controls, ...).

Better than H1Z1 and Fortnite for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027730280', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 151963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1574265145}
review:
INTRODUCTION:

I bought this game back in August of 2017.  I had known about it for several months but decided to hold off on it as I wasn't ready to get back into the multiplayer shooter genre.  My Youtube channel ended up switching over from Clash Royale to PUBG.  I now livestream PUBG 7 nights a week on my channel as a full time job.  I have about 1200 hours into the game with probably over 200 wins, although I do not keep track of my wins.

THE GOOD:

Many years ago I was a competitive Halo 1 multiplayer gamer.  I lost my interest in being a competitive gamer because there wasn't really any shooters I felt addicted to enough to put in that kind of time and commitment.  It can be very frustrating and you can lose a lot of sleep because of practice marathons.  CS/GO was the only shooter that I had thought about getting into, but was already worn out on that game from the original CS mod for Half-Life.  PUBG has reinvigorated my passion for competitive gaming.  The graphics are realistic.  The variety of weapons is awesome, with new ones on the way.  The bullet drop feels realistic (coming from someone who was a Gunner's Mate in the Navy).  I'm also a big fan of the overall military feel of the game.  You get such an adrenaline rush from knowing that you can't respawn and that once you die the match is over for you.  My heartrate still gets pumping everytime I'm in the top 10.  I love the fact that I can play with my friends in squads.  This is my favorite mode to play in.  They also have Solo and Duo's you can play.  I'm happy they added an FPP mode as well, as third person feels clunky, unrealistic (due to third person peeking), and slow.  They now have a third map Codename: Savage that they are working on and seems very promising as I have played it both times they've made it live on their Closed Experimental Server.  This game has a lot of promise and could potentially become the next big Esports game.  One in which I would love to compete in professionally.

THE BAD:

1.0 Release came out in the middle of December 2017.  Unfortunately, the game still has a lot of the same issues we've had since I've been playing it.  And still feels like an early access game to me.  Most of the problems and bugs the game has you don't see in typical AAA titles when they come out with their 1.0 full release.  The game still has major desync issues, mostly I believe to be caused by the Asian players that come onto the North American servers.  It could also be that the developers never expected the game to be so record breaking and are having a hard time getting enough servers to accomidate the millons of players they have worldwide concurrently.  It becomes very frustrating to peek from your cover and shoot someone, then once your back behind your cover, you get shot and die.  Sometimes I will shoot someone out in the open with my reticle right on them and not hit them once because they are desync'd/lagging so bad.  This is unacceptable to me given that it's 2018 and I have very fast cable internet.  Also, because I live so close to one of the NA servers.  Sometimes the desync/lag feels so bad, that I think it's worse than it was on Halo 1 when I played that competitively 15+ years ago.  This has been an issue since I first started playing the game and only seems to be getting worse.  There has been an outcry by the community for the devs to put in a region lock for many months now.  At first the creator, Brendan Greene, called the community a bunch of racists and xenophobes.  Which was incredibly insulting.  Then about a month ago they said they would release a region lock soon, but we have yet to see it come to fruition or hear about their progress with implementing it.  They supposedly released a soft ping lock in the game, but yet I can still hear Asian players over the proxy chat while in game.  Although, these Asian players could be using a VPN to fool the servers into thinking they have a lower ping than they really do.  Am I starting to sound racist myself?  No.  I feel this way about the Asians, because Battleye (PUBG's anti-cheat software company) itself has released statistics that 99% of the cheaters in the game come from China.  This is another issue that I feel the PUBG team DOES take seriously, but they are not stern enough about.  Most competitive multiplayer games have an extremely stern anti-cheat system in place.  So much so, that they will implement a ban mid game.  And typically it's an IP ban.  I have never seen so many cheaters in any multiplayer game as much as I have in this one.  This could be because the game is so record breakingly big.  It could also be because of the monetized skins available.  My game still does crash from time to time, although it is not as bad as it once was, so I feel they are making progress on that.  It crashes just as much now as any other AAA title I play does.  I do get some wierd FPS drops on occassion, more so on the test and experimental servers though.  The FPS drop frequency varies from update to update.  I feel that the desync/lag/cheater problem would be greatly reduced if they simply followed the successful actions other AAA developers have taken by implementing tougher anti-cheat, like IP banning, or even Steam account removal/limitation.  Implementing a region lock will greatly aid in this as well.  One thing, which I feel isn't much of a big deal is I wish they would add weather back and allow for map/weather/time of day selection.  I don't mind the desert map, but when you get the desert map 15 times before you get the original Erangel map again, gets a bit frustrating and boring.  I feel as though they will be bringing weather back as they have been testing it on the new Savage map.  I think people kept leaving the Fog map before because the fog was so thick that you could hardly see anything.  I think if they just tone it down a bit people will enjoy it and play it again.  Finally, some of the playstyles you see in the game can get a bit frustrating.  I like to either land far away from the plane alone with my squad to loot comfortably and then go hunting, or drop into a hot location just so that I can get into fights and warm up a bit.  One of the things I loved about this game is that they had a blue zone that pushes the players together to prevent camping.  Most aggressive/competitive players would agree with me that camping is a boring and not a fun way to play.  But, there are still players who will camp in the corner of a building (even in FPP mode), without peeking, just to wait until they hear your footsteps and shoot you in the back.  It makes no sense to me that they are so scared in a video game, A VIDEO GAME?!  A video game is meant to be fun.  It's not fun to me to sit in a corner and just hide the whole time.  I'll never understand why people do this.  This isn't necessarily something Blue Hole can fix, as it happens in every multiplayer shooter game.  So, I can't blame the devs for this one.  People will also try to fight with you outside of zone not scared of the blue zone.  They buffed the damage by the zone, but people still do it.  I think they need to make the blue zone more damaging than it already is to discourage this.

CONCLUSION:

This game is a great game overall, despite the issues mentioned above.  It's incredibly addicting and one that I feel I would want to play competitively in Esports.  Once the issues are fixed and come out with a real 1.0 release (one that is polished and bug free), this game has the potential to be a 10/10 game.  Just like Perfect Dark and Zelda: Ocarina of Time were back in the late 90's.  The game is only $30, which is half the price of any other AAA title, which I feel makes the game worth it.  Even though I joke on my channel when I'm having a bad night and say I don't recommend the game, I definitely do.  Buy this game.  If I can get over 1200 hours out of a $30 game, that in my book makes it a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037650529', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 21509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1556554621}
review:
I have really enjoyed this game. It's a great way to relax or to play competitively. This is a game for people that want to play more competitivly and more seriously rather than what fortnite has made with its community and fan base. I see PUBG as a game to be taken a lot more seriously.

It's fun with friends and also on solo as long as you make it fun. I myself have spent many hours playing with my friends and messing around. Not only that but I have spent a few hours playing with ex pro ChosenZygote (Calvin) and a few others.

I've heard people say it's boring however I have to disagree, it's only boring if you make it boring. Drop in a big area and try kill as many as possible, make it fun. This game can become hugely more entertaining if taken seriously.

With fornite recently growing massively and becoming such a popular game it's hard for PUBG to compete. My best advice to the developers is to make it free to play or at least half the price, however though it really is hard for them to make these kind of changes because the community would not take it lightly with so many people paying full price for it recently. 
I know there are many hardcore fans out there, I know some personally and know there are many more out there that should be supporting this game in its rough spot.

Summary of this mess of a review, is that it's a pretty good game and doesn't deserve the hate it has been getting. Good luck dev team!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101535224', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 33724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2609, 'last_played': 1575790851}
review:
updated at around 500~ hours played.

bought this game at launch and refunded it within a few games to being soo broken (warping through walls, parachutes not deploying etc)

bought it about 6 months later in and it was fun and alot more polished.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

now in late 2019 the gameplay itself feels very solid and stable. everything works as it should most of the time.

the only thing that makes it hard to recommend is the chinese are ruining the game. if bluehole can figure out how to keep them on the asian server and make aimlocks easier to detect (and no stupid temp bans) it might be get back to #1 on steam leaderboard. 

The desync abusing laggy server jumping cheaters make it frustrating at times. if we can get rid of them this game will be my favorite game on steam

*report any douyutv/huyatv gamertag and they get banned overnight but they still ruin games*

author: {'steamid': '76561198077491405', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570820545}
review: The game itself has good graphics yet sometimes you can experience some bugs and glitches, which are in my opinion very funny to experience. For instance you can get blown up by driving your car into weird structures. The community is crazy and weird. I love it when there are people who yell at you in voice chat and run around in circles. A lot of russians (at least on EU servers) who don't know english and speak very weird stuff to you. Love the customization, though it could use a better character creator or at least more hairstyles or customizable facial features. Honestly one of the best games I have ever played. I give it a 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198124145105', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1526599591}
review:
-- I am saying I recommend this game becuase there is no 50/50 option --
PUBG is a fun Battle Royale game that can prove quite the challenge to new comers in the shooting genre!
I do have fun playing the game, the challenge of going against 100 odd other players each match to see who can
emerge victorious is quite enticing, and the major variety of weapons offered in the game is quite the treat.
This is most definitely not a game for the casual player!

Pros: 
- Good variety of guns
- Big challenge and test of skill
- Very fun to play with friends
- Strategy is a fun aspect of this game

Cons: 
- Not very optimized 


People who are coming from Fortnite to play this game need to have a clear head I think. The games to have massive 
similarities, but they also have massive differences too. The shooting mechanic and gameplay is different, The building
mechanic adds a whole new layer to Fortnite strategy wise, but the military aspect PUBG brings a different feel. Fortnite 
definitely is a lot easier than PUBG, but does not make it a lesser game. 

I suggest if you are going to play this game for the first time, see if one of your friends have it and team up with them.
The steep learning curve of the game can prove difficult for newcomers and can put people off the game easily. Teamwork
is also one of the best parts of this game.

The game is very awkward to run, and I sometimes have issues with it, with my GTX 1080, Ryzen 7 1700 and 16GB DDR4 3000MHZ RAM. It can be off putting but you do sometimes get a good night in where it doesnt bother you.

This game is very enjoyable for the hardened player, if you like strategy or multiplayer games, its a must!

author: {'steamid': '76561198354110551', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569517281}

author: {'steamid': '76561198408662827', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1527493683}
review:
I'm not a man of excellent graphics, so I was okay with playing at my lowest resolution and lowest graphic setting with a steady 40-50 fps. But after they randomly dropped an update of 5gb, the game has now dropped to 20fps (still the lowest settings possible) with lag spikes and very slow terrain rendering time and is now unplayable for any system that isn't made for controlling rockets in russia. If you don't have the newest PC hardware, I really do not recommend this at all, you are paying $40 for a game that you can't even play. 

If you do have a rig that is powerful enough to run this, then by all means, it's a fucking awesome game, with great yet simple task, find gear, hunt players and be the last person standing.

EDIT: had to turn it to a positive review, its alright

EDIT: this game is fucking bullshit, still recommend it though.

review: In Poobergeist 2: The Second Coming you play as John Poober, Schut Marine. Your mission is to eliminate every circle in existence. This psychological horror game is fun for the entire family and can teach your child lessons in counting, safety, and physics. It has a deep story that matches the likes of Garfield Kart and Q'bert, as well as a fantastic soundtrack. Currently there are a few bugs in the game, one of the major ones being that you can't eat a chicken dinner with fingerless gloves on. Other than that its an ok game. Final score: Poob/Goob

review: This is honestly one of the best games I've played. It is, super fun. I reccomend this to everybody, despite there being a ton of glitches and things, its actually really funny whenever a glitch happens, and no, they dont happen every single game or something, but even if you are doing good and you die by a hilarious glitch, It, to me, is more worth it. I'm not sure why this game is getting a lot of heat since it has amazing graphics and game play mechanics that I personally love, but I definetly think it was worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014323792', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 31139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 131, 'last_played': 1575529629}
review:
This game is the fun, stuttery, buggy turd that you fall in love with because it came from the best meal you ever had. Picture a delicious turkey and gravy supper with all the fixings, and you ate it, digested it, then spent 6 hours in the bathroom firing out a 30-pound coco snake and the turmoil you face after deciding whether you name it and buy it a baby's crib or flush it down like every other poop you've taken.
I kept it. I named it Gord. I play with Gord every day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974819635', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 59272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 85, 'last_played': 1575049689}
review:
If i had a nickel for everyone blatently cheating in this game, I'd be a multi millionare. It's honestly too bad; the game is a solid game, well worth the $30. Needs more maps, as well as; need to improve upon the existing maps. However, the main downfall is the 20% +/- 5% of your playerbase is aimbotting and using radar. 

Update:

This game is insanely addictive, if you want to play without cheaters you really have to play on Asian servers. As, there's no incentive for the Asians to cheat on their own servers, they're not using the game as a micro economy in their country. The real quandry is that 99.9% of cheaters are from Asia, however, they also account for 46% of Blueholes playbase, while the US only accounts for 12% of the playebase and with skins being a cash cow for Asian farmers -- the cheaters are going to go where the money is (US/EU) servers.

Bluehole has implemented the infamous BattleEye anti cheat, however, just like ARMA 3; it's proved to be completely useless against monthly pay 2 cheat providers. As far as I've seen in its early implementation: BattleEye just complicates the process for your everyday user, creating a plethora of launching, match making, loading, and other various issues, keep honest players out of the game. Way to go Bluehole! :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198048612898', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564799732}
review:
This game is filled to the brim with hackers, bugs, and will provide hundreds of moments where you just don't understand why the hell did you lose. It will fill you with frustration as any and every possible thing that can go wrong goes wrong in the worst way possible, every zone is far away from you and every enemy seems to only focus you. You'll drop in a hotzone and everyone around you will get the best weapons, and you'll be stuck with a pistol. 

But sometimes you'll get to the top 10 with good loot, and your heart will race like you're about to die.
You win, and it was all worth it.


10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045129713', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567894375}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073149133', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1571544654}
review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS offers a new and fun experience for players, and it has served as a fresh reminder that not every competitive game needs to be team based. I have easely synced 500+ hours into other competitive games such as League of Legends and Overwatch. But I can say that the problem with games like those is that they provide a massive frustration: your teammates. I can never tell if I am improving in those types of games, and though I can often point out a reason for losing in my own play, I can't help but feel as if some of it was out of my control. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS eliminates that struggle, making it easy to see your improvement, and removing frustration in teamplay. Though PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS offers team based play, It is not nearly as frustrating as other games. If someone dies on a squad, they just leave and start a new game. With the inclusion of solo play, when you lose it's nobody's fault but your own. Almost forgot to mention that the gun play is fantastic, not too easy like C.O.D, and not too brutal for newbies like CS:GO. Leaning also adds a surprising layer of depth that I didn't expect it to add. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is, dare I say, "fun". You will not regret this purchase.

I thoroughly enjoy this game. I bought it in October 2017 when it was still in Early Access. I love how the look and feel of the game evolved. Also the new dessert map is epic, although I have yet to get a Chicken Dinner on the new map.

The hackers can be a pain sometimes, but it doesn't make the game less fun. It just amplifies my rage quits.

If you and a couple buddies want to have a little fun while running for your lives in the process, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094921535', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1994, 'last_played': 1575708717}
review:
First 20 hours of gameplay are gonna go like this: you land on top of some houses, loot for 15 minutes, you end up dying in the middle of a field. Then it gets better, next 100 hours are gonna be easier, you start landing on higher risk zones, you get a few kills, you die every single time to a guy with a shotty. After you cross the 300 hours barrier, the only frustration will come from not finding a gun before ths stinking guy that decided to land in the same fkin building as you. You might think playing in a squad with your friends is gonna be better but your friends will fail you and break your spirit time and time again: running you over with your vehicle, shooting you in the face b/c they thought you were the enemy, letting you bleed out next to a tree b/c they are looting a corpse or just driving the car off a cliff into some rocks or through the middle of a highly populated area where a guy with an M249 is hiding next to the street...

BUT GOD DAMN IT IF THIS GAME ISN'T WORTH IT !!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032877212', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567440796}
review:
WELL. GET READY FOR A REVIEW FROM SOMEONE WHO JUST GOT HACK KILLED.

Where do i begin. After playing countless hours through all stages of the game, I have come to bring friends, family and even enemies to play this game. Either for team mates or target practice. I have stood by this game and not judged or said a damn word publically about the horrible state of the game, because for me the fun was worth it, that adrenaline hit when your in the final 10, final 5 and even in the last one on one I have never experienced before to that degree. Oh my god when you win? you feel like your on the top of the world. You JUST KILLED 99 MOTHER****ERS AND CAME OUT ON TOP! Safe to say this game is extremely enjoyable, and deserves its place on the best sellers list and on the lips of every twelve year old who wants mum to buy the next big thing in gaming. I understand how the studio feels, I understand the immense pressure that has been placed upon them when all of a sudden their pet project, glorified half broken mod blew up and became what it is today. Since then the community (including me) have been begging for more content, more this, more that, fix this and fix that. So what have the developers done? Done an EA and put microtransactions for cosmetics (which is like every other bloody game these days so they get a pass for that) they add new guns, new locations, fixed the map, fixed the guns and how they fire, even added a NEW MAP OMFG GUYS. But wait, oh its another map where it can be exploited by those who have an easy time going through the coding and finding ways to exploit the game. BUT GUYS BUY THESE KEYS YOU MIGHT GET A COOOOOOAAAAAT.


This game has lost its focus, what was an incredible experience has now been ruined by hackers, cheaters and the barely held together structure of the game itself. YES I understand that a game this complex with 10,000,000,000 players (over-exaggeration) is not the easiest thing to fix. But for the love of **** the development studio would have made millions upon milllions upon millions of dollars, how hard is it to hire more people, SPECIFICALLY to combat cheaters and another team to target the games optimisation? Hire twenty people for each team to fix this now stale and aggravating experience that I used to crave playing the second I finished a 12 hour day at work. 



[HELD BACK RANT OVER]


It's a good game, if you haven't played it yet, buy it. You might just be paying for the game to be fixed for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342735798', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 20845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569198306}
review:
By the time this goes up I have 216 hours on this game and a lot to say. First off, Pubg is a great game alone or with friends. Play Alone against 100 people, or play with anchor friend in a duo game against fifty teams of two or play squads with two or three more friends in squads with twenty-five teams. The game begins in starting area that you are thrown into with your friends and other players. Then you are thrown into a plane that flys over a map, then the back of the plane opens and then you can jump out or wait to jump, when you jump and pull your parachute the battle royal begins. You have to find a weapon based on your RNG luck, kill other players that landed  with you or you die. Then you repeat the whole process of the start area and then the plane. This is the replayablity part of the game. Each game is different from the last, you can drop so many kills or die at the beginning. This does get tiring after awhile of doing it but it’s how they match make their players into the game. There is a lot more to say but it will take up the whole review. I love the gun play in this game the looting for medical items helmets body armor and backpacks, ammo guns and scopes. The odds
Are really stacked against you in this game. I have won 7 games total. One solo, one squad, and five duos. It is so rewarding to win because it means you were the best out of 99 players or 49 24 teams. In total pubg is the best game of 2017. I love playing it and will continue to play.  This game just came out of early access and the developers have a lot more planed for the future of pubg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090536984', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1539572323}
review: So how about a story...... So a friend and I were playing a duo match recently and we kill another duo at one point. We were shocked to find that on these two players we killed was a fully equipped AUG which we had ammo for and on the other guy was a AWM sniper rifle with a 15X scope on it with full ammo. So, we had two of the best guns in the game fully equipped and only 16 people left. We needed to move closer to the next circle so right after getting these weapons we hop on the motorcycle to move. My friend looks at me and says, you drive, I said no i don't trust myself, you drive. About 10 seconds after leaving on the bike in a completely open field we hit some bump we did not see and flip over and die. I peed myself for about 5 straight minutes laughing so hard because of it. Basically, whether its a good situation gone bad like in this case or whatever the situation its a great game to play with friends. Assuming your friends know how to laugh that is....................Good game solo.........Great game with friends. It has its issues but nothing worth bitching about, pretty sure you can refund any game within 2 hours of playtime in it so if your thinking about getting it go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967738560', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 155353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1516, 'last_played': 1575700297}
review:
Best game I’ve played in years for originality. I know battlerounds isn’t the first game to use the battle royale formula, but it seems I chose the best executor of the concept. When I first bought battlegrounds, I had no expectations. I had around 1,600 hours in CS:GO, and wanted to play an open world survival game. I read that battlegrounds was more of a shooter than a survival game, which, at the time wasn’t what I wanted. I watched a few videos and read a few reviews detailing the mechanics of the game, and thought “eh, this sounds fun and novel enough to spend $30 on.”

600 hours later and I’m finally playing my other games (I stopped playing Witcher 3, Divinity: Original Sin 2, Prey, CSGO). I will probably never play CSGO again as Valve doesn’t take care of their hacker problem, and I played CSGO since the original game’s beta, which I installed from a PC Gamer disc sometime around 2000. With Bluehole enforcing a 1.5 million player ban for cheating since PC 1.0, I’m hopeful that they will manage their community better than valve ever did. 

For the most part I find the community in PUBG to be okay. As a comparison, CSGO was filled with racism, sexism, xenophobia and bigotry. It wasn’t uncommon for people with white supremacist names to be spewing bigotry. I’ve had to team up with a fair number of bigoted players in PUBG, but they are easier to deal with because if I don’t want to play a match with someone, I can back out without a penalty. Also, a nazi thrives on stupid people supporting their bullshit inflammatory statements, so when they don’t have someone backing everything they say and actually have to use reason to argue, their argument falls apart. Or you can just make fun of them for being a nazi: the choice is yours. As far as trolling goes, I’ve encountered that only in random squads. Every so often you end up hitting a squad that has two really intentionally annoying players or someone who wants to drive everyone into another squad to be killed. Duos, people are pretty cooperative because it’s a little awkward to be an aggro asshole when it’s just you and your teammate and nobody else to witness the LOLs. I’ve met a few solid steam friends through duos.

As far as looting goes: the game is pretty shallow here. There is no crafting. It’s a matter of figuring out which guns work for you, finding them, and finding your preferred mods. I’ve won games with very little loot and I’ve lost games level 3d out with suppressors on my AR and sniper rifles. 

But looting isn’t what the game is about really: it’s about teamwork and working with the terrain to gain an advantage over your enemies. Enemies on the hill behing a house getting shot at by guys you don’t see inside of the house? Run up during the firefight and clear the house or wait in ambush for the team to loot the bodies. One thing you learn quick is to not engage everyone you see. You’re here to survive, not get kills. Let your enemies do the work of killing for you, as you have no stake in which team lives and dies in a skirmish. And wounded players are a few bullets less you have to waste.

While you may develop favorite places to drop and find yourself in a regular loot cycle, where the circles force you to move is what keeps the game dynamic. You may start at the same place in two back-to-back games, but be forced to move in opposite directions for each. When the circle gets small, tactical decisions like “should we take the house at the center of the circle or the hill at the edge?” Become a matter of critical importance. “Goddamn it, we should’ve gone dead center to the house while we had the chance” is a pretty commonly used phrase that I cap a failed game with.

Gun mechanics: there are more realistic weapon ballistics than instaclick games like CSGO (sorry to make the comparison, it’s just the shooter I have the most experienc with). Understanding bullet velocity/drop and weapon mobility are all important. What you click isn’t always what you get. This makes the game more challenging in my opinion and I like it. 

I’m annoyed that maximum foliage isn’t a mandatory thing as the game would be so much more interesting if you could hide in the grass. Most players turn it to its mimimum value, so hiding in the grass is useless until the final circles.

Vaulting can be clunky. I’ve vaulted off a 3 story building when I was just trying to jump onto a ledge and landed right down between two enemies I was trying to get the drop on (but not like that) a few times and needless to say, that’s incredibly frustrating. 

Anyway, go buy the game. If you haven’t tried it by the end of 2018, what kind of gamer are you even, sweetie?

author: {'steamid': '76561198148640847', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573798658}
review: Ok so, this game surpassed all my expectations. When I first saw it, I thought it was just a H1Z1 king of the kill clone and didn't want to even take a better look at it but since most of my friends bought it I decided to give it a try and all I can say is that I was amazed by how polished the gameplay and shotting were and because I have a pretty beefy rig I didn't even notice the optimizations problems at first and after the 1.0 release I get around 120 fps+. So good job Bluehole for making an awesome game where I can mess around in solo and do whatever I want but also where I can have a competitive experience with my friends and try to get that chicken dinner ;). And I do have to say that it does get frustrating at times when you die from a camping sniper on a hill or when you die at the start when you couldn't pick up that shotgun faster than that other guy near you. But other than that I really recommend this game to the player that wants "THE ULTIMATE LIFE & DEATH FIGHT" and who doesn't mind having some games where he/she spends 30 minutes looting and then dies to a camper hiding in a bush.

review: This game is crazy and simple at the same time. First turn graphic settings on low, Knowledge of earning points to reset your character, and get ready to die alot. Sounds bad, and first time i played it, I'm thinking what, thats it, you die, watch your death cam, and don't see the end of the game, you don't see who wins wt ... Then I drop again and again and i start to understand it's not about winning it's about how long you survive, how close can I get, till maybe one day that chicken dinner. There are so many skilled players that know the best weapons and more, but even then luck is a factor in every game, and can turn the tide. Recommend playing with friends and solo is a lone wolfs playground.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319349133', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1534573890}
review:
PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS or better known as PUBG is a great game when everything is going right. I still enjoy countless hours of fun and adrenaline pumping fights trying to get 1st place and secure a chicken dinner for the day. From my 170hrs I have not experienced the same type of situation twice when it comes to late game and this just makes me keep coming back and enjoy the game. 

Biggest flaw of the game as of right now has been an influx of hackers which has swayed me to play less and less lately. They ruin the games fundamental purpose of trying to stay alive and win when you don't have a chance to beat them in most circumstances. The other big flaw which from what I have heared is the perfomance and lower end or older PC's and not great, the game does need to be optimized better.

I would still recommend the purchase of this great game

review:
So summary.

I landed on school:
Spotted a bunch of naked kids with shotguns spraying down their enemies like they stole their PS4 and limited edition Minecraft. Killed them, got their stuff, went out of school

Thought to myself "lets hit the road the zone is pretty far away lets go", Proceeded to get in a car and go. found someone similar to Tachanka from R6, He started to spam my car with a DP gun and level 3 helmet. My car just told me fuck off and die. I jumped out, flew to a roof because I'm fucking jesus. Killed Tachanka, Tachanka called my mother a "Babushka fucker" I said "whats wrong?" He replies with yelling in repeat "Stroganoff!" then disconnects

I'm way to far over ground to jump for my healthbar.
I wait for 20 minutes to see if the circle spawns on me. It doesn't. Just misses actually.

I then watch my fucking computer screen as my game freezes, It unfroze a second before a flying dirtbike just hit my head and killed me. 

Great Game lovely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029799157', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 24781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1559499839}
review:
One might say this game lacks content, it lacks optimalization, a progression system and most of all it has a ton of bugs and the overall sense of polish is missing.

But nonetheless this is one of the most fun games youll ever pick up

Every game is unique, the learning curve can appear steep at the beginning but its very easy to learn and the thrill of getting that chicken dinner will keep you hooked for hours upon hours upon hours.

I have personally encountered very few cheaters in my many hours with this game, especially when compared to something like CS:G0 the amount of cheaters here is truly abysmal.

Its really fun and unique, go check it out! Youll enjoy it

review:
Pros:
-Very fun if you're into survival games and/or shooters. 
-Can be however tactical or laid back you want it to be.
-Two maps now.
-Extremely rewarding to win a match.

Cons:
-With the new update, the new map keeps being picked. It's not a 50/50 chance between maps. Kind of a shame but whatever, I imagine/hope this will get balanced eventually.
-Jumping mechanism still iffy, but way better than in EA.
-Heavy on your computer's GPU.

Overall a solid game, would highly recommend.

review: Overall a great game, but it's bad when it comes to matchmaking cause when you try to get into squads all you get are a bunch of Asians who speak a totally different language than english in your North American server. If you can keep people in their own regions of the game it would make it a lot more fun to play with others, but you are constantly stuck with your friends cause you have them or the screaming asians you choose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333094411', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1574517376}
review:
Brilliant, addictive and insanely fun! 
One of my favourite gaming experiences
Definitely a must buy for anybody and everybody.

Just a few cons -
1) needs a lot of optimising as we get better performance in games with higher graphic requirements.
2) improvement in certain mechanics such as shooting into buildings through windows is a little odd as the shots hit the wall in certain cases.
These may not be a problem for many, so there are no other issues. 

Just buy without a second thought and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066265676', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1691, 'last_played': 1575536726}
review:
First: This is my first EVER Review of a game.
Second: I've played this game Every Chance I have, and this is just an All Around Greeat game. I've played all the way throguh the Early Access of this game and even played the Test Servers. This is THE FIRST GAME That has ever went from Early Access to Full Lunch on Steam for me. In the Time line that they set All the way too the completion, and "They are still working on this game" it has been Amazing. This game Like Many other Game Titles that Are or Have become AAA does have it's ups and Downs. 

Let's Start with the Cons... As I like to Start with Bad news then End on a Good Note.
1: It still Lags when you have a Full 100 Man Lobby. This Stops with-in 30 Seconds of Landing...
2: You still Run into Hackers I've ran into About 15 my WHOLE TIME PLAYING (Currently Have 290.4 Hours on Record and this will Grow.) Also what AAA Title Doesn't have hackers? AKA Sore Losers who can't win a single game they Play EVER...
3: Still Has a few bugs but Not Game Braking.
Thats all my complaints.

Now Let's Move onto the Pros.
1: Love the Gun Play, and Gun Sounds.
2: Combat can be Fast and intense (Only Game that Really Gets the Adrenaline pumping for me.)
3: It's Fun as HELL to play this game with Friends and play it Solo as well.
4: The Vehicles in this game (1) Sound Good, (2) Feel Right when Driven, (3) Seam to be Very well Blanced to One Another.
5: The Developers Listen to What 95% of their Community wants. The other 5% Are Either Idiots, Cry Babies, Or Hackers.
6: When The Developers say they are doing something, It gets done, and NOT HALF ASSED!!
7: It's Priced Well...So Well infact That I went out and Bought it for my Xbox One, Yes it's Still $30 there too.
8: IT IS NOT PAY TO WIN THANK FUCKING GOD. It Takes Some Skill to earn a win even if RNG Bites you in the ass.

In conclusion The Mixed reviews are just that: An Opinion Like me, or of someone whom had either an Amazing Experience or a Piss Poor One. I Love this game and Can't wait to see what the Devs come up with Next for this game. Don't just Go off of my Opinion or someone elses to see if you will like this game, We all Know it's a 100 man Battle Royle and you're not going to win all the time every single day of the week. You need to play it and have your own Experience to Truly form an opinion on this game. Now get out there, and Game on!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989988153', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 61579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573695014}
review:
This is a great game, however, you need a pretty high end system to run it without a lot of frustration. Mainly you need 16GB of RAM. I think that is the most important issue. 

i5-7400
GTX 1060 3GB
16GB RAM (Originally I had 8GB and the game ran very poorly on parachute in) It would take 30 seconds or so to load in and by that time people already had guns and half the time I would be dead when I finally unfroze.

With the right setup the game is actually very very good. Best gunplay mechanics of any FPS out there.

review: I bought it well before its release with no one to play with and it was meh and unstable. But, soon my friends got the game and I met people who owned it, and it became more fun. With the recent release of the game, my framrate has jumped about 10% (110ish fps @ 1080p Ultra on GTX 1070ti). If you have friends with this game, buy it. If you love walking for thirty minutes than dying without firing a bullet, buy it. But, if you're going to buy it to play on your own, I would not reccomend it. Good price though at about C$37.

review:
This game.

this ♥♥♥♥ing game.

I'm gonna talk about the story first so if you don't wanna be spoiled or anything like that don't read, but first a generalization of the story:

This games tells one of the most gripping and depressing stories I've ever expirienced in my life. It made me feel really depressed, then really happy, and letting it ferment in my mind just makes me really happy and sad at the same time. I'm on the brink of literal tears writing this review right now lol, it's kind of embarassing. I think this game is a masterpiece, having completing everything but the special ending, which I plan on getting when I have the time, I can safely say that this game is a 100% masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095307011', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 31407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1562169149}
review:
Cool game.

Heart-stopping moments and unctrollable shakes afterwards XD. 
UI is made waaaay better than the early access. 
Still not that expensive considering other top rated games. 

It has a "just 1 more game" feel and I both love and despise that. 
After watching YouTube vids, I always want to jump in and do something crazy like 300m snipes with a crossbow. 
You can play seriously or just for fun with friends. 

Worth the money especially if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038466560', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573171034}
review:
Got an average gaming build from 2013 and I run this game totally fine, I'm aiming for 100+ FPS because I play on a 144hz monitor. You can tweak the settings in the settings menu if your PC is struggling, as with most games. I don't play it every day and I don't expect it to keep me entertained 16 hours of everyday the next 5 years. In PUBG I expect and want a challenging but most of all fun experience to play with friends. I expect there to be bugs and issues in an early access game,  if there wasn't then I would've been suspicious, since that is the reason a game isn't officially released yet. I also expect and accept issues and minor bugs in a released game, I expect new bugs to be introduced along with patches, I understand that a game is an ongoing piece of work and that unless the developers locked in current features forever and only focused on having a bugfree game, it won't be perfect ever.

If you have the same expectations and desires as me then I think you're going to enjoy PUBG in its current state. I've had some great fun so far, every of the 46 hour I've spent so far on this game has been exciting, and if the game died right here then I still would've considered my investment good value. 46 hours of joy for 30 euros is not a bad deal in my eyes, I'd pay 30 euros for just 5 hours of joy, I'd pay 300 euros for an hour of joy if I felt like shit. 

PUBG is a good game, for me it is way up there on the list of awesome games. It is the first of its kind that I truly have enjoyed, and I expect to have a lot more fun coming out of my 30 euro investment, so I am very happy with my purchase. 
I would give it a 10/10 despite the fact that I can find flaws if I really want to, but I don't care about technicalities, I don't care if the game ends up being unstable or laggy for a week, I'll play it next week. I care about being entertained and PUBG has not failed at that yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126979074', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1563728869}
review:
This game is good. I can say this game is good. So, the game is good. Here's the break down.

Pros:

-Very good gun mechanics (ballistics/animations)
-Car mechanics are good (handling/suspension)
-Community is quite something, in a good way
-Maps are very different and diverse for different types of fights
-Being able to squad up with a friend or multiple
-Bugs are a plus when they're funny

Cons:

-Not optimized for lower quality computers, only get if you have met requirements, new 10 series Nvidia cards or new radeon graphics are highly recommended along with kaby/coffee lake or Ryzen processors and at least 8 gigabytes of ram
-Bugs are a plus when they ruin your 20 minute looting spree of cities that no one goes to (I'm talking to you Zharki)
-Could use higher tick servers
-Although most gun mechanics are good, there are some unrealisms that some people are starting to care about. (Winchester not having the bullets move the piece of metal into the tube, primers not being struck after being ejected, The over and under shotgun not moving over the lever when opening the action, some guns attachments aren't very possible (SKS and AK have gas systems that need to be removed in order for a suppresor to be attached, being able to attach sites to a gun made in the late 1800s (Kar98k/DP-28) but not a Winchester, and many more, just tedious things
-Some rubberbanding issues

Overall:

If you have a quality computer and like shooting people and messing around with friends, get this game. Yes, you'll get mad at this game, but it is worth all of the entertainment you will get out of it.
