review: Ok so if you guys are a fans of battle arena this game is the best one there is,but i dont say this game is perfect.The first problem i had was there is no tutorial for a total beginner,this is a little problem for a new player who wanna start to play in this genre.But this problem can be fixed if the developer make a training mod like a shooting range for example.They are still many ingame bugs and glitches and i hope they fix it in the future since this game is allready in launch stage.And the final problem i had was when i entered matchmaking i always seem to get the new map, i dont play this game when it was on early access stage so i dont get to play the old map.I hope they make a setting where you can choose the maps you like instead being forced to play the new one only.Now the problems is out of they way lets talk about the best part of this game.This game offer a very best competitive experience there is.The map was huge there are a lot of diffrent geo to learn like sweetspot,lootspot,save spot and many more,there also have a lot variety of weapons and vehicles to test during the game and thats make this game doesnt feel repetitive all the time.This game graphic really can compete with other triple A games out there,it was very beautiful and a lot of efforts putting in it.Overall i say this game is a very fun game to play weither you play solo or with friends and its definitely worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288394252', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 101957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 395, 'last_played': 1575763767}
review:
After more than 700h combined with the Test servers I can honestly say that the game has his ups and downs. I'll keep it short.
PROS
-Realistic BR gameplay
-Every match feels different
-Long range headshots are super satisfying
-Extremley fun with friends
-The adrenaline You get from winninig and the satisfaction is beyond anything I have ever experienced
CONS
-SOLOS can be a bit boring
-Huge RNG factor if dropping in popular places
-Long waiting time jumping from one game to another
-Match can last up to 40 minutes
-Majority of games on the Miramar map will make You frustrated as You spend 20+ minutes looting and running around without seeing a single person just to get shot in the head from miles away

In conclusion I would resommend the game to anyone who likes BR games and the satisfaction of winning is really something else. Although I don't like the new map I hope the devs find a way to fix it. Early game et get really borring and if they want to keep players playing they need to reduce the map or at least doo something to draw people closer together on the first circle. Choosing the map would be a win for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086140488', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1519079399}
review:
Great Game. 12/24/17
Cons:
Mechanics need to be smoother such as vaulting 
Stop taking damage from parachute malfunctions 
The new map is to large with little cover so it's not as fun as the original 
There's no progression system in this game to hold people closer such as leveling up or gaining new PlayerUnknown unlocks through winning such as T-shirt 1 win, pants 10 wins, coat 25 wins, 50 wins gloves, 100 wins boots, and 250 wins hat/beanie. 
The loot crates today do not really hold my interest for character development today. The loots just a bit dull.
Please continue developing this game into a series everyone will enjoy buying/playing in a few years just COD, Battlefield, and halo use to be for many of us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208372493', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 31069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1566249756}
review:
This is one of the best games you can buy on whichever store u think of.

Fast paced or Sneaky-Beaky , the game has both gameplay styles and shurely sent H1Z1's "skin race" to the graveyard.
Many weapons to choose from, 3 stages of equipment and fabulous weapon customisation benefit all kinds of approach and tactics!

What about fashion? Shure, we have that too. Choose from a large amount of clothes, who are split among 4 crates, which with about 20~30 pieces or more. 

Take the bike and do some sick stunts, get a good old Dacia and ride the road like Mad Max or get a boat and feel the water in your face. Get on a high possition and snipe the plebs, or take a shotgun and destroy your enemies at close range. 

Explore single houses, towns , military buildings , power plants and schools to get all u need to destroy the enemy.
Feeling confident? take a crossbow or a pan and show them how its done. 

Your life, your rules.
This is Battle Royale in its pure form!

author: {'steamid': '76561198111145483', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1560454931}
review:
PUBG, Where do I start.

I've had a lot of fun playing it both alone and with friends.
The gameplay can be very diffrent and you can often choose what kind of game you want to have, If you want to have a lot of action, you drop in a location where you often find enemies (Cities, large complexes etc.) If you are one looking for more of a quiet game then you just try to drop at a more remote location.

The various guns are quite skill based as they have unique spraypatterns and that rewards more experienced players over new ones. Saying this doesn't mean it's impossible to win a game just because someone is better experienced than yourself.

The randomness of the game has two sides. It makes every game a bit diffrent and you can't always play the exact same way. If you find a sniper for example you probably want to get some distance from your enemies when engaging. And if you only find an SMG it's the opposite. This also makes the game a little unbalanced as some won't get barly any loot, and some will be stacked after just a few minutes.

Overall, if you are fan of the BATTLE ROYALE genre this is probably one of the best ones out there right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088109328', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 34401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1574489810}
review:
This is fantastic game, it makes you think, after about 400 hours on the game, I still find new and surprising things, there are still things that I could improve at, with 350 hours on the first map, I can confidently say that there are many places that I haven't been too, many things I haven't tried, and so many things that keep bringing me back to it. Recently, I have seen a large amount of chinese players on the american servers, which is quite frustrating especially considering that many of the cheaters in this game are from china. There are also many bugs that occur when driving, especially on the new map, there are many times my car will get hitched on something that isn't there. There are many hackers ruining the game right now, but from my understanding they just sent out a pretty big ban wave, which is nice to see.

Overall, this game has many fantastic experiences and moments that I'll remember for a long time, I recommend this to everyone that has a decent computer (the experience is not great on a low grade desktop.) The few things I'd like to see happen to this game is that they continue to support it; add more content; and build upon it, they region lock china specifically, and they continue to optimize and fix the game's bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045286089', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 15889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1523657433}
review:
Happy to see them leaving EA and launching.

Really great game that has come a long way.
Devs have made some mistakes in the process, but overall they have been active, responsive, and dedicated to making the game great.

Though they do need to imporve on Anti-cheat, improved hitboxes, and some other bullshit (problems shooting through fences, out windows, inability to wall bang certain objects, some random exploits) that ruins the competitiveness of the game. In its current state, I do not believe it is Esport ready. Because I do not find it to be as competitive, I do not play it as much anymore, or take it seriously for that matter, but it remains a fun game to play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160623937', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1560844861}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198269474493', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1534968838}
review: PUBG is a 100 player free for all until the last man (or team) is left alive. This game offers a wide variety of places to land and weapons to loot this game is an amazing addition to the Battle Royale genre. Unlike H1Z1 this game is worked on and not just given small new features. If anyone was wanting to get into play Battle Royale games I would without a doubt tell them to get this one. About the price $30 seems reasonable because of all the features and high player count, so finding a match will take no more than 3 seconds on anyday. The only thing i dislike about this game is the huge system requirements i get around 30-60fps (with low settings) and a majority of my other games i get 150+. Overall however this game is good and now that it is coming out of "Early Access" that means this game has been worked on very hard to become a full game and everyone who dislikes this game should try it one more time with it being out of early access. For me: 9.5/10

review:
I have played many games over the years but this one is just remarkable, so addictive game, there are issues I know that but I guess that is why its called an early access game. The game is a perfect entertainment and playing with squads specially adds more fun.

-----

Completed 1000 hours today, still addicted to this game, the game has improved alot since the beta release but still pisses me off sometimes due to desync and hit registration issues.


------

27 Oct 2019


after 1500 hours of fun and entertainment, Today is the day I am finally done with this game, thank you the developers for such a great entertainment, its been very good 2 years with pubg, you tried your best, I dont have complain of anything except the fact that you are doing nothing for this game, and it feels bad for me to see this game is dying, I hope that day never comes. I would still recommend this game to anyone who wants to play. GG Boys........

review: Player Unknown Battlegrounds is a fun experience with friends. However, with a mid ranged gaming laptop, this game runs poorly. At lowest settings I get 60fps, which makes the game playable but it should be able to run MUCH better. Recent patches have helped this and the test server has better fps. New map is too large, with too slow tempo. You find people at the beginning of the game and almost always have no action until top 20. There is enough variation in gameplay to keep you entertained for hours. Although some glitches may be frustrating, many allow for some good laughs.

review:
[b]+Pros after initial release in comparison to early access [/b]
-No more clay buildings
-Better Performance
-Less collidion glitch/bug in-game
-Improvement in graphics
-Better lobby design and music
-More contents

[b]-Negatives after initial release [/b]
-Some of the buildings in Miranmar had a lot of weird pixel walking capabilities
-Server can't handle 2,3+ Million people playing the game
-It's a pain in the ass to invite people into a squad , half of the time they are busy or showing up as offline in-lobby
-Heavily traffic-ed servers cause lagging during gameplay 

>I hope to see improvement in the future bluehole! 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056687545', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 117, 'last_played': 1575702418}
review: PUBG is a game that pretty much broke gaming this spring and summer. I was among the people who enjoyed this, and I quite frankly only played this during the entire summer. But I noticed that it slowly became boring. Nothing new was happening. Sure, they'd add a new gun once in a while, but it would usually be put in the crates, so it isn't like you'd even really use it that much. They didn't add anything really from August to now. Granted the new map is coming out, along with its new weapons, but I think that the damage may have already been done. Playerunknown's Battelgrounds has become stale. It's as simple as that. People are sick of the repetative mechanics, lack of content, not to mention the optimization problems everyones been crying about for months and they evidently can care less. PUBG had its hayday, but it is going to decline. I was surprised to see it still at the top of the most popular game tab, but I wouldn't be surprised to see it slowly decrease down that list. For new players, I definitely reccomend. It is a lot of fun, but don't main it as a game. Play it once in a while and it'll last so much longer.

review:
* Start game
* Que Solo Match
* Spawn In
* Jump In highly populatyed Areas (Military Base, School, Prison etc....
* Kill One Or More Person
* Die When There Are 10 People Left Becuase Some ****** Backstabs You With a Shotgun Or Smg
* Receive Around 170 Battlecoins (Depends On Kills)
* Repeat Around 5-6 Times
* When You have Enough Coins Collect Battlepack
* Open Battlepack And Receive An Baseball Cap Worth 0,03€
* Sell On Steam Market
* Repeat Around 1000 Times And You Will Go Profit!

10/10 Can't Wait To Make Some More Easy Earned Cash

author: {'steamid': '76561197975415273', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569782291}
review:
The best Battle Royale game as of today.
It is poorly optimized, but they have really made improvements overall and it feels like they are working continuously to improve the game further.

I think, unlike many others, that the release of the new desertmap Miramar will be great for the PUBG community so we all have something to enjoy while they are working further towards the smoothest experience possible.

I do think however that the game runs pretty smoothly on a decent computer. Make sure you have your grapichs-drivers up to date as this reduces microlags tremendously.

Nevertheless it's equal for every player. The game is loads of fun to play teamed up with your buddies, raiding buildings, jumping off cliffs with vehicles, charging towards the latest airdrop.

It's a great experience, well worthy of the its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406228333', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1526186034}
review:
Get ready to suck at a game like no other
this game is absolutely,brutally honest in a way that is fun
40% of gameplay is being shot at by a sniper from go knows where
The rest= running and scraping a handful of kills together.
The concept and controls are well constructed, optimisations is okay 
And combat feels smooth. Although custom keybindings are recommended
 Beyond what other salty players would persist, this game is great, little to no bugs other than the cars occasionally flipping and spazzing, this game brings new and exciting ways to die and or succeed in combat that is Adrenalin inducing TO THE MAX!!!!!
Outfits and character customisation is quirky and the best aspect is the ability to make decent amounts of money off this game marketing crates for dough on the steam market.

If FPS non canonical pvp games are your whiz. I highly recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198215382525', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 16618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564996237}
review:
This anime visual novel was one of the best I've ever played. It had one of the most compelling stories I have ever experienced. The anime girls were well fleshed out characters, that I really cared about. You may be wondering why I have over 100 hours of gameplay in this game. Simple answer is because of the beautiful, plump, juicy, tender anime tiddies in this game. This game is actually not a thrid person battle royale shooter, it is actually a compelling romance visual novel that will completely blow you away, you will be playing this for countless amount of decades like me. I've been playing since the year 1943 where I was in afghanistan on the front lines fighting against the murderous psychotic nazis. But this game has saved me from all the horrifying experiences I have ever had, on the front lines of WWII. This game has stuck with me till now, my wife who is actually a body pillow loves this game. I do not like real women, because they do not understand me like body pillows do. Me and my wife sakura chan played this game for countless hours on end , because we can relate so much to the main character and his shocking past where *SPOILERS* His mum and dad both died from a terrorists attack where they were taking a holiday in russia *SPOILERS* I could relate to this because my parents got gassed by the Nazis, and Sakura chan had her parents killed by a terrorist suicide bomber in a basement of a hentai store in Japan, where I found sakura chan when she was buried in the rubble and aftermath of the bombing. I got her out of there and have been caring for her ever since. Many tears have fallen from our eyes because of this game. Few years later we married, because of this game we have bonded so much and fallen completely in love with each other. The characters in this game made us so heart wrenchingly sad, because me and my wife connected so much to them. There are approximately 25 endings to this game all with different out comes on all of them. This game is very detailed and well made and it has made me a WWII veteran, and full grown man shed tears everytime I played. please do check out this game as it is a masterpiece and has connected with me on a very personal level.

Jebediah, the WWII Veteran.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025422010', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1557614563}
review:
Let's all be real, no one is being extremely xenophobic. The issue is that this game requires communication, you cannot play with a team that speaks a completely different language than you. Is it okay every now and again? Of course! But every damn match where North American English servers are completely, and I do mean completely, filled with Chinese players is just ruining it for everyone. Chinese players can't understand half the American Enlgish speaking players and vice versa, no one has a good time in the end. 

Do not get me started on latency, I have shot and watched these people walk through building - disappear - take 10000 bullets - lag out - etc.

We get it, you don't want a huge media disaster, "PUBG VIDEO GAME CREATOR HATES CHINESE PEOPLE!". 

Let me tell you this, a step by step guide on how to not lose all your playerbase as NA is not the only victim, check out EU too.

1) Stop being a cuck, it's not racist to try and balance a game based on language compatability.
2) Add some sort of region locking system, yes it can specifically be for the Chinese as they have 10x the amount of players.
3) Do it FAST.

I have had over 30 friends switch to games like Fortnite and even, dare I say, H1Z1. SOLELY so they can communicate with other English speakers.

You are fucking up your game, you are fucking up your fans, you are fucking up the future of video game politics.



If it wasn't for us, the players, you would still be PLAYERUNKOWN and not a big time hot shot. Fix it before you lose what you've worked so hard for.

#REGIONLOCKCHINA

author: {'steamid': '76561198418522311', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569723991}
review:
[h1]Not as Good as I expected it to be[/h1]

[h1]Pros[/h1]

I do like the bare concept of the game. 100 people drop into a map scattered with gear and the name of the game is find gear and eliminate all the other players until there is only 1 remaining. The "Winner Winner Chicken Dinner" at the end of a game is also pretty nice. The game is quite good visually. I run a GTX 1050 on a Dell Inspiron 7000 and have no issues with the games sounds or graphics. The UI is quite easy to navigate too. The weapons are realistic and gun damage is pretty consistant to each particular weapon. Bullet drop adds an extra factor into shooting as you cannot shoot someone from 500m away just by aiming at them unless you change your zeroing distance. The game is also great for people to spectate too. Twitch streamers have blown up with popularity while playing this game. Not to mention the E-Sports community that is building in popularity too.

[h1]Cons[/h1]

After playing over 100 hours of PUBG, I can say that from a technical standpoint, this game needs alot of work on the back end.  Server stutter is a real big problem. You get behind a tree, you've been there for at least half of a second and then you pop back out from behind the tree because the server didn't catch up. Not to mention the irritation of not being able to use voice chat because chinese players leave an "open mic" on all the time and all you hear is the background noise from their gaming cafe they are in. Like 250 voice all yelling at once in a foriegn language is rather annoying, so I reccomend just muting the "All" voice chat all together. Another BIG issue they seem to have is with hackers. Alot of American players are calling for a "Region Lock" of the chinese players to keep them in their own servers, and I can't say that I blame them. I'm still not sure why they decided to allow players to play on other countries servers. It isn't good for connection quality and not knowing the language just makes for a bad play environment. The hackers jump from region to region for reasons I do not know, but I do know that PUBG does not seem to take this issue as seriously as it's playerbase.

[quote=Brendan "PlayerUnknown" Greene]Yes, the majority of cheats come out of China, but that doesn’t mean all Chinese players are cheaters. This idea that just because you’ve got a few bad eggs, you’ve gotta ban a whole country is a bit reactive.[/quote]

No one is claiming that ALL chinese players are cheater but, from my expirience, of the chinese players that are not cheating, they are screaming in broken english about how america should die, and that how "China Number One". 

Another issue I have with the game is that you cannot add people to your steam friends list after playing a random que duo/squad game. If I meet someone, and they are a decent person and a good player, I'd like to add them to my friends list, but I can't within the game. I have to ask them for their steam ID, tab out (which often crashes the game all together) and open steam to add them. It's rather more complicated than it needs to be. 




[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

PUBG is a visually stunning game that still has quite a few issues to resolve if it wants to stay at the pinnacle of steams Battle Royal charts. With free games like Fortnite allowing players a better expirience for free, I'd say the only thing keeping players to PUBG is it's realisting look and strategy. If PUBG could fix the issues I've seen and heard about, they could be a real contender to be at the top for a long long time. I don't see how a company worth BILLIONS, with a B, can still be facing these kinds of issues when there are games out there that are far less valuable in terms of how much money they make and how many people they have working for them making games with a better expirience on the technical end and clearly listen to what their players want. Just seems like Bad Form. All in all as of now, I'd give the game a 6/10 and would recommend it to people who would sacrifice overall expirience for visual realism.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304089817', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 106507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2383, 'last_played': 1575769142}
review:
A letter from a Chinese PUBG player

Hello ya'll! At the time of The Steam Awards 2018 Nomination, I wish my comment can have some little effect to make PUBG greater!

As for me, some fixable problems exist in the current environment, and solution could be simple: 
 
1. Take action against the sale of cheating program, cut the problem from its source.
2. Fix Bugs and Physics to guarantee user experience.
3. Keep improving gameplay. Release something fun for gamers and make Esports matches better balanced.

At last, Mr. Bluehole, it's not all Chinese users' fault like global fans complained. 

You know exactly what was going on, right?  

So please make effort before it is too late.

review:
The game has had its ups and downs. There is no denying that. After the "FIX PUBG" Project, I feel that the game has gotten x100 better. I have no had any issues since returning. The servers seem a ton better, input lag isn't there, bullets actually hitting and going where you are placing them. 

Also, I really like the addition of cosmetics they have added that have allowed us to support our favorite esports teams or our favorite streamers. 

I am just not having issues that others are seeming to have. I have enjoyed the game since coming back a little bit ago. The most recent update seems to have done some wonders too.

review: You know I have a mixed feelings with this game.I have played this game for over 100 hours and have had a hell of a lot of fun playing it with my friends. But this game does have problems that are going to need fixing if they intend to keep this game afloat. Server issues and hackers are the two larget problems that I have come into contact with. For a while my firend wouldnt be able to see for the first minute of the match and it made the experience much less enjoyable. I haven't ecountered many hackers but when they come up they are very annoying and angering. But I do like the direction the game is going in with the new gamemodes, updates, and maps. Overall this is a game that I would recommend but buyer beware as there are problems that you should think abiut before you buy the game.

review:
Really fun multiplayer game, the best game I've played so far in 2018.

I haven't encountered that many bugs at all and I think performance is great on my older system, though I'm sure it could always be better optimized. Only thing I can complain about really is the earned credits in game only go towards customizing your physical character and nothing else, it would be cool if they could unlock stuff or something else.

24 hours in and it's still just as fun when I first bought it. Highly recommend if you have friends to play with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066033808', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 283502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 151, 'last_played': 1574998037}
review:
TL:DR VERSION - Great game. The only reason not to purchase and play at least 100 hrs. is if you really hate the Chinese language or the Chinese people.

Although classified as a survival game, this experience could also be considered a looting game with really beautiful scenery and peaceful, calming sounds of nature. The RNG of loot really makes each game unique, and there could always be some sweet new loot behind each door. There must be thousands of rooms in each instance of PUBG and each one is its own little treasure chest to be discovered. Loot is everywhere on these huge 30 square-kilometre maps, just sometimes not the right loot you are looking for.

Ultimately, each looting session must give way to the barbaric shoot-outs and desperate ambushes as the map randomly shrinks in and damages everyone outside of the circle. At this point, it becomes absolutely necessary to have good gun handling skills and also the tactical awareness to know whether to hide, run or gun. The semi-realism with ballistics and damage is refreshing and makes for some of the most intense PVP experiences that I have personally felt since playing Diablo II in Hardcore mode. Intense. I'm talking 130 beats per second pulse, sweating hands and actually forgetting to breathe kind of intense.

Life is precious in PUBG, and that makes kills feel more like murder. But getting the skills to get the kills can be a real challenge.

For the first 100 games I had a jpeg image of the keybinds on my second monitor, just to be able to get the hang of the controls. It's very much the same control system as SQUAD (Project Reality) but somewhat easy to forget in the sudden gun fights that happen. After finally getting the basics down I started doing solo speed matches dropping into the heavy zones such as the Arena in Pecado, Prison, or La Hacienda. These are bloodbaths that rarely last long for me but great for gaining combat experience.

Wait times in-between games can be very quick, which is a good thing unless you are trying to get in a quick bio-break. Queue times are non-existent - there are many, many people playing at all hours. It's basically 45 seconds and you are flying into the zone. Dying can be very frustrating but at least it takes no time at all to get onto the next match and the search for fresh new loot and sweet gear combinations begins again.

There are a few horrible things about this game, let's be real.
1. Although 1.5 million accounts have been banned and more cheaters are caught every day - because it is a client-based system it will always be susceptible to the shady, shady dudes who are savy enough to code their own exploits. There is a reporting feature that apparently works. After 200 games I have detected at least 10 separate instances of  someone absolutely cheating. I'm talking about 100% for sure cheats with headshot kills through a house from a very far distance and another guy who snap shotted me without a scope from 300 metres even though trees were covering me on the kill-cam. Frustrating but mostly quite rare.
2. If you are trying to play in Duo or Squad to play with teammates during certain hours you will most certainly have Chinese speaking partners who probably do not know many English words. I personally feel it's a really cool cultural exchange and I'm doing my best to learn a few Chinese words but it is not ideal. Why so many Chinese players are on the North American servers may be one or two reasons. They may be abusing the netcoding because it favours high-latency players or they may be farming items which have real world value to sell on Steam - either way, many players see this as a negative gaming experience and are demanding region-lock. I personally feel that fixing the way the netcode deals with high-latency players would address the root problem.
3. I have often queued for a squad game yet I enter the match alone. [/violin sadly plays]. Not sure if my teammates are dropping queue or if I'm just being put in solo-squad to fill out the server numbers.
4. You have to have a beefy gaming-rig to handle the CPU/GPU crunch when dropping into a congested zone. Even the beastiest of PC's can have a hard time and experience some chuggington as soon as the parachute is cut and you hit the dirt.

That's the worst of it. I've made a few Chinese friends on Steam and have had some great platoons so if you are friendly to the Chinese they are almost always friendly back. Only in one game did I have a team of Chinese squaddies who I felt killed me just for speaking English. Remember, the only North American languages are ones like Navajo, Cayuga or Mohawk - English and Spanish comes from England and Spain so easy with the Xenophobia bros.

Holding down alt and having a free look option is a small detail that puts us one step closer to Virtual Reality as an entry point. Driving vehicles is a very entertaining mini-game. Graphics are very nice and seem next-gen to these ol' eyeballs. I think more updates could improve the sound. For example, no matter what surface you are breaking on, some vehicles make a rubber screeching sound, even on dirt. URRRRRKKSSSS - right on the grass. 

PLAYERUNKNOWN's BATTLEGROUNDS is a very special game that has me excited as I was the first time I tried World of Warcraft and has awakened my imagination once again.

review:
Love the game but hate the hacks... CAn you all start blocking MAC addresses like blizzard? 3millions sales wiht 1.5 million bans really means you've got like a solid 700k maybe of legit players rn lol The rest are recurring users of cheats and the services that insure they get a new account when the old one finally gets banned. Putting that person right back in the mix willy nilly. But if you monitored MAC addresses and the computers activation keys to your cache of banned suspects it would really put the hackers out of the game for good unless they felt like dropping a few hundred to change any all of those. with the ISP gateway IP still being marked as well.

Also it feels like one of your latest few updates has significantlly bogged down my performance in game from 240fps in lobby and 120-140 in game to basically being locked in at 60 no matter what. Which seems like maybe a pre release kinda thing to try out. Or if it is a frame cap, add a way to turn that cap off? But hey idk, I'm no dev, just a lowley player unknown.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032487314', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 255, 'last_played': 1575259839}
review:
[h1]Summary:[/h1] PUBG is an amazing game that keeps getting better. With each update comes something new that enhances the game and makes gameplay increasingly more fluid. The guns are all pretty much balanced (there could be some tweaks here and there). The RNG in the game either is heavily in your favor or heavily against you such as when you drop in a town with your friends only to find micro-useless's and P92's, or if you have to play marathon-runner to get to the circle (THIS IS A YUUUGE PROBLEM WITH THE NEW MAP!!!). Vehicles are mostly realistic and have truly come a long way since just this past summer when i started. Overall rating 7/10, but unless you are really picky or you are really bad at the game you won't realize it is anything below 10/10.

[h1]The BIG issues:[/h1] This game is riddled with hackers, specifically from asian countries. These guys join the lobby and instantly start shouting "CHINA NUMBER 1" or some similar chant but with a different country, that is basically a key indication that you have some hackers in the lobby. Good thing is that you can usually beat them if you out flank them and don't expose yourself. Most of these hackers can either shoot through walls with hip fire, instant head shot, destroy gear with single shot, use super speed, instant death by grenade without cooking, or fly. I haven't seen the ones that fly, or the ones that run as fast as a vehicle in a couple months. It is very easy to identify hackers now that we have the replay feature, so if you think someone is hacking you can record the clip and report the player. I think there is an option for further reporting that you can use the video clip of on the player unkown website. Hackers only really ruin 9 out of 10 games, the one game they don't ruin is because they messed up and got out played or the circle killed them. When I first started this game my buddies and I could win a couple games in a row or at least play more than 5 minutes without getting killed by a hacker. Now it seems you get into a game and as soon as you land you'll die from a pistol head shot through a wall from a guy half way across the city hip firing. 

[h1]THE FIX:[/h1] Region lock countries and it will fix most hacking issues for North American players. Most of us just want to play the game with our friends, act like badasses, or just troll. Most of us our sick of playing with people from another country who yell "F*** America, America number 0, China number 1" while hacking to kill us effortlessly and then t-bagging our dead bodies. This is what needs to be done if an anti-cheat system can't be enabled that solves until there is a solution that solves the problem.

[h1]FUTURE SUGGESTIONS[/H1]

To end this I would like to suggest that in the future there be a feature for purchasing/renting, or self hosting servers. I think it would be a great addition to the game especially for those in it for the e-sport aspects of the game. This would open up a lot more local tournaments. Also, please consider adding different options for each map such as larger teams, and more players on specific maps. The new map definitely could be a 200 person map. 

Another suggestion before I wrap this up, please add a map that is smaller but made only of cities.

[h1]2019 Edit[/h1]

Game is still riddled with hackers, some new and good things have come along since my initial review. Definitely a fun game to play but you won't avoid any issues and 1/5 of your matches will still be frustrating. Game also still crashes on Ryzen systems with only temporary user fixes in place at this time.

review: While I will say that this game is better than fortnite, personally I hate it. I hate the whole battle royal gamemode. I have gotten my share of chicken dinners by myself and with a team. But more often than not, I get killed for what usually seems like BS to me. I spend about 30 mins in a match...of that, I spend half of it trying to find everything I want, 40% of that time is running, and the other 10% is spent hiding in the circle hoping you see the other guy before he sees you. The reward system in this game sucks and makes you feel like you are playing for nothing if you are not #1. If I only get one life in a game, I dont wanna spend the whole thing trying to get a decent loadout, only to lose it all before I can even get a shot out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198856100138', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'last_played': 1575007953}
review:
I am a big fan of battle royal games and this game is worth 30 bucks. Yes there are cheaters, and yes the game can be unfair at times, but its just a game. If you are a big "camper" in battle royal games, then you will get smashed a lot. If you are playing on a semi outdated computer system, it may seem like there are a lot of cheaters because you will experience lagging and a lot more desync which will get you killed. most people that play these games seriously are running very hi tech consoles or pc's, giving them waaaay smoother frames. out of the 6 months i have played (mostly on xbox) i have maybe encountered 3 or 4 hackers that i could actually tell were hackers. 
To Sum it up..... If you like shooter games, play it, but keep in mind that some people have 100's and even 1000's of hours in this game so it isnt going to be all that easy.

review: PUBG is a legendary game.  Anyone who is still giving this game negative recent reviews is likely not very good at the game, plain and simple.  PUBG requires skill to be consistently good and the average player can routinely become frustrated.  Its just the nature of the game.  For anyone looking at reviews thats still debating on giving this game a chance, give it a chance and you may get hooked.  This game will keep you on the edge of your seat and you can play whatever play style you choose, whether aggressive or passive.  Also take note that when looking at reviews, disregard the reviews of players with a low play time, they probably arent very good and are biased for that reason alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019721831', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 35490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 63, 'last_played': 1575150764}
review:
I don't know what people are on about. Either you're good at the game or you suck and need to grind in a lot of hours before you become good. This game focusses on realism which is why it's more unstable than Fortnite which is a little kids game. Yes PUBG has bugs, yes PUBG is more unstable but the game is being worked on and is a good game already!

Stop with your excuses of getting killed by a cheater cause the chances of that happening are very slim to none, some people are just very good at the game (Watch Shroud on Twitch). Also the better your computer, the better you will be, I play on a Laptop and that does definitely affect my performance! But even though I play on a laptop I have already been in the top 4% of the world and currently after the update in top 40% and rising quickly.

Stop with your excuses, play the game, grind it and you will become good at it, even if you only have a mid-range laptop like I do.

review:
Okay, the game was lot better in early access. The devs are taking lot of time to fix these minor bugs. I know they're trying their best (or maybe not?) but these bugs are getting worse. I stopped playing the game as there are many bugs and less features. I heard that the people aren't even able to select servers now. You will be forced to play in a server where you might get 200 ping, you won't be able to pickup any survival items on time.
*
I would still recommend this game to those who are up for casual gaming and not serious gaming. Serious gamers will probably rage when they face these minor bugs and ping issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079458671', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 10564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1561884703}
review:
The game is in a much better state now than it was on release i.e. not as much of a Chinese BP farmland so credits to Bluehole for that. They seem to have fixed many issues such as bikes getting stuck on grills, cars flying off, and janky parachute to ground transition to state a few and the new Sanhok map finally speeds up the gameplay. Even then, PUBG remains unpolished when compared to a game like Fortnite which is a free title. It still suffers from laggy servers and significant fps drops during gameplay, for example, when you throw a smoke grenade or get caught up in a firefight.

Now the sad stuff. First, the addition of locked crates require you to get a $2.5 key to open what is most likely a half cent cosmetic item. Second, a new event pass thing pulled straight off Fortnite but actually costs a lot more. What's next? In game advertisements for real world products?

While PUBG continues to be fun and tense, it still drags along a handful of performance issues from its early access days. Implementing multiple anti-cheat solutions, banning, and doubling crate costs per purchase may reduce the incentive to cheat, but it's still there. Buy this only if you like what you see or have played or if it's on a good sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997582533', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 114908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1555236516}
review:
After playin PUBG for a while and enjoying every second of it I have 2 things to say.

Thanks for the fun associated with burning my gpu and becoming so competitive I barely have friends left.

PUBG is the best thing that could’ve happened to us in a loooong time  so next time before u talk smack think and ask urself... “If I really hate this game and am tired of bad devs, why do I even bother crying?”  

And you whiny entitled cucks should stop complaining about the game not being perfect... Look at what ur getting from a team of ppl that went all in to bring you the game you loved but didn’t really think through that UE4 was never built to have 100 ppl running across a different maps filled with weapons and everything just for your gaming pleasure, the game will never run like cs go or league, so you cucks who think complaining about fps will solve something think again, if ur game doesn’t run well it’s your problem and not theirs... They’ll optimize the game but it’ll never be running like butter unless they change engines. 

Bluehole is doing as much as they can even though you guys fail to realize building and working on pieces of codes that make a game played by millions of players a day is definitely not an easy task and you whining will not help. Support the devs and stop being so negative, we don’t want our game to end up in the gutter just like csgo and many other games did.

review:
Glitchy, buggy, yes. Fun, exciting, interesting every time you play, yes.

You know what you're getting with this game. It will run worse than you hope it will. You will die and lose a lot. But some day you will get a chicken dinner and it will all be worth it.

One of the most satisfying games I have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078053027', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 33452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572087787}
review: If you look past the hackers that take advantage of this game, it's a great tactical survivor game that forces you to crawl your way up the ladder to be the best in a game against 99 other adversaries. Sad that the anti-cheat system is not as effective as other games. Hopefully, this will improve in the near future. I recommend this game if you have a bunch of friends to play with, or you are good with recoil management.

review: I have recently got this game and while having mixed reviews not only in the past but recently too i think this game is truely a game worth getting. Without a doubt this game has many, many bugs, and sometimes lag can be unbearable, but this game is very very new so you go to give it some room to update. It just had its official release a few days prior to this reveiw, it has introduced and large margin of new and exciting new things, such as; new weaponary, a parkour system, a brand new Desert map, ect. This game gets better and better everytime i play it, it has reached a state that not too many games can rival with, i truely believe that with hardwork from the devs this game can be a masterpeice but until then, ITS STILL FUCKING AWESOME AND YOU SHOULD MOST DEFINITLY CONSIDER PURCHASING IT.

review:
There are obviously bugs and cheaters (here's to you, China), but the game is still enjoyable.  Scenery is nice looking, gameplay on its own is great.  The mechanics are great and I love that the game is always being updated and the producer (usually) listens to the players on what should be implemented.

Unfortunately, a lot of people love to hate this game.  Albeit it's not perfect yet, with optimization patches required, it's still a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271924336', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570367758}
review:
Despite all the negative reviews i saw on this game, i decided to buy it and try it first hand. The game is very addictive and it's NOT as bad as some people are making it out to be. there are a few times when you get in server with chinese hackers, but there are normally 90-100ppl on the map. You can still go around and kill the few or wait patiently inside the zone to ambush a passer by. 

I myself ABSOLUTELY love this game! It's very fun and fast paced. With only 10hrs in I still am learning the gameplay and techniques on aiming and where to get best loot.
My advice for anyone that loves CS:GO or FPS/TPP you gotta try this game out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971206361', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 78685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 563, 'last_played': 1575785640}
review:
1000 hours, what can I say? I love it. I hate it. It's insane. It's one of the most adrenaline inducing games I've ever played. It's had me hooked for years now. I think I've developed high blood pressure, thanks to this game.

It's not perfect. I wish they would rebuild the game from the ground up, the spaghetti code is transparent as hell. It still doesn't run very well, even after all the attempts to fix it. I doubt it will ever have the precision of polished games like CSGO. If it did, I'd probably play nothing else.

Also, please add US West servers. Minimum of 80ms ping in California.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962101857', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1533116365}
review:
I have never really gotten into competitive shooters before this game, but for some reason the gameplay of PUBG grabbed me. I think it has to do with the fact that you can approach the game any way you like: Go in guns blazing, hide in some unpopulated spot, or just have fun trying to run people over in cars. 

The game isn't super easy to learn, but you will notice yourself getting better over time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001390302', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1530758039}
review:
It's like rainbox sixs realistic mode splayed out onto a multiplayer 100 person giant island. There's always a story happening somewhere on the map, and if you play your cards right you will get to live these stories, with the added bonus of getting a head shot or surprising an unsuspecting competetor.

I never thought I would love an online shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204096789', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 77, 'last_played': 1575203566}
review:
Aside from the lag and slightly more than average amount of hackers, this is a pretty good game, the gunplay imo is great, and 4 huge maps offer amazing replayability. The relatively large arsenal of pistols, shotguns, sub-machine guns, assault rifles, designated marksman rifles, sniper rifles and a [b]FREAKING CROSSBOW[/b] means that you can take out your enemies (or get taken out) in a different manner every time, adding in a selection of attachments including suppressors, extended magazines, and different scopes, you can customize your guns to suit your own play style, whether it's charging into the enemy and spraying them with an UZI or be a "snake" and crawl everywhere.

tl;dr
fortnite gay

author: {'steamid': '76561198068986710', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567572808}
review:
Having played since waaaaaaaaaaaaaay before release, i must say, this game has really improved from back then, being a more complete and fun experience.
NOW, if i must start to count since the final release, then, this game isn't really doing much to improve itself.
Having only 2 maps, the good russian one we all know and love and the half-assed new sand map which came out as the 'main map' for the final release, a solid gameplay, nice graphics and sounds, and a really good king of the hill experience, PUBG starts off as a great game, but it gets boring the more you play it, once you know the maps, develop a smart gameplay approach, won enough times, and if you're like me, don't really care much about customization, which seem to be one of the big points since release, with players grinding points to sell the loot boxes, then you'll be eventually tired of this game.
It's not a bad game, hell, is a really fun one, i still find myself having a blast with it, from time to time, but it's not a 'main game' or something i would find myself playing everyday.
Gameplay-wise it still reminds me of ARMA/Battlefield, with an inventory management system and loot, sweet, sweet loot, added to it.
Playing with your friends can really enhance the experience, unless your friends are 'lone-wolf' wanna-be assholes who always die first, alone, and bitch & try to tell you how to play for the rest of the game.
PUBG is a great game, and i still hope it will continue being the king of the king of the hills, if the devs bring fresh and new twists to it.

review:
I'm bad at this game, but this was fun.

This is my first battle royale shooter, and I have to say I'm enjoying it so far. I love that feeling of adrenaline when you're in a shootout. Customization is also pretty good. Once the things of the test server come to the main game, I'll love it even more. My only concerns are the frame rates (probably due to bad optimization) and the servers (I heard it was 17 tick?). Other than that, this is a fun game that should be played with friends. I can't wait to see the future for this,

author: {'steamid': '76561198343747860', 'num_games_owned': 2, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1248, 'last_played': 1575727029}
review:
I have played over 500 hours on this game since late november 2017 whilst holding down a full time job and supporting a family. All i can say is well done to the creators because i cannot stop playing this game lol...very addictive indeed. I have made some good friends through playing the game.

A couple of down points are as follows:-

New map is far to open and uneven.
The loot seems to have got alot worse.
The VW wagon is pointless.
Not being able to choose which map we want to play. 
We should be able to purchase keys for the crates with BP points even if its a large amount (not everyone wants to spend money on buying these things).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970935961', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 26712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1554638942}
review:
I nominated this game in the steam awards this year in the better with friends category, because that's where the game shines for me the most.

Whether playing seriously or casually, this game is great when played with other people; making plans, reacting to emergencies or just having a laugh: PUBG is great for this.

There is plenty else to say about the game, but let's leave it there for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321983001', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 98144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 220, 'last_played': 1575193591}
review:
To all who give a damn.......

PUBG is a great game, mostly, as long as you dont live in Australia...... if you do live in Australia however, PUBG corp has given all of us the middle finger here in the great Down Under, there are no servers and no support for PUBG players here, and when there is a server up and running theres a time limit on when you can play, (max a few hours in the afternoon),  it is also restricted to 3rd person squad and Solo squad modes. No 1st person option available (my preference) which is highly dissapointing

PUBG has displayed utter disregard for their community of regular players here in Australia, and i assure all of you that there are plenty of us here in Australiua who enjoy PUBG as their "Go to" Battle Royale title. i have put in nearly 900 hours into this game and love it to bits, but as of now I have NO faith in PUBG corp to sort out their title for us here in Australia. The ridiculous high ping to US servers is unacceptable, constantly hitting upwards of 250, ruining the game experience for everyoone

Truly dissappointed in the developer for their lack of giving a crap about their player base here. I hope they fix this simple problem.... bring back the servers in Australia 24-7.

TBH PUBG is a game worth playing, I love it and i do recommend it to evryone who likes BR, unless you live here in Aus.

ill see you on Vikendi (hopefully)

cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198282108255', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1556722028}
review:
PUBG, First time playing as a noob.

-Drops down
-Finds level 3 Helmet and a Backpack level 3
-Finds a Scar-L
-finds a Motor Bike
-Drives it
-Flips over and dies
-Random guy loots your items

Round 2

-Plays on DUO
-Lots of asian and Chinese people you dont understand
-Chinese player shoots you for not following him
-Revives you
-Now you understand
-You follow the Guy
-Finds 2 Enemies, kills them
-Wins!
-Loot their Stuff
-Gets ambushed
-Got Knocked down
-Chinese guy tought you were an enemy
-Gets shot by your team and dies

Round 3

-Plays SQUAD
-Drops down at a waypoint placed by a pro
-Finds a Gun
-Squad is all American, good
-Finds a Squad
-kills the squad
-Gets Ambushed
-Killed them
-Heals up
-Finds a Dacia
-Noob (You) Drives it
-You drive swiftly and perfectly
-Drops at the Waypoint
-Finds a whole pack of enemies
-Your team kills alot of Enemies
-Heals up
-Pro accidentally Equips a Grenade rather then a Medkit or Bandage
-Drop it
-Whole Squad dies
-Placed in top 2


11/10 would get killed by teams again.

review: I was convinced by a friend to get pubg and have to admit that im having a world of fun. Getting use to the controls and aiming at a distance is challenging but still i cant stop playing. On the other hand, Ive been getting the prompt "servers are to busy, please try again later" which has now reached the level of being rediculous... Ive sat for 30min trying to connect, how much later should I then try???

author: {'steamid': '76561198121139390', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1557956307}
review:
Although I do reccomend PUBG, beware of laggy people with pings higher than 500.

Anytime I play a solo match, I end up getting some nice weapons, such as the AKM. But I can't win any battles, because on the enemy's screen, I never shot at them until I was already dead, injured, or shot. But duo is a whole different story. There's no high pings, just ordinary players. On the other players' screens, you shoot exactly when you really did shoot at them. I've never suspected or caught anyone cheating, but there should be people who do such just to win the game. This is only how I see it, so don't think the same will happen to you. It may just be that I live in the U.S, but others live in foreign countries, far away from where I live. I still enjoy the game, even solo, no matter what happens. You can win by just hiding and gathering up armor and weapons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065899308', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1547870193}
review:
With over 500 hours on record, I cannot say that I have not enjoyed this game. 

Pros:
- Need a shot of adrenaline? Check
- Need a reason to hate yourself? Check
- Need a reason to hate eneryone else? Check

Cons:
- You need at least a fucking 1080TI to run this game...
- Cheating/Hacking is STILL a problem!
- Don't play it before bed, or your sleep will be terrible.

In game notes:
- Terrain feels wonky...
- Weapon balance has improved, but still feels lack luster.
- The UI feels like it took blue hole about 10 minutes.
- The continuous (but damn slow) improvements to the game do show that there is a mimimum of 1 full time developer on staff, which is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182594439', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1545251396}
review: Playing with people online can have it's benefits and downsides. This game shows both. Knowing there are 100 people in one game and only one person can come out top and you may be the top dog or the one that carries the top dog to victory. The Battle Royal genre has always interested me in many ways. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS has a very unique style to it coming from H1Z1. I love this game and will continue to love it even though there are people whom are better than me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348458200', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1566131069}
review: This game has a price tag that is for some people, a turn away, and for me, the price was too steep. Yet, my friends persuaded me to get it and it was a wonderous game to behold. Coming from games like CSGO, other first person shooters, the third person view is really intuative. For all the games bugs and glitches, the actual gameplay is on another level. absolutely mesmerising map size, the tense moments when you are going one on one with another man for that chicken dinner and prevailing is an amazing experience. I highly recommend this game for everyone as the small price tag is easily outweighed by the hours of fun from this game.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198029317829', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1574049112}
review: I have put a lot of hours into this game and I must say it is honestly a really fun game especially with friends. The amount of funny and random stuff that happens leaves some long lasting memories. With that said some on the long lasting memories is the amount of hackers. Look at the top 1000 players on the server and you will see a recurring theme in the names. The developers had a movement to "fix PUBG" and it clearly failed as I still encounter hackers every 2-3 games. Even with the amount of hackers the other 50-60 percent of games make up for the bad ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135051639', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 21425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 64, 'last_played': 1575378452}
review: Where to start with PUBG... How about the great and addictive gameplay that pulls you in after every loss even if you feel like a stale piece of garbage turkey for walking into a house and not watching your corners, and gives virtually no reward for winning besides some scrap of self-worth and something to brag about to mates. The graphics are not to be shun even though they are par for the course with ganes that come out these days, the map layouts are memorable and iconic and after about 10 games i knew it like the back of my nuclear warhead. One negative thing that can be said about this game are the performance issues which aren't that prominent since the 1.0 launch but are still present, another thing is the CHINESE, why can't Bluehole just give them their own server, since OC and NA servers seem to be getting the brunt of their hacks and teamkills, it just doesn't seem to help bluehole in any way since this could lead to a chunk of the playerbase quitting. Overall.. iss pre gewd

review:
+ great gameplay
+ great fun
+ new free map 
+ new updates 
+ good game

I always loved PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. Yes, there is lag sometimes and the game is still being optimised but it's unplayable as most people claim it to be. I never had major issues with this game.

After having played PUBG for more than 100 hours I can still say that it makes a lot of fun. I bought it for only 30 bucks and it provided me with great fun. I don't regret buying this game. I can't wait for future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161103763', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 14200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564406008}
review: A game whose rapid claim to fame became its greatest downfall. While the game can be very fun and is receiving updates (At a slow rate) to improve it, the game is plagued with hackers and teamers (People who play as teams of 4 in 2-man lobbies etc.) this can ruin an otherwise perfect run you and your friends may have invested 40 or more minutes into. You'll find great loot and have all the heals you could ask for only to be shot by hacker 5000 feet away from you. The game mechanically still feels like it's in beta and really feels unpolished with parts of the map having 'bad' textures which will kill you or get you stuck in the unfortunate circumstance that you clip into them. Overall the game needs much work before it is even close to being worth the $30 asking price. Regardless the game can still be fun and if you have 3 other friends who want to join you, but be prepared the journey is not smooth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819699201', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 130151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1309, 'last_played': 1575762905}
review:
I have 1565 Hours on PUBG, Is the game perfect no. Is the game the best BR Experience no matter how many times you play getting a win is challenging. The Gun play is amazing hitting a 500M Headshot on a moving target is hard and rewarding. Spraying down 4 targets when it only takes 5 Bullet's to kill you is amazing. This game get's bad Rep for it's netcode (de-sync) yet BattleNonsence-YTer proved it has the best. 

TLDR PUBG is the most challenging realistic BR it is the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132107211', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 18484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 236, 'last_played': 1575512722}
review:
Coming back to this game after over a year of not playing. It has its aspects of a crappy free to play mobile game, such as the really bad loading screen artwork, the battlepass, etc., but I'm enjoying it like I did years ago. As of writing this, there is currently no map selection, but I understand why. It was impossible to find matches when I tried playing again a while back, when the choice was open, so I hope they can find a system that works well.

As per usual, this game has its fair share of bugs, but I still have fun (most of the time)

There is clearly still a problem with cheating, although I don't see it much in the eastern US. Currently, the top players on the leaderboard are mostly obvious Chinese grind accounts, which I would assume are sold for money.

Still desperately miss the old menu music, but the current one is better than their other attempts.

A lot of the cosmetics that they have been creating lately haven't been half bad. Plenty of rugged clothing items and skins, which is good to see.


For better or for worse, this game isn't quite what it used to be. Plenty of game-breaking issues have been addressed, and while i may miss the way I got to play this game back in early access, it's good to see that they're trying to shape this into a proper game.

review:
[b] I was in this game from the first day of released so know everything about changes and gameplay.
First; thanks GOD for that the company finally optimizied the game (of course it need's more optimizing, there's a long way to a good game), it's a real mess at the beginning!
Shoot and aiming is different from all the FPS games that I played, much more realistic, so if your a CoD, BF, CS or another FPS game, don't expect to be a good player here too.
It's very depending on ping and if you have an upper ping of 200, completly forget this game and stick to another BATTLE ROTAL game.
Of course it need's SSD beacuse of heavy buffering load.
At the end; just for fun with friends. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198200282850', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 29515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'last_played': 1575265511}
review: For all the people who are down voting this because of Chinese players playing NA, its not an issue if you just play with friend or do solo and dont do random teams because yes you will more then likely be team killed or it could be an obnoxious chinese person but who gives cares just play solo. Other then that I find this game extremely fun especially with friends and getting that first chicken dinner can be one of the most satisfying things ever, when I got mine I was screaming in joy. For people who are not that great at shooters I still reccomend this game because you can get better I was absolute trash when I played and 200 hours in I finally actually shoot at people. Give this game a chance and try because it can be a great experience. One of my friends is great at fps games, much better then me and when he dies he gets so frustrated its hilarious and I have another friend who should definatly be better at the game but I just laugh at him because he does the dumbest mistakes. Id say you should definatly get this if you have friends to play it with or just want a rollercoaster of an experience. BTW to bluehole I reccomend a jungle map because that would be the coolest thing ever.

review: Worth the money for sure, but it is full of bugs. author: {'steamid': '76561198004251679', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1546410081}
review:
I know a lot of people have poo poo'ed PUBG, and for good reason - releasing more microtransation items rather than working on the bugs and optimazation, scoring console deals and working on those projects rather than core game. The implementation of the season passes and level incentives came way way too late. 
However I will say this. I love dropping into a game now and then just to raise some hell and pew pew some peoplein the face. I'm not concerned about chicken dinners, i'm what you'd call a "casual" BR player, not a try-hard in the least. If i can have some fun with a friend in duos or a full squad of goofballs - thats all i need. and PUBG still gives me that environment. If i *do* want to try and win a game, i can still do that, but I wont pour hours into the game at a time these days. 
Take PUBG for what it is, and if its not your cuppa, there are plenty of other BR's out there that might be a better fit for you.

review: The pioneer gold standard for Battle Royale. You will experience campers because it's a survival game. The best game I've ever played and I hope it lasts forever.

review:
===[ Player Bases ]===

===[ Bugs ]===

☑ Bugs sometimes crashing the game sometimes
☑ Some bugs there and there
☐ Few Bugs
☐ Funny bugs
☐ Nothing

===[ Summary ]===
I love and hate this game. I'm not the biggest Battle Royale fan, I hate the randomness with looting, and the general game length to action ratio. I love the exhilarating fights, the gun mechanics, and the feeling of winning though. This game isn't for everyone (even though everyone seems to play it), but for $30, you'll definitely be able to get your money's worth. And for fans of the Battle Royale genre, this is the best we have for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074245929', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565141355}
review:
I have to say I played this game for a while solo and was kinda like, meh but I was behind the curve because I got it late.

I have recently started playing with friends and it is a totally different experience and so much fun.  I would definitely recommend it.  Whether you play solo or with friends.  I enjoy playing solo because I only worry about me and often make it to the top three but it is such a different experience with friends!

I see a lot of people complaining about hackers, I have yet to deal with an instance of hacking, although I am sure they exist.  I really enjoy the newest update and other than some initial problems with the menu loading I have no issues now.


Highly recommend and add me if you want to play!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198404535906', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569086775}
review:
While PUBG focuses on executing the core mechanics that make battle royale-like games great, it lacks technical refinement. At launch, PUBG is noticeably improved from its early access days, but frame rates can still fluctuate inexplicably. Even a high-end PC can have trouble maintaining a consistent framerate with relatively modest graphics settings, evidence of PUBG's ongoing optimization struggles.
Likewise, the familiar fear of seemingly random crashes and connection difficulties remains, and it's sometimes almost as unnerving as an opposing squad converging on your location. (If it's any consolation, you can pick up where you left off if you relaunch the game before your character dies.) You may also experience character models clipping through the environment and getting stuck inside objects. If and when these problems strike, an otherwise good match can be ruined in an instant.
PUBG's technical shortcomings can undermine its broader achievements on rare occasions, but they don't override your desire to continue playing. Each phase of a match presents a different type of tension that is equal parts thrilling and terrifying, driven by the insatiable desire to be the last person (or squad) standing. Whether you play solo or in a group, successfully executing adaptive tactics to win intense, high-stakes firefights makes for an incredibly rewarding experience. Every player has unique stories of their most memorable matches, and even after hundreds of hours, PUBG continues to inspire rousing tales of victory and defeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094928735', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 11177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564876787}
review:
This game, its different. Forcing you to leave your comfort to win, making you a hardened killer, and also a master tactician. The only problem being that all those skills go to waste when a chinese lag-stabber hits you in the head, constantly screaming "China! China! China!"

The realism is great, bullet drop physics, and overall playthrough of tense and calm moments, and total hilarity when your friend barrels the car over a rooftop and hits someone. Its that rare mix of having fun and being serious at the same time.

One problem, already mentioned, the flux of Asian/Japan players overcrowding the NA/EU servers, and really just letting the lag do the work for them. Region restrictions and ping monitors/locks should be put in place to make the game more equal, instead of getting shot by some guy across a field who's rubber-banding running towards your corpse.

review:
Owned this game since very first launch as early access.
To be honest, I went from playing on very low to ultra as we speak right now on i5 6400, gtx 1060 /w 6gb vram & 8gb ram
Game went through so much adjustments, but the community are greedy for way more, they adjust, optimize and release new content, and I'll be honest with you, you dont see an everyday company, that does those three in same time and rock at doing it. This game is a total buy and has a really BRIGHT future infront of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257845616', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1550891523}
review:
I decied to leave a review once I found out that this game's reviews are mixed.

I understand there are  M A N Y  flaws, and issues regarding the playerbase, *cough* hackers *cough* china numba 1 *cough*, but I have had an amazing experience playing this game.
The combat is fun, the game provides a feeling of reward for planning, improving and having good skill. Squads are a blast to play with friends, and make the game almost endlessly replayable.

I'm not gonna list cons here because, well, you should be able to find plenty of them in other reviews.

review: Game is fun as hell with a team, and even more intense on solo, but when your constanly being paired with chinese players, sure i have some buddies io play with that speak english , but they dont play as much as me , so im always stuck with the chinese players. Now as far as cheaters go they"re running rampant right now and the majority of them are chinese, i used to see 1 a week , now i seen 5 yesterday in a 2 hour span ,about 8 or 10 games , blatant third person shots across the map, with no scope , i seen one replay on my mine the chinese guy knocked two of my partners down at  a dead run , we got behind rock and i was able to revive , my third partner started shooting at him from a different angle, who was my son btw , as the chinese player spoted him ,he went to scope in on him and instead,,,,, his gun and scope swung as fast as fuck to the right ,,right back on the last dude ,,my buddy ,,,who i was picking up ,,, the chinese player backed behind the hill a little and must have recalibrated his aim bot ,,  and poked his head back over the hill just to hit my son whose at a dead run with another ,,,headshot,,, with a 'kar98,,,   that being said  battleye is a joke and should be ashamed to call itself anti-cheat lol,,,the cheaters  are ruining this game ,,,

author: {'steamid': '76561198069485923', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1542581011}
review:
I remember Battlegrounds
like it was yesterday
I remember that village we had cut down,
It was a massacre
All the dead Chinamen we left in our tracks
I remember their faces
The children
This one child I'll never forget
Poor little bastard was still alive
Little Chinese legs were blown clean off
Could still see the little shins of feet
hanging off the ceiling fan across the hut.
He was charred from his head
down to his little Chinese legs
He tried to get up
But what was left of his
right leg broke off
As he lay there flat on his face
he looked up at me
His little Chinese eyes burned straight
into my stomach, deep into my soul
He said something to me in Chinese
sounded like some cartoon shit, but
I understood his question he was asking me
I don't need to speak Chinese to know
what that question was..
Why PUBG? Why?
Why'd you have to bring China into this   shit   ?

review:
Excellent game. After the game's been officially released and out from the early access alpha they have literally fixed everything. No input lag anymore and the game is really well optimized and stable. Also has less cheaters than CS:GO for example.
Best FPS multiplayer experience along with Counter-Strike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213372685', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565664971}
review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS, or as many know it as Pubg, is a fun third/first person battle royale game. You've might of seen reviews of there being tons of hackers in the game, but so far no to be seen in about 40 hours of playing. The game takes some time to get used to. There are some really cool features that you wont find in any other battle royale game, like attachments, different levels of gear, and different items to heal yourself. If you play and that some time to learn how to use everything, you can get kills, get far into games, and even get a Winner Winner Chicken Dinner, as a win is called in the game. Overall, the game is fantastic, even if there's a few bugs, and other things that might effect the outcome of the match, but like I said if you take the time to get good at the game, then you can have fun killing and winning in PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS.
