author: {'steamid': '76561198074742767', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 130567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572215202}
review:
I've been playing since beta. I've seen the horiffic rubber banding of the 1.0.0 release. I know of the speed and aim and instant kill hackers. I lived through the M4 meta. I've gone through periods of only playing solos to grind the leaderboards, and playing squads with discord servers dedicated to setting up squads, and just playing random squads because I need to relax. 

PUBG is not a perfect game. It is not an ultra realistic Mil-Sim. It is a fun game. I will compare it to APEX legends because they are both BR games I have experience with.

Apex legends is fast paced, fun, a bit cartoony, and smooth. Movement is quick, and aim is king. The voiceless communication system works really well. It plays like a BR version of overwatch, both due to ultimates and abilities, but mostly because of movement similarities.

PUBG is a game with good gunplay, good team communication (in randoms a lot of people use mics and use them correctly. People are often helpful, but sometimes people are not. This is the way of people.) and huge maps. Compared to apex I forgot how you can just die to zone because you took too long and couldn't find a car.

The map variety on PUBG is great. The map balance and weapons balance has improved considerably over time, and I haven't died to desync once in the past couple of months. This is all with a good connection on US servers, so results may vary, but matchmaking algorithms have been nailed down fairly well and random no longer drops you in Sanhok every time.

I haven't seen many cheaters (or even one) in the past month or so. Probably because there is less financial incentive/there are new games out to cheat on (apex I'm looking at you).

PUBG's UI and interaction and movement feel far clunkier than APEX, but way better than Arma or similar games. It is a functional balance of realism and gameplay which can take a couple matches to get used to, but is worth the additional interaction capabilities and general 'realism' vibe of the game.

Bullets feel deadly. except for the PP bizon. I'm really bad with that gun. But getting shot or hitting someone feels correct. the melee is garbage. Apex's melee is way better. Any other melee in any other game is more consistent and usable.

You can solo wipe a squad. People are not bullet sponges like they can be in apex. Positioning is important, and if a squad member is killed, they are gone for good. Staying together and communicating is key. You can hide in the grass and pray no one finds you. Sometimes you can be looking for people and see no one for twenty minutes. It's still fun for me. Finding good loot feels good. Getting a kill feels good.

Vehicles are way better than they used to be, and better than many other games (not the best, not driving sim material, sometimes they get collision messed up and get stuck in a fence and explode, but like 3% as much as they used to.)

Generally, balance is way better than it used to be, positioning matters a ton, and good aim is necessary, but lightning reflexes aren't essential. Gun play feels good, and pacing is inconsistent, but feels like it should be that way.

If you aren't patient and just want combat, you likely want to just play sanhok all the time. If you like looting and sniping, Miramar may be the map for you. Erangel is a nice mix. Vikendi is a denser erangel, and snowy, with a lot of house/building based fighting. Urban combat still feels less reliable than positioning based distance engagements, but you learn from your mistakes, and figure out when combat is the best option, or when that lone target in the middle of the field is better used as bait for other teams, and not worth giving your position away for.

The microtransactions and crates and all that don't matter in my opinion. I don't feel the need to spend money on cosmetics when the reason I play the game is for the uniquely well made semi-realistic battle royale experience it provides. I've made some good friends playing randoms, people I still talk to and catch up with who I met a year or more ago dropping Hacienda and Pochinki.

The leaderboard is a bit meh because it primarily tracks how much you play, instead of how well you do. But again, that doesn't detract from the engaging (and significantly improved and balanced since release) gameplay which makes this game the most played on my account.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960626849', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1548919771}
review:
Want to give this a neutral review.
All of the negative reviews of this miss the main point.  There may be a few bugs or fps drops but if you aren't trying to be an esports hall of fame twitch streamer you'll have fun.  The worst part to me is how great scopes are and how much of an advantage that is.

The biggest issue of this game is that it's arma stripped down.

It looks like arma, plays like arma, and only has some ui improvement and slightly better mechanics then arma.

Otherwise you can get arma 3 and play pubg mod, dayz mod, gta mod, tons of other mods, as well as arma.

The instant queues because of the massive player base is the only thing that really separates this from arma.  If 6 million people bought and played arma 3 there wouldn't be much reason to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052943082', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1561612570}
review:
This is a game which gives me both pleasure and the sense of defeated.
I got this game in about May or June in 2017. During that time, the game stayed unfinished. The menu was built by web and needed to load every time I opened it. It was not friendly to Chinese internet at first. I really had a hard time to connect to the server. Each time I got several kills and heard another man's sound, my game would crash or the internet would go down. It killed me honestly. But this game is good. I continued playing this game till now and everything seems fine. The FPS was stablized, the internet issues were "about" fixed(though I got some loss sometimes.) Though TPP was full of unfairness and hackers, hmmm, I mean, this game is still playable, once you are patient enough, and pay less hope of getting a chicken dinner. 
The game is progressing, hope it will be better in the future. Hope there will be fewer hackers and more fairness... Peace out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073276676', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 28309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 105, 'last_played': 1575600322}
review:
So I have been playing this game for a while now and it has come a long way and has, in my opinion, gotten better. A feauture they just had was an event of a 8-player squad which I thought was kind of stupid with the double AR spawn but when I played it I had so much fun and they should make that a full time thing and that was the one mode that the whole team for every game I played they had mics that worked and i could hear them just fine. Really like what the game is starting to turn into. Devs have done a good job with the patches and adding new features, honestly they just from here on just listen to the reviews from people and improve it from there.

*UpDate*

author: {'steamid': '76561198301561488', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 62214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573725827}
review:
PUBG is a multy-award winning game with a high player-count. It has dominated the steam charts for months and has attracked dozens of popular youtubers and twitch streamers. Although, the feedback from people have been negative, pubg has maintained a stable player base till early january. Now, PUBG is loosing players. I will try my best to conclude why.
Why is PUBG "dying" ?
Firstly, I shall begin by the in-game reasons. Then, secondly, the decisions taken by the game developpers.

        As we can see, for many people, PUBG is a game rigged with bugs, glitches and un-balanced assets. The game itself is quite stable compared to others, but still, bugs appear, and for a company that is now worth over 60 million USD, bugs that appeared from the beta must at all cost not be shown in a "released" version of PUBG, that  includes the buggy matchmaking system, being stuck between objects and even minor ADS bugs. Equally, PUBG has a serious balance issue. I personnaly find the game reasonably balanced: weapons, player health and even map terrain; is balanced accordingly. But sometimes I can see why people say that PUBG is un-balanced, as an example : 4<5 shots to kill someone without a vest is ludicrous and unrealistic. And of course the shotgun spread mechanic, some accuse it of being broken.

        So, what is Brendan Greene and his team doing ? A wealthy game company should in theory keep the game in a stable state. Of course, many players are leaving PUBG for the actions taken by the team: Instead of fixing common issues, patches are focused on adding useless features, for example: they have changed the U.I for the parachute indicator multiple times, recently, they also added the plane's trajectory. I find that PUBG tries to focus players away from common issues by adding these features. Many people find PUBG uses "patches" to introduce crates that must be payed to open. I personnaly find this greedy and insulting to the remaining community, instead of creating new maps, new weapons and accessories regulary, they create "cosmetic" content that we have to pay to keep us occupied: it's just disgusting.


      Finally, PUBG has had awesome feedback. But is slowly dying because of a lack relation between players and developpers. A buggy and un-balanced platform and a oblivious management team.



                                                                                                                                                       Tom,
                                                                                                                                         "A salty player"

author: {'steamid': '76561198015865003', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 49421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565773006}
review:
[h1] POSITIVES [/h1]
[list]
[*] The game is unique in the sense that its gun mechanics are on point and satisfying to use.
[*] As of late, the game's engine seems to be running a lot smoother compared to when the game was fairly new.
[*] Gun sounds are distinguishable for both your own weapon and the enemy's
[*] PUBG gaming community salt level: 2/10. Only rarely will you encounter somebody that is toxic. Report system seems to ban such players on the regular. Eg: Players that intentionally team kill. 
[/list]

[h1] NEGATIVES [/h1]
[list]
[*] Movement mechanics and moving around the terrain in general feels super clunky! Quite frustrating to end up being shot because you were slowed down or stopped by a square piece of grass that hasn't been clipped properly. 
[*] Jumping or vaulting onto obstacles such as a large rock is also super clunky!
[*] It may seem like you are clear to shoot someone over or around the cover you're behind, but quite often your bullet ends up hitting that object.
[*]  Developers seem to focus their attention on adding cosmetics to the game rather than fixing core issues such as players who are cheaters. (Aimbot, shooting/driving through walls, 0 recoil) Though there are far less cheaters compared to the early days.
[*] Most cheaters or toxic players I've come across seem to be from China. Just an observation! 
[/list]

[h1] OVERALL [/h1] 
Overall PUBG is still a good and fun game to play. If you can manage to accept its clunky movement behaviour and enjoy a more slower paced battle royale game, you'll have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998029976', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1535229848}
review:
I have absolutely zero clue why the hell people are giving PUBG so much crap right now with their shitty reviews.

I haven't played a whole lot lately, but all these complaints about hackers...? Sure, I sometimes question how someone managed to kill me, but to my knowledge I have never encountered a hacker (in EU servers). Neither have my friends.

I do see a problem with the whole lootbox system, but 1) it's there since the early stages of the game, so why are people bitching now and 2) it's not pay to win. It's gambling, which should be illegal in most countries and distracts the devs from further development. That does not take away that PUBG is still the ultimate Battle Royale experience, as is.

To explain that, I refuse to turn this into a fancy review explaining what I approve or disapprove of in regards to Graphics, Gameplay and Mechanics and more. The point is that this game did what DayZ did not. What H1Z1 could not. What Fortnite still cannot (though being hugely popular with the younger audiences). And what many other games including your common casual shooter can never achieve.

It's a shooter with reliable shooting mechanics. It's easy to get into, but will require some degree of skills to master. It has quite a lot of variation and randomness compared to other games in the genre. Controls are fluid as is operating your character in the world. There are third and first person options depending on your preference. In fact, they made the game more competitive by adding so much more attachments and scopes that everyone is bound to get a feasible build for the late game these days. These devs started out with a winning concept and finetuned it perfectly so far.

Basically this game has the formula right. Something that very few modern games manages to reach. Do not for a second trust any of the negative reviews, which are all written out of spite for supposed hackers or the whole lootbox situation. The only thing I dislike of Bluehole is the fact that they have arbitrarily banned random players without evidence, but have let offending streamers off the hook because they are promoting their game. That and lootboxes are the only gripes I can name and neither have an impact on the foundation of this game: the perfect gameplay.

If you are dying for a proper Battle Royale shooter to play with or without your friends against other people... this is simply the way to go.

review: I find this game fun when playing in a Duo with a friend or a Squad with 3 of my friends. Every game you play will be different, different loot drops, different circles, and different maps. This sort of variety is nice to see in a game like this. If you like more "tactical-esque" shooters aswell as the BR gamemodes, you'll most likely enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981480534', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 157993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1712, 'last_played': 1575797203}
review: It's been 1500 hours almost and still I come back.  This game is like a relationship with a crazy person.  They fuck like a pornstar, but they ignore everything you want.  Yet there you are week after week plowing away because trying to find something else is not just more work, it's doesn't seem to have the gratification that PUBG can have.  Sure it's not always gratifying.  Sometimes it's downright abusive.  But when it is good, it is so much better than anything else.  Sure you could find that safe, sane game that will treat you the way you want to be treated.  And who knows it might even work out.  But a part of you will always yearn for the feeling that PUBG gives you.  You will yearn for that feeling and eventually you'll be back for it.  Because we both know you can't get it anywhere else.  And Bluehole knows that too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117735037', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 29655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570900048}
review:
Most of the negative reviews given here are from 
1. Salty people who suck at the game and quit.
2. People with shitty computers who can't run it yet expect 200 fps.
3. People who think everyone is hacking because they are better than them. (Only applies to US players, there is a legit hacking problem in the AS and OC servers)
4. Dumba$$es who say "JUST OPTIMIZE YOUR GAME" without actually realizing how long and how much effort it takes

My first 400 hours on this game were before 1.0 when I could barely run it and had to wait 5 minutes prone in the grass because none of my buildings were showing up. This game was just so fun that I could ignore that. The adrenaline rush I get from getting a good kill or outplaying a team was well worth the low frames and frequent bugs. Now with 1.0 out I could even raise my graphics settings. The devs obviously put effort into maintaining this game consistently fixing any major bugs and problems that come up. 
Now for the hacking problem. In all the time I've played this game I've run into less than 20 hackers total, and they usually come in waves then disappear soon after. This only applies to the US since the asia/oceania servers have legitamate hacking problems where people pay top dollar for subscription hacks. But for the US, most people who complain about hackers are honesly just bad at the game. They can't see the difference between their dumbass mistakes and an aimbot. For the US players out there I can say for sure that hacking is not a big problem. They've done a good job dealing with the huge amount of hacks coming out for this game (seriously just look it up), and they ban thousands on the daily.
All I can say is ignore the childish reviews of people complaining about hacking or lag and try it for yourself, steam does have a refund option after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084421265', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1557869848}
review:
Currently this game is in a very "annoying" state, but i can still say that it is fun to play and mostly enjoyable. Recently the new "map" has been introduced as of last month and it's nice that the Dev. Team is constantly updating the game, although there are soo many things that they could fix to make it a much more enjoyable experience.


CONS / PROBLEMS:

-People that aren't playing on their servers by location.
-Has terrible optimization compared to some other games.
-Pistols are nearly completely useless.
-Driving in the game is extremely problematic when all the cars slide around like the ground is ice.
-Weapons of the same caliber have completely different stats(bullet drop, range).
-Entities fail to render in for some people which leads them to die to another player that lacks the same issue.
-leaderbords are completely inaccurate.
-Bugs that allow you to be completely compromised for the whole game until you die exist(mainly in the new desert map).
-The list goes on with each match played.
-No Hitmarker noise or screenlocked indicator, it is indicated by one of the enemy's kidneys exploading into a "bloody mess"



PROS / NON-Problems:

-Bullet drop is fun and challenging, also the game has "Zeroing distance"
-Fights that break out betweeen multiple squads over objectives like supply drops or moving into the next zone are heated, tacticle, and enjoyable(exept when encountering bridge campers, yes it is an effective strategy but..... it's unfair forced engagement).
-Everyone can have a favorite weapon in the game, there is no weapon in the game that is complete S*** It's all opinion based(except the pump action shotgun and the 7.62mm Revolver(meme pistol))
-Silencers make you feel like an assasin
-Winning a game is just as or even more satisfying than eating Tide Pods(depends on your current mood)
-The realization that the Tommy Gun's description was lying sent me into a soul searching journey for 2 days; during that time i found out that i have two sons that are 18 and 17 years old, one named Bicheal and one that is transgender or something.(The moral was that the game lied to me and i was heck'n SHOOK)
-I have learned that the only words that all chinese players know in english are "No", "China", "Numba", "one", "Bye bye". Exclusively in that order too. (take with a grain of salt please, it's hard for me to learn a 5th language with all these heathens in my good christian life)
-You can pretend to be a "Mormon Converter", simply go up to a house, knock on the door with your trusy bullet-proof frying pan and then convert them by force.


----------------

P E R S O N A L   Q U A R R E L S :

SQUADS:
-Squads needs to be improved, i know that it is logical if someone dies they have to spectate but quite frankly it is the most boring experience in my life when you get killed by another player with a fully automatic Mini-14(because macros=win in this game) at the begining of the game because you landed in a large building which had a beanie and a P1911

-Queing up on the NA SERVERS for squads with matchmaking because your m8's are offline and you get matched with 3 other players whome all greet you with "Ni hao".

-New map gave me and my entire discord server an addiction to Tide Pods(or those cheap "Great Value" knock-offs)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077424237', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 41840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 63, 'last_played': 1575752264}
review:
[h1]my honest Opinion on it, because there are so many bad reviews here[/h1]

[u]+ pros:[/u]
[list]
    [*]Greatest BR game I have played so far (I have played ArmA 2 BR, H1Z1, ArmA 3 BR and Fortnite)
    [*]New Map (Sanhok) is great
	[*]Bugs get fixed when they appear
    [*]Such much fun playing it with friends in Duos or Squad Games
    [*]Optimization has improved a ton. (FPS are fine)
    [*]Few Cheaters. (I have seen 2 Cheaters in 380 hours of Gameplay, thats very very low when I compare it to CSGO)
	[*]I like the Event Pass, so you are killing people with weapons you normally wont 
	[*]Low queue times
	[*]Weapon balancing and spawn rates specially on Sanhok
[/list]

[u]- cons:[/u]
[list]
    [*]People complain about things that are not really a problem
    [*]Wish there was a lobby with 3 Players and not 3-man Squad Game
    [*]Can't queue for Erangel or Miramar only
[/list]

[u]conclusion:[/u]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Category[/th]
        [th]Rating[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics for a BR Game[/td]
        [td]9/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td]10/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Audio Quality[/td]
        [td]9/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Audio Effects (Ghost Steps, Shots)[/td]
        [td]6/10[/td]
    [/tr]
	[tr]
        [td]FUN with Friends[/td]
        [td]10/10[/td]
    [/tr]
	[tr]
        [td]Price[/td]
        [td]Worth the money[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[h1]overall I would recommend this game to everyone![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198040855364', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565843594}
review:
The game receives more negativity than it deserves. The devs have been making strides to improve the game with new guns, optimization, new maps, anti-cheats, and the server tick rate has recently increased to 60hz as well. A lot of these negative reviews come from the addition of micro transactions (keys/locked crates mostly), but that doesn't change the fact that the game itself is being improved all the time. Money is important for this.

The game has been in "full release" for about 6 months now and the devs haven't given up. Would it have been better to leave the game in perpetual "Early Access" (DayZ) and forgotten? The devs do listen to the community, the game isn't perfect but it's not as bad as these reviews make it out to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968615367', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1515042499}
review:
I stayed away due to the mixed reviews, but finally pulled the trigger during the sale.  I am so glad that I did.  The game looks and play wonderfully.  Even on Ultra settings, it is smooth as silk for me.  

The gameplay is tense and a ton of fun.  Carefully and quickly scavagening for gear all the while watching your back and listening for signes of approaching enemies brings a great sence of suspence.  

The only negative I can say, is that during the drop sequence, you have those people who go out of their way to asail your ears with hateful and annoying speech.  Thankfull a quick button press mutes them.

If you are like me, and enjoy modern, semi realistic military shooters, and enjoy the tense quiet of stalking from place to place, then do yourself a favor and pick it up.  It really is one of my top games this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115044634', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1526515834}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126841796', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1562445418}
review:
Yes: This game can lag and sometimes the servers are just choppy as hell
Yes: The playerbase is incredibly toxic but there are hackers all around. I personally prefer region locked servers or a more efficient method to preventing hacking. 

I honestly never expected that I would enjoy a game such as PUBG only because I am not very good at FPS / related. After playing it and getting used to the mechanics ( and getting used to how rude some people can be in the lobby lol ), it's really not a dreadful experience.

The game itself certaintly has work to make it better, but for a game that needs to handle so many servers at once, it's quite a respectable feat. TBH im surprised my game hasn't crashed as often as I assumed would happen.

TLDR: PUBG is certainly not a game for every gamer because of the community can be, but it's worth playing with friends who can enjoy the game alongside you, despite the set backs the game offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420536531', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1548004876}
review:
This is a really fun game....given that you have : friends to play with, a good computer (well it doesn't matter that much 'cause you'll get bad FPS anyways, but they say they're gonna fix that, so I'm really looking forward to it), a bit of luck and game-sense....ain't getting nowhere without game-sense. Of course, as any other mainstream games, it has its PROS and CONS, and I'm gonna go over them right now (there are not so many of them though), and give a final verdict of the game at the end...


[u] [b] PROS [/b] [/u]
[list]
    [*]Really fun, especially with friends
    [*]Encourages team work and communication
    [*]Ever increasing community
[/list]

[u] [b] CONS [/b] [/u]
[list]
    [*]Not optimized properly, you'll get low FPS even if you have a good rig (I personally get around 70-80 FPS)
    [*]Increasing amount of cheaters and hackers
    [*]Stream sniping b*tches
    [*]BUGS...lots of small bugs that are annoying as f**k

[u] [b] VERDICT [/b] [/u]

Is this a fun game ? Hell yes. Is it worth the 30 USD price point though ? No, period though. I recommend either getting the game when it's fullly released and polished, or if it is on sale, otherwise hold on to your cash. But, if you are thinking about it, and you have money to spend, this is definitely a get-it. 

Also, a note to the developers - priotize the small bugs and FPS issues, THEN look towards introducing new features and porting the game to other consoles and stuff.

review: E-Sports ready game. There is no other experience like this. The game rewards skilled players who have dedicated there time to perfecting there shot. It's not like you can just hide in a bush like a p***y and ruin a skilled players game. The game has absouloutely no bugs in it and it's ready for the pro scene. A clear example of this is the last game I played where my gun was shooting at the roof when i was clearly aiming at him. Actually I am realizing how riveting the game is when there is no car spawn and you have to run a 10 mile marathon to make it to the next circle only to get shot by a couple highly skilled players hiding behind a rock. 10/10 will play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972204604', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 37242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19, 'last_played': 1574713281}
review:
How come this game was better in Early Acces.. Warping is real bad in 1.0. I always get the new desert map. I don't mind if I get it a few times in a row, but when I get it about 12times in a row without getting the original map, then a bomb starts ticking in my head.. I really love this game, it's my favourite game and probably will be for a long time, but the warps and lags are ruining it for me atm. Hopefully it gets fixed soon. I still recommend buying this cuz you will have a lot of fun playing alone and even more with a friend or 3friends. FIX THE LAGS

EDIT (18.2.2018) - 

Game is running fine now but there are ofcourse still a few bugs, but thats just the gaming experience that every game needs in a way.

EDIT (25.7.2019) -

Yup, game works fine but you only play this max 10hours a week, and I play alot every day.

And this game will also allow you to heat up your cold ass room in winter when its like -20 degrees outside to a nice +30 summer, so you get a smaller electricity bill while having fun lol. And now that its summer we shouldnt forget that its probably 40 degrees in my room while playing this totally environment friendly game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042841285', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 68789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573650588}
review:
Boy does this game get more hate than it deserves.

In all my games on EU servers I have encountered around 5 'cheats' (it does look like American servers have more issues) so in my experience that is more of an annoyance than a problem. People seem to want to judge this game for what it could be rather than what it is, the bottom line is that this is an enjoyable single player experience however, as with a lot of games the true fun comes when playing with friends, never once have I not enjoyed a match with mates....and some games can be so tense towards the end that you genuinely feel the pressure. 

Is this game totally polished...nope
Should this game be better with the time/money it's had....Yeah
Is this game still really fun to play....Definitely...people should focus on what it has to offer rather than what it doesn't

author: {'steamid': '76561198009792083', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1522249081}
review:
This is actually my first Battle Royale type game.
Bought this together with a friend to go Duo match making.

Game looks good but doesn't really give much reason to use better graphics settings as other players can not be seen further in the distance with all the small clutter in cities or villages where most players are located.

Controls are a bit janky and feel more responsive in first person mode for some odd reason.

Jumping through windows without breaking them is also just strange. Makes for some bullcrap deaths

Oh well. Great game, just wish the devs weren't butthurt so easily over other games mimicking this one, of which there's just 1 competitor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031092706', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 27512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565595699}
review:
Alright so I have a unique perspective here on the game, so if you care here's my opinion on PUBG, Its past, current state, and future. So as everyone knows PUBG dropped onto steam like a nuke, just demolishing everything out there and smashing gaming records and amassing millions of players in mere months. The hype was insane and nobody could get enough of it, everybody wanted more! But thats just it. Everybody wanted MORE... But nothing more was coming... It got stale and old quickly, then small patches managed to break the entire game to a point where players started losing hope. That's when I picked up my copy of PUBG hoping that all of the negative was just people finally getting off the hype train... Boy was I wrong I played merely 4-5 hours before I totally lost hope in the game and thought to myself "there goes 40$" and i gave up on it for months.

   Fast forward to 2 weeks ago when I had gotten wind of a new map, battlepass, and apples to say fuck you to Fortnite, I laughed and said "Fuckin' hell, guess ill give that game a try again" in preparation for the new update I got back on and gave it another go, and to my surprise the game actually felt slightly less bugy and a little more playable then I had previously remembered, and for the first time I was actually thoroughly enjoying PUBG! I started watching more and more footage of the new map and was genuinely excited for the update. I couldn't wait! 

    Now we arrive where we are today. The release of Sanhok, the battle pass, and seemingly some optimization and slight gunplay tweaks (Correct me if I am wrong though) And I have to say that this is the first huge step in a new direction for PUBG co. THIS is fresh new content that your playerbase has been screaming at you about for a year now! The game actually feels fresh and new. New weapons, scenery, sound tweaks, AND APPLES! No more updates of more Microtransactions and new skins and bullshit nobody wants. Continue listening to the people keeping your game in buisness and your game will last for eternity.

                                                                           SUMMARY
  PUBG has been notorious for a lack of innovation and a lack of concern and care for their playerbase and what they want. BUT now it seems they seem to understand what is going on around them and how their multi-million copy celling game is failing. They released an amazing update. The gameplay on Sanhok feels new and fresh. This is what we've all asked for guys. ITS HERE! If youve given up on PUBG in the past. This is a new beginning if they continue on this track. 10/10. Good job PUBG

review: PUBG is by far one of my favorite games for the PC. Are you into action? Are you a thrill seeker? Guns blazing and fire at will? Or perhaps more of the lay low, strike only when needed player? Either way, this game is for you. Now, don't get me wrong, PUBG still has it's flaws. Lag, teamkillers, hackers, and the random Chinese kid screaming "CHINA NUMBA 1!" into his mike, but what game doesn't? I will happily stick to PUBG for the long run because quite frankly, there's not much out there quite like this game. Sure, you may have other battle royale type games, but none of them come close to PUBG. By far, one of the best out there.

I paid £20 for this.

I opened 3 crates so far without spending any money, and I've made £64.32 in steam credit.

Aside from basically being given my money back x3, I'm enjoying this game.

Having a shit day? Jump into a populated zone and rambo that shit.
Having a good day? PUBG can fix that.
It's fun, especially with friends, and even making random pals in-solo is pretty interesting. WWCD.

review:
This game is FUN. It seems to be the only BR game that offers great gameplay with some wicked gun mechanics, and generally a good experience. 

The server optimisations and spaghetti coding do give a lot of drawbacks but it is still very much enjoyable albeit frustrating at times (See Desync and lag issues) devs offer monthly, if not more frequent, game updates and have improved comms with the community (esp. on Reddit) a lot, and I have faith that they will improve upon the issues that plague this game and stop it from being as good as it can be.

As Gaben said; "These things, they take time"

author: {'steamid': '76561198146701850', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 20314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1562340522}
review:
The game feels great. Honestly the best Battle Royal game I've ever played. It offers more of a realism aspect compared to Fortnite, which I heavily prefer. My only negative comments for the game is the hackers. There have been numerous occassions when i will die from someone using ESP, No recoil, and even no clip hacks. Another thing i dislike is the fact I'm always in a lobby full of chinese players. As an American user, I'd prefer to play with people from my region; people who speak English and have similar ping as me. There is nothing more frustrating, besides the hackers, than being killed by a person who is lagging everywhere and yelling "China number 1". VPNs could still be used to get around a Region Lock, but on top of Region locking, being involved in a game with players who have similar ping will defently resolve my issues. The hackers are pathetic, but they'll eventually die out or be banned. 

Great game, I just hope there's some major tweaks to the matchmaking!

author: {'steamid': '76561198208429155', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1545605049}
review: Although some people may say that this game is expensive, I think that PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is worth it if you enjoy battle royales and you have someone to play it with. Whether you play competitively, scavenging loot from houses and killing off enemies, or mess around by dropping into big cities and "Superman punching" people, this game is a blast. I have Fortnite, but this game offers a way different experience in the same genre of video games that I personally like more. With two unique maps and many different vehicles and guns, PUBG is definitely something I've had a lot of fun with. I will say though that if you don't have someone that you will playing with most of the time it won't be nearly as fun, because you will either be playing solo or with a team of strangers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022826309', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 29, 'last_played': 1575360860}
review:
First time writing reviewer here. Don't really care to write reviews much but I feel like I should in this case. 

I'm not going to deny the fact that the developers were wrong during the early stages of this game (game release date onward). It was clear that they weren't focused on fixing the game itself and more so focused on generating revenue through ingame purchases. However, you have to understand that BlueHole was originally a company that made cellphone games. So, ingame purchases is pretty much second nature to them. 

I understand people are upset about this but too much of the current and former player base are being too salty about what happened. If you weren't so salty and have been following up on patch notes- you can really tell they have changed the direction of their developers. Yeah, they made the pass a purchasable thing but you don't HAVE to buy it. Why do people complain about ingame purchases when you don't have to buy them. A lot of people are ignorant and believe that a one time purchase can fund an entire company forever is rediculous.

IMO PUBG deserves more positive ratings because they shouldn't be judged on their past. :)

I used to get ~100 frames with similar settings but AA and Post-Processing: on very low. But recently, I've tried setting my graphic settings higher and I still maintain high fps through the entire game. 

TL;DR 
Game used to be really buggy aka rubberbanding
Game has been optimized
Runs smoothly (sometimes slight lag in extremely crowded landing areas)
Devs are focused on fixing the game
I love this game i hope more people play it :D

Specs:
i7-6700
EVGA GTX-980
16gb DD4 Ram
250gb Samsung SSD
1TB harddrive
Windows 10

Averaging 110+ fps

Settings:
AA: med
PP: high
shadow: very low
detail: high
effects: medium
view distance: very low
foilage: very low

ty for reading my review <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198073383004', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1562753992}
review:
Ohh....Playerunknown's Battlegrounds....a love and hate story. This game is phenomenal. It gives you all the things u want from the battle royale genre. Is the best right now. First i will say the pros of this game.
PROS:
-Action, a lot of it.
-Beautifull graphics if u are playing on a GTX 1080, but still pretty good graphics even if u don't play on maximum.
-Joy, a lot of joy when u win a game.
-A lot of funn with your friends when you are playing squad.
-Challenging.
-The price is good. ( 30euros )
-Good updates.

CONS:
First i want to mention that i haven't got lag issues, I can't say about yourself so I am not going to mention this problem.
-Sometimes buggy mechanics
-You are going to rage quit... a lot... .
-A lot of hackers, this is a big problem that from my perspective is ruining the game.

That's my review on PUBG. Is worth playing it and if you will love it. And it got out of early alpha. ( 8/10 )

author: {'steamid': '76561198029394979', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1526162558}
review: Very Nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198068701615', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 79321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2443, 'last_played': 1575796646}
review:
Aight so I used to hate on this game like most other people back in the day, but the devs have taken the necessary steps to keep fixing things, add new content, more ways to play, and enforce their anti-cheat measures. PUBG is in a good spot right now.
Now and again I still have issues like random crashes or servers that grind to a halt with massive packet loss. Cheaters are rare but still exist. A large amount of players in China still connect to North America servers which leads to desync still being an issue, but this is minor in comparison to how it was just a short while ago.
All in all, PUBG is good again. It may not be able to relive the glory days, but it's still worth playing and it's still fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085505391', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 81495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2033, 'last_played': 1575786703}
review:
PUBG.. I have a little too much time invested in this game. I love it, it's addicting, But what a broken POS. With constant lag issue's that, to be fair, are improving a little with every update, it's amazing it made it this far and got as popular as it did. The netcode/optimization issues are finally being listened to a little bit, but i personally feel with the money they have made most of those problems should be fixed by now if not perfected.This most recent update basically changed the game completely. Just when everyone got used to the last update they drastically changed things again. Now micro transaction? We all saw this coming.. It's only a matter of time before that one big BR title is going to come out and swallow PUBG whole. Fortnite hurt numbers bad enough as it is.

With that being said though, and the player base still somewhat holding strong. For the price I say it's worth it. It can be thrilling and fun, but also raging and toxic. Beware certain Discords, don't let bad communities ruin your expirience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970688828', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 130665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3001, 'last_played': 1575768242}
review:
I first heard about this game about a week before the early access release back in december 2017. I immidiatly falled in love with the Battle Royal concept, being on a plane with 99 other guys, and know that only one of us would still be standing up at the end of the game. The first time I played the game (the day of the release), I remember that I had that feeling, telling myself, "this is huge" .... The last time in my life I had a such great feeling was the first time I played Counter Strike (Alpha version) back in 1999, I told myself this game is special. Ok, to be honest, I may have told myself the same thing the first time I played GTA... But honnestly, I haven't played any game in my life that much I played Counter Strike, and I am quite sure that PUBG is here for a long time. 
What I love with PUBG is that I can run a game in solo whenever I want to play, and I don't need to rely on any third people... Random teamates use to be a mess... I love even more when I play the game in squad, with some friends, and that's what initially loved in Counter Strike, the team play.
Now many people complain about this game at the eSport level being too random... I agree that that part is still a problem at a high competition level, but when it come to have fun, you will for sure enjoy this game for a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996762280', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1528405892}
review:
PUBG is a BatteRoyale game in which the only remaining player or team wins the game. The two maps are 8x8Km and start with 100 players who drop in with only the clothes on their back. More maps will be released including a 4x4Km one.

   I first played PUBG when it was still in early access and I was absolutely thrilled to play a game where the length of your weapon counts and suppressors don’t lower your damage. Mechanics such as bullet drop, bullet penetration, and leaning (peeking) are also present. The damage model is a bit simplistic. With time the game got a much better netcode and it’s a lot more optimized, but it’s still not very good. I love that they added the option of double tapping lean (peek) to make it toggled. Another thing that I really liked, is that there is another fire stance besides the classic hip fire and ADS, where you just hip fire more accurately while trading away speed. But even now you are being forced out of ADS when you get too close to objects like walls, door frames, etc.; I think, at the very least, there should be an option to just prevent movement instead of forcing you out of aiming when there is no room to move. The way maps are deigned works well for PvP, but it’s very nonsensical and look unfinished. Vehicle physics is still wacky. Gameplay wise it’s not that exciting, except maybe if you get in the last 10, or 3. A lot of matches will be you running around for 15 minutes, ending when a player gets the drop on you or after a short firefight. Time to kill is very low but it can be increased a bit with armor.

 Rating: Chicken, chicken, this game’s not the winner.

http://pixelloot.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198163830465', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 18131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18, 'last_played': 1574982497}
review:
This game is as fun as you want it to be. Yes, it can annoying when you don't find good loot or when you do you get killed almost right after. Or if you are doing really well and then you get lagged out of the game or if it takes forever to join a match. I also get that the voice chat can sometimes be a bit overwhelming and some times slightly racist - Whilst all of these factors (especially the last one) need work, the game is still fun when you're playing with your friends and even if you die in a stupid, angering inducing way, the game makes you wanna think "what should I have done instead" and then when you play another match, you remember that. This game is a learning curve and just take some practice =)

So much potential!

review:
Been playing for over a year now, still has the best shooting mechanics of any shooter period. The game has received a lot of updates and has become more optimized. At this point the only thing to complain about is the grenade meta and how it's still a difficult game to get into if you're new. 

No other BR gets my heart pumping as much as this one in the last zone. 

This is still best BR experience especially when you have a good team. I don't care what people say about it, it's still one of the top played games on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839616714', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 28296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 430, 'last_played': 1575665157}
review:
I know this game gets a ton of hate for being a cash grab, but since I first played it, I was hooked. It is by far the most replayable game I have every owned. The only game that I got even close to playing as much was Battlefield 1, but even then, I played PUBG far more. I originally owned the game on an Xbox One X, but it was an absolute mess playing it on that. The game was locked at 30 fps and crashed constantly because it would overheat my Xbox. Also, you can imagine how difficult playing a game like PUBG is on a controller with no aim assist. Still, I had a ton of fun playing it on the Xbox and put around 150 hours into it on that. Playing on PC has been spectacular though. Playing it in 1440p at around 110 fps is a night and day difference to the Xbox. The visuals might not match some other AAA titles, but they are close. It is good to see that Bluehole is still refining the game by adding new weapons and switching up weapons like the M16, UMP, and Vector while adding the MP5K. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198119507059', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573872595}
review: Despite what everyone else is saying, I really like this game. For everyone saying the netcode is terrible and there are constant crashes, I don't know what your specific problem is, but I really haven't had many of these issues. For me, the netcode isn't perfect, but it gets the job done. People say they are always dying behind walls, I haven't had this issue. People are saying that the hit detection always misses hits for them, I haven't had this issue. For me, I either hit them, or just flat out miss my shot altogether. Maybe PUBG just really likes me and just hates everyone else, but I haven't had most of these problems, and the ones that I had earlier have somewhat gone away. I personally say go for it, and if you'rehaving problems refund it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429580862', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1549813815}
review: AAAAAAHHH where to start. This game is great, or it has the potential to be incredible. the game play is great (apart from the flying cars and lack of cars, just my opinion). The guns i think are good, not great because the shotguns are just damn awful, the assault rifles are slightly overpowered but nothing to cry about. But this game is massively infuriating, imagine just waiting for a game  to start and then you're stuck with a black screen and then you have to close the game then open. Dont even get me started on the damn lag when im jumping from one crate to another and i end up on the ground and find myself punching my screen. but despite all these faults and infuriating flaws which the developers take a damn long time fixing, despite all this I can't help but recommend this game because its brilliant. So rewarding, so hard to master and when you pair up with someone its just hella fun or if you want to take on the world alone go for it, even more rewarding. so i should'nt recommend this but i have to, its simply too much fun (but don't get me wrong this game is hella broke).

author: {'steamid': '76561198182947213', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1533100354}
review:
First off, this game is good. But it depends on how what you think is "good".

If you like: Somewhat slow paced, but not too slow, somewhat buggy, but very playable, somewhat bullshit, but really satisfying, then this is your game.

This game is an imperfect beast, it's a misbred donkey, it's an oddball. It's a game that many people like and love, like I do. There are many that dislike/hate this game. I am not one of those people. Just know that you can say what you want about this game. 

So why am I saying all this? To let you know that the opinion/controversy surrounding this game is immense, but once you get past all that, it's home free baby!

In conclusion, you decide how you like this game. I'll let you decide whether you're willing to deal with all of this game's imperfections to get to the core of it: A game with a good concept and with somewhat good developers behind it. Have fun everyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055652126', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 19014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 61, 'last_played': 1574775123}
review:
Launch was definately a breath of fresh air. It was just the right kick to get me back into the game. After many deaths due to unbalanced gameplay. The game itself does FEEL like a full release game. Menus are flashier, Menu theme actually sounds like music, and the new map brings out new playstyles from both new and veteran players. 
The one thing that makes me still very angry about this game is the lock on custom games/private games.
You might be saying "But wait, you can join other custom games right?" 
Technically yes, but im saying that if its going to be a full release, why is it that I cant make a smaller custom game for just me and my friends to play on? Why is it that the PUBG Partners are still the only ones able to make locked 1v1 custom games. There is no real reason from the dev as to why players cant access custom/private matchmaking from the release of 1.0. So until that feature (FINALLY) gets added to the public. My review will just be a 4/5
Why?
Because sure, the game is still fun to play, 
but locking out a function of the game when its supposed to be the "Official launch", just makes me feel like this is still an early access game. 
However, with that asside its still very much playable, and still does give me alot of enjoyment. So I will still recommend this game to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045860867', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564093564}
review:
My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother told him that if he ever wanted to see his grandchildren grow up and graduate, you have to stop immediately. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what was at stake, he gave up smoking immidiately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was realy sad and it destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke, please don't put your family through what your grandfather put us through" I agreed. At 20,I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.










But please...Region lock this game...

review:
It's fun. 

Yes, there are bugs. Yes, there needs to be some optimization. Yes, some of the game mechanics need tweaked. 

Is it better than that crap game Fortnite? By a mile. Unless you're a 12 year old boy, PUBG is the better game. Feel free to try Fortnite, but don't expect it to be anywhere near as good as PUBG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268759179', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1535547910}
review:
After playing more the 100 hours of this chaotic game I can finally make a short and simple review.
Since my pc is cheap and everything in it is outdated i get some performance issues, but the new client really boost my fps and I can actually shoot my gun at enemies. The bullet drop in this game is hard to learn not mentioning the actual guns and their mechanics but if you learn that you can shit on some newbies. If you drop in popular areas and kill your way out of it you are 70% to be ready to kill anyone else in that game, going for drops is risky but beneficial and playing with friends is more fun then solos actually all the games that i won were duos or squads.
So i can say if you dont mind dying alot but at the end winning some insane games this game is for you if you dont like preformance issues in online games or bullshit driving mechanics dont bother trying this game all in all fuck this game but also praise this unexpected blessing from the gods
very nice/very nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198023968618', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 19317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1556711063}
review:
For a $30 game it's amazing.
For a game picked up by multi-million dollar companies for branding, it's awful.
For a game made by a small team over a short period, it's riveting.
For a game that's made as much money as it has, it's atrocious.
For a game that is a core Battle Royale it's incredible.
For a game that's first code seems written last week, it's glitchy.
For a game that I have spent so much time on, it's addictive.
For a game that has wasted so much of people's lives, it's shallow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228116076', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 24339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16, 'last_played': 1575573038}
review:
So, this was my very first experience at the "Battle Royale" genre. I used to play CS and my friends gifted me this game on my birthday and i've been enjoying it ever since, yes at the start there were bugs crashes here and there but presently this game is amazing, the excitment when playing this game is unreal, the fear you get in the beggining when you are a noob and hear a shot its all so amazing. Now that i have around 150hrs or so, i feel really confident playing this game. and i won't lie but i am addicted to this. So for $29.99 or Rs 999 this game is all worth your money. A HUGE THUMBS UP FROM ME, GOOD JOB PLAYER UNKNOWN.
P.S. i get around 75-80 fps on custom settings on my Gtx 750ti With Ryzen5 1600.
Settings: Anti Aliasing- High, View Distance- High and everything else low.  I can go a bit higher on the shadows and what not but i would rather have more fps than good graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028908644', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573932230}
review:
I love the game! Of course after the launch of 1.0 the rubber banding thing appeared, but thats not so much to worry about, because it happens only in approximately the first minute, then its almost completely gone, return perhaps a few times after that, but thats quite unnoticable to be honest.

Yeah we cannot choose the map, and the desert map is the most frequent now, but we got to assume it is because, the glitches on the map need to be detected as fast as possible and fix 'em.

Overall don't listen to anybody saying pubg is unplayable after 1.0 patch, it definitely is and i'm pretty sure it'll just become better and better

Edit:
There is now a possibility to choose your desired map, and the third one is in progress :)

review:
Absolutely amazing! Visuals are stunning, and gameplay is smooth.
Even anyone with medium settings are still getting buttery smooth gameplay and the visuals to accompany it.
The gunplay is fairly balanced, and the mechanics and animations are great!

NOTE: I have heard that there is a fair amount of hackers, so be cautious as to who you're playing with.
Possibly anti-cheat update? Good game otherwise. Would Recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170047625', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 23167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572980638}
review:
To be honest. after  350 hrs of playtime this game is truely still the best Battle Royale game in my oppionion.
Pros:
-3 Maps
-Hillarious community
-Good servers
-Great Graphics
-All in all very fun (Best played with friends)

Cons: 
-Occasionally Still buggy interface and main lobby screen
-Sometimes it takes a while to get matched. Depends on where you live / what time it is

To be honest thats all.
PUBG is and will be the greatest RB game atleast for the next couple months or years.
The "Fix PUBG" campaign Blue company started after they realized how broken the game was at around April 2018 was a great success and Really gave top improvements in all ways to the game
I would 10/10 buy this game again if i had to.
Enjoyable and perfect for timefilling.

Thanks for Reading

author: {'steamid': '76561198052639629', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565733491}
review:
----- Update -----
With the servers being updated and the tick-rate being adress, being shot behind walls happens way less.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I only play FFP so that may be why I never really saw any hackers. But in my hours of play I can only remember one person who I could say was for sure hacking. As of yesterday, (1/25/18) it seems like the devs VAC banned many hackers as the hackers are claiming to be banned unfairly on the forums.

This game is no where near "ready for e-Sports" as you can take damage just from entering a car. The servers are also the worst of any game I have played.  The tick-rate needs to be taken care of... not asking for 60Hz server just a stable one so the game is more predictable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189596078', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19, 'last_played': 1575051119}

Is this game unfinished?
Yes.

Yes.

Also yes.

review: Do you want a game where accuracy is everything? Where strategy pays off and earning in-game credit actually gives you rewards for spending hours and hours of playing? A game where people on english servers actually speak english? Well F#CK dont play thiss piece of shit. The developers are only financially motivated. I still enjoy it though, beter than fortnite.

review: If you like the typical but good battle royale genre games then this is the game for you. It has it's moments of "Boring-ness" sometimes, but at the same time, every game is random. You don't know how it would play out. I recommend this game if you really REALLY want a battle royale game. Keep in mind, the optimization is kinda "Okay to good-ish",  It can also earn you a few dollars because you can sell the crates and its loot at the Steam market place. Overall I rate this game 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197974085338', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1539656116}
review:
PUBG is a very frustrating game to love. The physics and gameplay mechanics feel great, and it has a stealthy, tense quality that many other battle royale games lack. That kind of slow-paced, very intense gameplay is why I play and love PUBG.

However, the developers have...strange priorities, to say the least. That the game still runs this poorly so long after its EA launch is absolutely unacceptable. The microtransactions are un-fun and useless, all the skins are boring, and the event pass is honestly insulting.

But again, it offers an incredibly fun kind of BR experience that is hard to find elsewhere right now.

If you do buy this game, understand a few things:
1) It is very, very difficult at first
2) It will likely not run great on your computer if you have anything less than an i5 6000 or Ryzen and a GTX 1060/RX 480
3) You will have to put up with unpatched bugs and terrible optimization for what appears to be the life of the game.

If, like me, you can accept these faults because PUBG is such a unique battle royale experience, then you will have a great time. If the realistic feel isn't as important to you, or if you have no patience for bad developer choices, there are far better BR games available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412874183', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565647771}
review:
[b]TLDR: Graphically and Audibly Pleasing, Fun and Challenging, Must buy for the Battle Royale Fans out there[/b]

[u]GRAPHICS[/u]

Visually PUBG is pretty impressive, even on very low settings for all graphic options the game still looks clean and well designed, players blend into the environment making for a tense and thrilling ambience especially in the closing moments of a game. what makes PUBG the best battle royale for me is the less cartoony feel you get playing it as opposed to other games in the genre such as fortnite and H1Z1

[u]AUDIO[/u]

If i had posted this review a month ago my conclusion would have been needs some help. but now after some changes and seeing the further improvments on the test server i can safely say to you the sound has been polished to a reasonable standard now, cars sound like cars and not a french guy snoring into a vaccum cleaner, you can now more easily distinguish were the hell you are being shot from rather than hearing a shot come from in front of you when it is infact behind you, all in all the sound quality has improved and its a welcome improvment.

[u]GAMEPLAY[/u]

Until you have been killed by a naked pan weilding maniac blaring "All Star" through his mic you have not experienced this game to its full potential. the tense combat moving from cover to cover always wary of that fucker somewhere 400+ meters away with a kar98k and an 8x scope taking pop shots at your half hp no team mates alive ass is what makes this game amazing. there is a reward to be had for playing any way you want also! fancy hiding from fights and ambushing people? go ahead! you'll get less loot but you will make it to the top 10 spot more often than one of those nuts rushing into the centre of a warzone to pick up that extra loot and armour. All in all this game is Broken, Unoptomized and Buggy as heck but sometimes thats what creates the magic and i love it!

GIVE IT A FUCKIN PLAY ALRIGHT!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996908267', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 71597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 850, 'last_played': 1575748139}
review:
Despite what others may say, this is still probably the best battle royale game in existence for a number of reasons:

1. Competitive player base, feel rewarded for getting those kills that you do.
2. Realistic gun interaction, recoil is appropriate for each gun and most guns actually hurt.
3. Lots of content, more guns and maps than any other BR to boot.
4. Constant improvement, the game is being developed on a regular basis and receives updates to improve performance and an official release is still around the corner.
5. You can use a winchester lever action and get kills.

All in all a very satisfying game. Accept no imposter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053737158', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 10152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1521524324}
review:
Like most people, I played PUBG in it's beta. It's a solid game that has gotten some real Quality of life updates over the last year. I feel bad for Blue Hole in that this game didn't get to actually have a beta. It's completely impossible to keep up with the tens of thousands of bug reports and make meaningful changes from that input. 

To their credit, I feel like Blue Hole really tries to listen to the community and make well informed updates and form their game the way they deem correct. From a gameplay perspective, it's incredibly basic and occasionally janky, but you don't play a game like this for the mechanics alone. You play it so you can watch a random Chinese guy blasting slayer through his ingame chat single handedly kill your entire squad with a 1911 and a slight breeze when you had lv. 3 Helmet and Vests, then watch the death cam for 20 minutes before eventually swearing and hitting the report button out of jealousy. 
It's a game where you create your own fun through experiences, and I think that's an awesome thing to share with your friends.
9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014662459', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1546126771}
review:
Things I would like to say to Bluehole:

Fix your netcode and do the same thing I've asked a previous employer to do, and that is to regional lock by geolocation their online service to prevent fraud (which they eventually did well after I left).  

In this case fraud is the equivalent to exploits and hack tools.

For netcode help please refer to DICE fixing Battlefield 4.  I know it's an EA game, but your company just made money that EA dreams of making with their failed AAA titles.

Otherwise this game is kind of amazing in all game modes.

review:
Do you like video games?
Specifically; do you like shooter games?

Now, do you also like gambling?
Finally, do you also like to rage not at your own actions, those of others, and the common absurdity of the game itself?

If you were nodding your head to any of the above, give "PUBG" here a try.
At least you can try it for just under 2 hours to gather your own opinion.

review: I have played this game for a while now. Not really sure what the draw is to this game by so many. I could play this game for 1000hrs and still have the same shit as the new guy? (crates dont count) I do enjoy the game and after playing fortnight for free; I can confirm **THIS** game is worth money in comparison. I have seen a few hackers but there are really good players in here as well so dont cry when you die. The developers are doing a good job of continuing to bring more content to the game for free. Overall I would say yes I recommend this game to any of my friends. It had its share of trouble in BETA but its not in beta anymore and the full release is faily solid.

review: This game was, is and will always be a timeless classic. It has it's own feel that cannot be replicated by imposters. Definitely for more mature audiences that don't mind the peace and quiet before the storm, and for those with a sense of humor who can ROFL when they hit some insane bug. Like CounterStrike, we'll be playing PUBG many years into the future. Look forward to the continuing updates.

review:
First of all, I am newer to the game, approximately 20-25 hours into my favorite game mode (Squad TPP). Luckily, I have yet to encounter a hacker. This game is a solid game that forces you to learn quickly. It has a steep learning curve for beginners who have never played any sort of Battly Royale type game before. At first it is super frusterating since there are sooo many people who have many more hours into the game. But the key to this game is to practice. 
I Havent had any server lag issues as of yet. My complaints:
- Bugs, such as your parachute catching the side of a building oddly, dropping a couple of feet and losing half of your health. 
- Playing on a NA server and getting non-english speaking squad mates -.-

UPDATE: 3/31/2018- While I'm currently 101 hours into PUBG and I still suck very much. What is happening? You do an update on something worthless, and the you cant even access the lobby for hours. When you do, your character is #unkown. STOP with the weapon skins, emotes, events. You need to fix your server issues otherwise you will be losing a ton of players! This is almost a daily occurence now and it's incredibly frusterating. DO SOMETHING.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167797021', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1558803769}
review:
• Battle Royale
'PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS' é um jogo em formato 'Battle Royale' onde o objetivo é único, ser o último a sobreviver. Enquanto você tenta sobreviver, você terá que encontrar equipamentos, armamentos e objetos de cura para ajudar-te na batalha, que consecutivamente você terá que matar para sobreviver. Explore o mapa gigantesco enquanto o gás/raio faz a área diminuir para juntar os jogadores sobreviventes em uma pequena área para a batalha final. O jogo conta com vários veículos para ajudar na sua locomoção, desde carros e barcos.
PUBG possui também o modo "DUO" e "PARTY".

Duo: Você e mais um jogador farão uma dupla para tentar sobreviver.
Party: Você e mais três jogadores farão uma equipe para tentar sobreviver.

Além disso tudo, PUBG também possui o esquema de salas customizadas, tendo como jogar o modo "Zumbi" e um modo onde pode-se ter uma equipe de até oito jogadores.

O defeito maior do jogo é a renderização e otimização do mapa, é constate quando alguém está jogando e se depara com as estruturas não estando carregadas, isso para alguns, pode ser que seu inimigo que caiu perto de você já tenha o local carregado e pegue uma arma e te mate, não dando chance para você.
Notas
Gráficos: 3/5
Mapa: 3/5
Jogabilidade: 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197973018704', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 241, 'last_played': 1575673741}
review: I would advise not to play close attention to the recent negative critical reception from other users on Steam - while this game is not perfect or did not lay the foundation for the Battle Royale Genre, it DID set a new standard for games that fall into the same category. Since this game has phased out of beta sometime late 2017, the game has received tremendous updates and attention from developer PUBG Corporation. They have paid attention to fan inquiries regarding the adjusting of weapons, they have renovated previous weapons accessories like scopes, they added new weapons, vehicles, maps, modes, rehauled the main menu interface, fixed bugs, glitches, etc. and people still find a reason to complain or cry about the game not exceeding expectations. While the game still has its fair share of bugs, glitches, server-related issues, hackers, exploits, etc. its really worth noting how many issues had been addressed from previous version. Do not let any of the bugs or glitches discourage you from playing this game - any massive open-world game is prone to having them until adjustments have been made from initial public release. This game is an excellent choice and is a title worth having in your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208763283', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 50818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 256, 'last_played': 1574908785}
review:
After getting every achievement in this game and playing for over 650 hours, it's time I review this. When I first heard of Battle Royale, I was instantly interested. PUBG was my first Battle Royale, and today it remains the only Battle Royale that I consistently play and that can keep me hooked. When I first started playing PUBG, I was instantly drawn in. Getting into the end game and realizing you have a shot at winning is a feeling like no other -- palms sweaty and all of that. The brutal realism of this game just makes it unlike any other. Unlike Blackout, Apex, and Fortnite, making a mistake is extremely punishing in this game. Positioning and discipline is everything, not just raw skill. The guns and armor are incredibly balanced, unlike other games. I can't explain how frustrating it is to go against someone with gold armor in Apex and know that you have barely any chance. The low TTK in this game makes it unlike any other Battle Royale. 

Despite what other players may say about the playerbase diminishing due to bugs, lack of features, or cheaters (all of which are in the best state they've ever been in), I think it's more that the playerbase stabilized. Like I said, this is an extremely punishing Battle Royale. Especially if you don't have a squad to play with, mistakes are very harsh and the people that are still playing this game in mid-2019 are very experienced. I've been playing this game since it was in early access in early 2017, and I can say that it's harder for me to get a win now than it was a year ago, because of the players that are still around. This game was what kicked off The Battle Royale craze, so a lot of people purchased this based on hype rather than intense research on whether or not they would actually enjoy this or not. Surprise surprise, a lot of people didn't enjoy it, and the player base actually dropped, as most new releases do.

This game is definitely not for everyone, and of course my experience with this game is subjective, but this is my favorite FPS of all time. The gunplay is extremely well-made, every aspect of it. The recoil, the looks of the weapons, the noises, the gun playing this game is simply better than any other game I've ever played. Four maps all of which are a different size and different terrain give this game a lot of variety. It's pretty easy to meet friends on here too -- even if you are a solo player, you can meet some great people in duos and squads. If you can get over the learning curve, this is truly an experience unlike any other, and this game is around stay for a very long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144377938', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 84495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 254, 'last_played': 1575258250}
review: PUBG has probably been my greatest investment of my Steam Library. This game has an atmosphere that not many other have. As a Battle Royale, the game allows for a large variety of playstyles, and after the most recent update which added ledge grabbing, explodable gas cans, an armored vehicle which is basically a tank, I haven't found myself having this much fun since when I first bought this game. Just as all games are, this game can make you salty, you could spend 10 minutes looting and all of a sudden you've been headshot by a KAR-98K. GAME OVER. If you're a person who likes the adrenaline, hot dropping is always an option. Strategic like me? Bushes are your friends. Learn to accept, and love the environment that this game provides, and to top it off talk with your enemies in voice chat, and I guarantee you will love this game. Play it for fun, and treat it like a game, that's all I ask for you to enjoy it.
