author: {'steamid': '76561197990930573', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 91992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 141, 'last_played': 1575174063}
review: I am frustrated with this game. I sometimes get long waits to join and it annoys me. I sometimes get thrown into a server in Asia and my teammates don't even try to communicate with me (not so much that they can't speak my language, but that I was put there in the first place). That annoys me. I have been playing FPSes for over 15 years. I've played with some incredibly good people who practiced several hours daily. I think I have a pretty good idea when someone is playing straight or when they are doing some fairly impossible shooting. It annoys me that some of those people are still playing.  But when I do report those people I'm pretty sure aren't legit, I have a decent record of the Devs actually banning those people. I appreciate their involvement and their communication back to me that my concerns were addressed. This game beats up on my video card, but it is by far one of the better looking FPSes I've ever played. I wish that this game didn't give such an advantage to people who are able to spend much more money on their rig than I am willing to do, but it is what it is. I hold this game to a higher standard than most, but I do that because I really do like this game. I criticize this game just like I do any other game that I see a lot of potential in. But I would completely recommend it to anyone who prefers semi-realism to cartoon character battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965556207', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 9289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564243282}
review: PUBG Corp is a crappy money grubbing company and yes they suck.  However, I am reviewing the game, not the company that made it.  The game is fun, tied with Squad and Post Scriptum for my favorite multiplayer shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025547326', 'num_games_owned': 1033, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 32854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573750206}
review:
This is the most difficult recommend I've given.

On one hand, the game has it's fair share of problems. Vehicles bug out and kill your squad, people shoot you from behind walls, textures don't load sometimes, the game is rampant with hackers, the devs have a penchant for being greedy.

On the other hand, it's still so much fun, and there's no other Battle Royale experience like it, especially with friends.

I've tried plenty of Battle Royale games, H1Z1, Totally Accurate Battlegrounds, Fortnite, but none of them hit the feeling PUBG gives me. The bad stuff nearly doesn't bother me as much as you'd think when it boils down to it. The game doesn't require additional purchases to play (not that I'm advocating a cosmetic-only system in a game that costs $40 already), the textures not loading and people shooting through walls happens maybe once in 20 matches for me, and you can use the buggy vehicles for some pretty dumb things.

There's the feeling you get when you win as well. Maybe I just get it because I don't win a lot but it's still refreshing and exhilarating when you kill the last person, and you can ride that high for the rest of the play session with your friends.

That's the other point, this game is WAY more fun with friends, especially good friends. Finding all the attachments to tweak a gun to your preference, moving through the map as a group, calling out flanks and positions, it's a nice feel to it.

This game won't be for everyone. Some people can't look past the bad and it's fine. Some people are more suited for the faster playstyles of Fortnite or H1Z1 and that's fine, but for me, PUBG is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350518711', 'num_games_owned': 7, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1548128923}
review:
The biggest mistake most people make is spending way too long looting. instead of endangering yourself by overlooting looking for a kar or whatever, its better to go on the hunt as soon as you have a helmet/vest/AR. Let other people do the drudge work.

If you see a vehicle pulled up to a cluster of houses, sneak up and camp the vehicle. kill the enemy team when they hop in to move on.

Personally I think vehicles are deathtraps and should only be used to outrun an encroaching circle or in the very early game

author: {'steamid': '76561198111580425', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1568883109}
review:
Still a very broken game you die by a UMP-9 from 300m just like when the game first came out. it takes 10 years to get into a start lobby and when youre lobby is full you have to wait another minute for some reason. The plane also takes ten years to fly across the map which really sucks because by  the time you get to where you want to land some one is already on the ground fully geared and all you can find is a pistol or a crowbar. The RNG in this game is complete garbage. Oh and you need two 1080TI's to run this game on high and to get 60+ FPS. The servers this game runs on are also garbage, on your screen you shoot a guy 30 times, on the his? you shot him once or twice. I hate this game, I'm pretty sure this game will be dead by the time BF5 comes out, so.... Oh and dont forget this game will crash on you for no reason, so be prepared for that. 

Buy it

author: {'steamid': '76561198408930809', 'num_games_owned': 1, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 54859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1530346243}
review:
다 좋다 그러나 아직도 끊이지않는 핵쟁이들과 거기에 투쟁하는 깨끗한 유저들 사이에서 운영자는 아무것도 할줄 모른다는 생각이든다.

좀 더 재밌고 깨끗한 게임이되기 위해서는 운영자가 노력을 해야한다. 운영부분에선 다소 실망을 감추지 못하지만 게임자체는 재미가 넘친다. 따라서 나의 개인적인 입장으로는 추천을 하고싶다. 

게임의 핵을 전부 소멸시키고 쓸데없는 패치를 줄인다면 더 멋있는 게임으로 평가받을것이다.
내가 말한 쓸데없는 패치중에서는 대표적인 예로 감정표현을 짚고 넘어가고 싶다.

다만 배틀그라운드는 내가 경험한 스팀게임중에서 가장 최고로 흥행하였으며 지금도 흥행하고 앞으로 더욱더 흥행할 것 이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999011385', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1553517254}
review: "The free fall is fast (140km) my shute opens as I aim towards a small group of run down houses. One is two story so I make a B line for this. My pulse it a little high as I know someone jumped in near me I just lost sight of them when I hit the ground. Listing for the ever present nail biting threat I pick up an MSG. I like it, its small and agile with a full auto fire mode. I get backpack level 2 I'm happy. I proceed to loot the other 3 buildings presuming the other person has left in another direction. Upon heading up the road I eventually find a van which is great as the circle is a long hike from where I am. Jumping in my elation turns to dark humor as the darn thing struggles to make the hill which would not even tax the heftiest of humans, in the end we make it to the top just before another van comes screaming (fast walk) along the road I am about to drive onto. He/she jumps out & into a small shed, I could just drive past but I decide to put a few rounds into the shed to ensure they stay there for a moment so I can roll my van down the hill to the now much smaller circle. I see 4 small buildings and head for them. Hiding inside I get lucky by no small margin as the circle comes to me, I have an AK now but no attachments however I picked up a silencer for my SMG, looks great. I watch out the window as the last 4 engage in battle and then proceed to jump out and crawl thru the rather dismal amount of grass in the desert. I have just made it too one side of the road just hidden in the grass and I see my pray hiding behind a tree and I am sure they have no idea where I am. 1, 2, 3 grenades the a molotov and they are flushed out I whip up my SMG and blatt away full auto with sweat upon my brow and a slight twitch to my right eye I nail them. I won after playing 31 losses I get my first win thus starting an insatiable need for more chicken and the sheer nerve rattling thrill that is PUBG" Simply put a great game for an edge of the seat ride where your next move could be your last.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148568991', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1564196510}
review:
*sigh*

Alright, this game is really fun, but the sheer amount of hackers in 8/10 games is rediculous. I love this game, but China needs to at least be addressed. Region lock, better anticheat, something. It's a love hate relationship with PUBG, and that's not just me. SO MANY people want to enjoy this game but the sheer amount of cheaters is insane. Otherwise it's really fucking fun, like, really fun. I'm gonna reccomend it, but if you're thinking on buying it, be aware of the amount of hackers, yet you can still have a lot of fun by yourself or with friends, just don't expect to win every game until the cheating is addressed.


| 7/10 |

| 9/10 | if the hacking problem was solved or at least decreased.

The developers seem to also be active in updates and patches, and if you are smart enough you can make money off of this game. author: {'steamid': '76561198024729930', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 39007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 43, 'last_played': 1575041223}
review:
This game has something no game yet has been able to nail with it's exactly right bit of realism and an exceptional FPS feel combined with the battle royale ruleset. 

Every run is a different story with a different arc and no game ever has had me feel the way I do when I'm fighting in the final ring for that chicken.

The game has some technical issues out of 1.0, but the speed at which the developers have been fixing these proves to me that you will get your money's worth in the next year regardless of if those issues get immediately fixed or not. The game is 100% worth it's price even in it's current state.

Note to people reading reviews on this game on Steam: This game has an absurdly toxic community of reviewers playing it for thousands of hours and giving negative reviews because they [u]mix feedback with reviews[/u]. Consider this a corrective review for all the misguided ones in here!

If you like FPS games and super intense PVP fights and you don't mind a learning curve - this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964423945', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 24564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565142770}
review:
I've been playing PUBG for about 8 months now.

The community is toxic as hell.
The gameplay isn't perfect (but it's gotten loads better.)
It's gonna do for now, but something better is almost certainly going to come along and eat its lunch.

But until then, I'm gonna keep playing, having fun, and keeping public voice chat muted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113344676', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 46624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565102137}
review:
Alright, I've played this for a bit now, and here's my thoughts.

It's a good game. The gameplay, the balance, and the movement are all good, I think.
The firefights, especially when you're in the top 10, are intense, and as you get used to the maps and building layouts you can use a lot of flanking routes and so on, making it more tactical as you get better.

There are some issues though. The main problem is that they made it 1.0 too quickly. I played the test server for 20 hours or so before they upgraded it to 1.0, and I simply don't see enough issues fixed. The most important one, where the game crashed due to bad_module or something, was fixed, but another very important one, in my mind, was rubberbanding.

At the beginning of a round, there is a massive issue with rubberbanding (being teleported backwards every now and then), which is irritating and occasionally enraging, when you land next to someone and get teleported away from the weapon as you both go for it, leaving him to get it and kill you instantly , which is not something I'd see as acceptable outside of early access. It was bothersome then, intolerable now. 
They should have fixed this before launch, even if they were feeling deadline pressures. They've already sold hundreds of thousands of copies - there is no real reason to fear the game would flop just because they pushed back the date a few weeks, especially if they announced the reasons. Could even spin it as a "We don't want to become a Mass Effect Andromeda" thing.

But they went ahead, which is dumb.

Beyond that first part though, the game is good. Confusing at first, since you don't know where to loot and where to go, but as you learn (or look up) what the better places and strategies are, you'll find yourself getting better and more confident.

I'd also like to adress the possible misinterpretation caused by watching streamers before buying the game. When someone like Shroud, Forsen, DrDisrespect, etc. is playing, they'll routinely get 20+ kills. This might lead someone to believe the game is more action packed than it is, since you're not actually likely to see more than 15  people throughout a round.
The reason these people get that many more kills is that when they're streaming, people watch them, and try to get on their server and kill them, leading to them meeting far more other players than you would in an average match. 
The streamers are very good at the game, obviously, but the killcount gives a skewed impression of the game. Just something to keep in mind.

Despite the rubberbanding issue, which is the main negative, I recommend the game. It's good fun, especially when playing with friends, and the firefights are intense and leave you thirsty for more. Hope they fix the rubberbanding soon.
________________________________________________________________________
EDIT

Alrighty, since I reviewed this they've fixed the rubberbanding, so honestly I just recommend it flat out. It's especially fun if you play duo/squad mode with friends with discord/skype, but solo is fun too.
The only things you can buy with real money are keys to cosmetics chests, so it's not remotely pay to win, and I only occasionally have issues with getting randomly disconnected, not noticeably more than with any other game I play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989398617', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1547646925}
review:
Great game to play with friends. 
Its okey solo too, but imo better with a friend or 3. 

Get ready to be frustrated tho, like all shooters you will feel like there are hackers whenever you die, but its unlikely. 
The gameplay is pretty fast, so you can easily get some games in even if you dont have that much time to play.

My tip is to use headphones with high volume, so you can hear footsteps.
Might also be worth practising your aim if you are not used to pc shooters. No auto aim here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040055666', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573914336}
review:
I like to find a sickle and pretend to harvest wheat within the open fields outside Pochiniki and Yasnaya Polyana. As I reap my crops, I like to take in the serenity of the landscape around me and listen to the distant echos of gunfire and the low humming of the cargo planes as they pass overhead all instilling in me a sense of tranquility that no other game has done before. 

I wish the developers could make it so that the sickles can actually cut wheat rather than completely going through them. I believe this would help add some more realism into the game. That is my only complaint, other than that the game is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063439513', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1568757054}
review:
I have a solution here in the text

Sehr gutes Spiel mit noch einigen Bugs,
ich habe dazu ne Lösung hier im Text

Das Spiel läuft für eine Early Acces sehr gut, Ich spiele seit ein paar Wochen nur auf den Test-Servern.
Die EU-Server haben das stärkste Rubberbanging, aber man kann ja einfach auf die NA-Server wechselt. 
Da das Spiel noch in Endwicklung ist, sind Bugs normal.
Mit den Sounds hat man nur Bugs, wenn man nen schlechen Soundchip hat. 
Wenn man den Ton über Grakikkarte mit HDMI-Kabel an einen AV-Receiver gibt hat man Gar keine Sound Bugs.
Nutzt man den Onboard-Sound oder eine Creative-Soundkarte, hört man die Fahrzeuge nicht, wenn die weiter weg sind.
Algemein werden auch dann, wenn sehr viele Geräusche gleichzeitig vorhanden sind, einige ausgblendet, wenn man halt nicht den Ton über die Grafikkarte oder eine ASUS Strix Soundkarte nutzt.
Ich habe es mit verschiedenen Soundkarten ausprobiert und da sind mir dann diese Kombinationen aufgefallen.

The game is running very well for an early acces, I've only been playing on the test servers for a few weeks now.
The EU servers have the strongest rubberbanging, but you can just switch to the NA server.
Since the game is still in development, bugs are normal.
The sounds are only bugs if you have a bad sound chip.
If one gives the sound over Grakikkarte with HDMI cable to an AV receiver one has no sound bugs.
If you use the onboard sound or a creative sound card, you will not hear the vehicles when they are farther away.
In general, even if there is a lot of noise at the same time, some will fade out if you do not use the sound on the video card or an ASUS Strix sound card.
I have tried it with different sound cards and then I noticed these combinations.

review:
By far one of the most addicting games I have ever played.
If you are debating about buying this game, consider the following:

*Do you have a SSD in your computer? cause PUBG will need to be installed on it.
*Can your computer run VR at 120fps? then it should run PUBG at 45fps
*Are you able to dedicate a month of your life to this game? cause its too addicting.
*Do you like the toxic community of DayZ? Its worse here.
*Do you like being sniped across the map by a naked dude with a pistol?
=============================================================

If you said yes to any of the above. BUY THIS GAME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Fortnite is lame PUBG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219428597', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 46851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1571463236}
review: Most of the people that are putting negative reviews are probably the noobs who always die first and doesn't know how to play the game and how pubg actually works. The Devs are doing an amazing job at the game, it isn't perfect and the Devs cannot FIX every problem in the game but they are doing their best to optimize the game for everyone, every game HAS a problem. The only main problem in pubg is mostly hackers, D sync and server issues. Most of the time the game itself runs awesome. Gun play is amazing in this game, it is slow yet a fast pace-arcade gameplay, the best thing about the game is when you land those headshots with a sniper rifle, and I mean IT IS THE BEST FEELING in the game. Pubg WILL tilt you, but if you love the game you will get back on it over and over learning how the game works and what can you do to improve. Overall, this game isn't for people who aren't willingly to take time to learn the game and its mechanics, Pubg is a great BR for those who have a heart to learn the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071347462', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1560630595}
review:
PUBG is a very entertaining shooter. For me it meant a revival of the genre. What I like the most about this game is the realism (at least compared to other shooters); bullet damage is high and aiming is complex ( i still suck while shooting through a scope); expect a slow learning curve. There is strategy in the way you approach an enemy, you can't simply rush to them and spray and pray for the kill, every movement must be made with strategy (at least if you want to get to the final stages of the game). Furthermore, the survival mechanic adds a lot of replayability to the game, there is something so addictive about dropping from a parachute, looting for whatever weapon is available and...surviving. Getting the sweet chicken dinner is very rewarding in such a game. On the downside, there are some games where you'll die within the first 20 seconds of the game. Also, and this is what bothers me the most, are cheaters. Sadly, there are still ots of ways to cheat the game, resulting in frustrating deaths where a player jsut shoots you blindly through a wall. 
Nonetheless, I think it is a game worth buying, I have a lot of fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070928240', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 90481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 72, 'last_played': 1575796147}
review:
Very addictive last man standing gameplay, let down by some long lasting performance issues. Playing with friends is fun and often hillarious. 
The amount of times I lose an engagement because the framerate tanks as soon as I take fire or try to get the jump on someone is fucking rageworthy - an issue that has plagued the game since early beta. Granted, my machine is running a bit old, but this is a complaint I've seen mentioned by people running all manner of rigs from low-high end.
That said; overall optimization was greatly improved at launch which has been great.

I've seen many complaints about chinese hackers, however I very rarely encounter this phenomenon; I play on Japan/Korea and Oceanic servers so  unless all these Triads are braving shitty ping to troll american and EU servers exclusively, then I'd suggest many of the reports are simply the result of salty players and a missunderstanding of how broken the Death cam is.

I'm giving this a Thumbs Up: regardless of some ongoing optimization problems and the rare cheater, I always find myself jumping into lobby after lobby no matter how frustrating the previous matches may have been - the core gamplay is exciting, with good shooting mechanics, and highly addictive replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059203946', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1548203950}
review:
This game is definitely a relationship of love and hate for me, but seriously, PUBG is awesome.

CONS: The game is full of cheaters, not well optimized, servers are found stuttering sometimes, and most of the cheaters at the SA server are actually chinese, and this makes the gameplay pretty fucked up.

PROS: Nice and fun gameplay, FPP mode is great, fast queue, and one of (if not) the game I most had fun playing in my life.

The cons I had for this game are the only ones I could actually find, and I probably couldn't actually resume all the pros it has. And this is only an early-release review, so, PUBG: 9/10 ez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198246256560', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 84476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1757, 'last_played': 1575551108}
review:
PUBG is the ultimate competitive Battle Royale game.

Nothing comes close to it's realism, it's intensity, it's competitiveness, it's versatility or it's satisfaction in the genre. 
There aren't many better feelings than a Chicken Dinner when it comes to competitive gaming and all this is the reason why a paid game shocked and dominated the gaming world, even overcoming F2P giants like Dota and LoL, to become one of the most played games of all time. You'd be daft to think it was all just hype. 

Now I just want to take a moment to address the entitled, toxic circlejerk that is currently tanking this incredible game's review rating. 

Firstly: Hackers. Personally I have experienced maybe 5 definite hackers in my 625 hours of playtime, yet I find a lot of people screaming 'ANOTHER CHINESE HACKER, WTF BLUEHOLE' almost everytime someone hits a nutty shot or outplays someone; whether that be streamers, twitch chat or friends. It's to the point where it's such an easy copout for a lot of people instead of just accepting that someone is better than you because of how stigmatised it is. Not saying that hackers don't exist, they exist in every competitive game, just that myself, and everyone I know, have not experienced nor seen much of it, if at all in the past 200 hours, during my total play and view time. While there is also an active update system to counteract new hacks pretty much every single day. 

Secondly: Optimisation. Just to preface, PUBG is one of the boldest undertakings in gaming right now: 100 people in one 16x16 (or now 4x4) map, complex looting system with hundreds of items, weapons and throwables with hundreds of loadout combinations, multiple different destructible vehicles and structures and an infinite number of gameplay scenarios that can playout. All of this packaged into a game that offers two different playmodes (TPP and FPP) and has multiple queues and maps. This is not an easy game to 'optimise'. To cover my bases Fortnite has roughly 8 years of development and could run on a Macbook, please stop comparing the two, they are different games. 
Personally, my game runs like an absolute dream and my computer is not some unreachable titan of a thing and I have friends who have much lower end specs than mine and say the same. 
Yes, sometimes I have clipped on things and die because of it, but it's far from regular and every single day and every single patch things are being improved. So to literally abuse the developers on EVERY social media outlet, on EVERY new update is a gross underappreciation for the work this game requires and just goes to show how little these people actually read of patch notes or the development roadmap PUBG have set out. 
For example: Patch Note #15 releases with a MASSIVE list of performance, gameplay and stability improvements and all these people can scream about is 'lol copying Fortnites battlepass, lol money-hungry, fix the game first', completely missing the fact that the team that does the games OPTIONAL cosmetics is completely separate from the team that is regularly improving the game. 
These are the same people that fill every PUBG related comments section with 'suing Fortnite for stealing the Battle Royale genre because you're jealous and your game is dying' and other much less coherent rants; because they can't read more than the clickbait headlines regarding the case because they are the lowest common denominator such headlines are made for. Protip: they are not suing out of jealousy, they are suing because they have a solid case for Epic literally stealing game game resources when they were working together. I personally don't give a shit if it goes through or not, but misinformation helps nobody. 

Just a quick-list of improvements I want to see, and will be on the developers backs about, so I don't get labelled too much of a PUBG-fanboy:
- Perfect optimisation 
- Rewarding ranked and progression system
- Decent map and gamemode selection
- Remove TPP: the game is best experienced in FPP and the split playerbase just makes everything even harder
- More support for the esports scene

Anyway, with the game being the best it's ever been by a huge margin, with a brand new map and brand new content, with a keen esports scene thats finally getting the official support it deserves, with the toxic part of the community loudly announcing their departure from the game AND with the game being on special for the first time ever, now is the perfect time to play! 
Whether you are returning or playing for the first time it's time to chase them Chicken Dinners again and push this game to even greater heights! 
I look forward to killing all of you xo

author: {'steamid': '76561198179041023', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1531016414}
review: PUBG is a check-your-brain-at-the-door fun time. I play it on medium-to-high settings, and other than an occassional framerate hitch here and there, it runs beautifully. At times it can be a little frustrating when you land on a map and there are no weapons anywhere in sight, but after playing it for a bit you start to learn where the good stuff is often located. Overall, if you're looking for a fun multiplayer experience it's hard to go wrong here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068625567', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 38293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 588, 'last_played': 1575789147}
review:
Tactical, high skill ceiling, open-ended gameplay makes every win more rewarding and every defeat a bigger loss. PUBG offers a very unique type of experience in the Battle Royale genre.

Unfortunately, PUBG is suffering the same fate as No Man's Sky: It was released with a lot of hype, but soon players found out about how broken (both from a technical and gameplay standpoint) and laggy this game is.  As time went by, the devs listened to feedback and did (and still do) all they can to improve the game. 

Actually the current state of the game is better than ever. It's only sad to think that the initial release left a bitter impression in a lot of people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070544280', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 86773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2318, 'last_played': 1575504085}
review:
I find it hilarious that some people have 1000+ hours on this game and don't recommend it. Look, the game has its problems but so does every game. The gun play is the BEST of any game out there, period. There's nothing more satisfying than hitting a headshot with a Kar98k on a guy who was running, no other game makes every kill feel rewarding. This game, even after 1400+ hours makes my heart race in tense fights and top 10 situations. 
This game still has a lot of stuff to improve upon imo, but look how far the game has come, compare this to a game like DayZ which is STILL in early access (lol), this game releases regular updates, listens to player feedback and now is adding ranked in the future.
This game gets better with more people, so but it and try it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122518670', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 37, 'last_played': 1575490259}
review: Still one of the best BR-Games out there. Enjoyed playing this Game a lot, even tho I havent played in a while. Ingame-Shop Items are pretty expensive, but theres no need to get anything if you dont want to. Planning to play this Game a little more again since it has to offer a lot, especially with a Group of friends this Game can be extremely enjoyable. Maps are well designed and Weapons/Items are pretty balanced. Its not as popular as it used to be, but still a good 7.5 imo

author: {'steamid': '76561198088787610', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 105423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4634, 'last_played': 1575772195}
review:
1.Join a match.
2.Meet a DouYu Player.
3.Kill Him and T-Bag Him
4.Get shot in the head by a kar98

author: {'steamid': '76561198084739942', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1144, 'last_played': 1575251821}
review:
This game is fun, but beware of somethings that will make you mad.
       - This game needs some work on it's guns, many of the smgs are way to overpowered, and marksman rifles are too overpowered. QBU needs some of the most work on balance because it can one-shot anyone no matter what kind of armor they have. I got one-shotted by it and had a lvl. 3 helmet. it's crazy.
       - Audio needs some work because really if you are fighting someone, you can never hear their footsteps. I was fighting a guy in the woods very close to me, and as I was reloading, I didn't hear a thing and was met with a surprise party from the guy I was fighting.
       - now this part is just community. You will always get double teamed weather you like it or not. You will get cleaned up weather you like or not. And there will always be someone that's better than you and you just have to persevere until you build up the mental capacity or muscle memory to do certain things pros do.

Now, if you are going to get this game, play with friends because it lightens the mood. Don't get to mad because this game is one to make you mad, but you're the one that's letting the game do that. practice if you are trying to go pro on this game, and just remember, Keep it fun for everyone including yourself, and enjoy the game!

review: game used to be pretty badly optimized, came back after not playing for over a year and to say i was surprised was an understatement, the game runs smoothly, the core mechanics are way better, new spots were added to empty spots in older maps, new maps were added, the ability to mute a teammate and not just quit the voice chat is also very welcome, and overall its now a lot more fun than it used to be. honestly i think if PUBG came out back then at the state that it is right now fortnite would have never had a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972081398', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 50528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 346, 'last_played': 1575508638}
review:
So Steam keeps asking me if I would recommend this game to others. Obviously with 800+ hours into the game the answer is yes, but that yes comes with a lot - and I mean a LOT - of caveats.

As a shooter this game is - to me - the best one out there. It's more realistic that the others without going super dark and over the top like Escape From Tarkov. But it has issues. Lots and lots of issues.

For starters, it's never really been finished. The patches put out are maddening and for every one thing that gets fixed it seems there's another that it breaks. The last patch, for instance, overhauled the loot tables on one of the maps, but completely messed up the way that sound carries. 

I won't go into the cheaters because every shooter game has them and it's always a race between those writing exploits and those devs trying to patch them. But it seems as of this writing that cheating has become more prevalent lately. Maybe the devs will catch back up and maybe they won't.

PUBG is a great game but it's also an infuriating game that even the best players absolutely hate at times. It's like being in a toxic relationship that you know is toxic but there's just nobody better out there right now.

So Steam, is that good enough? Will you leave me the hell alone now about writing a review? PS. Your new interface sucks and I hate it.

review: By far the best game in my library even considering all it's faults (which are many) The truth is, no game is perfect but this game is bloody the closest to be it. Naysayers are people who just could cope with the extremely high level you need to survive or just get tired of games, I'll get tired of it one day and stop playing but what i wont do when that happens is start trying to justify myself by vomiting on the game. The game is amazing and when you manage to overcome the extremely high learning curve... it's even better. Tried all BR's out there, none come close.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162306457', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 20031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 22, 'last_played': 1575494914}
review:
Best game to play with friends 10/10
Best running simulator 10/10
No matchmaking based on skills 10/10
Poor desync making bullets not hitting a target but instead dying from a headshot? 10/10
Would i kill my friends over minor inconveniences? 10/10
Will i ask my teammates where are they from? 10/10
Will i blame my killer for using hax? 100/10
Will some teammates not even greet their team while waiting to drop but instead talk and insult you only when they are knocked down ? 10/10
Will you meet an actually talkative and funny teammate? 2/10


Overall 69/10

The Art of Warfare - Recruiting (Founded in 2001)
The Art of Warfare (TAW) is looking for some additional members to join in on the fun.

TAW is a highly organized international gaming community that has been established since 2001. Today we have 2000+ current active members in 40+ games including PUBG of course.

We currently have an active player base in PUBG stretched around the world including NA and EU, consisting of both seasoned and new players.

What we offer you in TAW:
•	Active and organized players in PUBG as well as 40+ other games
•	Structured gaming community
•	Our own forums, blogs, wikis. 
•	Mature gamers that want a laid back environment away from foul language and offensive topics.

Requirements join: 
•	Be able to understand and speak English

How to join:
•	Go to www.taw.net

author: {'steamid': '76561198071531828', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 40415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 72, 'last_played': 1575098359}
review:
Regardless of what ppl say today, i have been playing this game since it first came out in Jan 2017 in Beta. It has come a long way from then with maps, bug fixes, optimization etc etc. Bt 1 thing stayed the same and it was the DEVS working their  bones off to make this game better. They have dedicated their everything into making this game what it is today. And thats the reason this game stands out among all the other Battle royales which are out there. This is prolly the greatest BR i have ever played, and ever will. 
Also big shoutout to the DEV team for putting in so much hard work n making this awesome game ever more fun...
Keep up the good work, Long LIVE PUBG :D 
9/10 for me Overall
100% recommend from me too !

author: {'steamid': '76561198237952960', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 985, 'last_played': 1575773627}
review:
So fyi this is written from a the perspective of someone who is realistically still a newb :).  So PUBG is my absolute favorite game, and I like it better than both Fortnite and Apex Legends.  PUBG is basically an accessible military simulator.  Here are the main reasons I love PUBG, and the things I think they need to work on: 

PROS:
Graphics are gorgeous 
Gunplay is very very satisfying and difficult
Driving is accurate and fun
4 maps
Takes lot of skill to master
In game community is not toxic (still somewhat, but not bad like CSGO)
Good party game
Movement is accurate and fun
The whole game just feel buttery smooth
Tactical gameplay

CONS
There still are hackers (not that many but a few)
EXTREMELY DIFFICULT TO WIN (frankly this is a pro as well)
Need to have a reasonably beefy PC to enjoy 
4 maps can make wait times kinda long (or random selection now)
Erangel is the most played map, so it can be hard to play other maps at times
There are bugs, but Bluehole does a very good job at fixing them

Overall: I would absolutely, 100% recommend this game to any and all BR players as the most realistic and intense battle royale currently on the market (except for simulators like Arma III).  It is completely worth the $30 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309551424', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567394111}
review: I had such high hope for this game but it continues to disappoint me in mind-boggling ways... It has the most terrible moving mechanisms and in-game sound feedback. It is impossible to tell a guy from one floor to another. A guy in a building next to you sound just like another in a building on the other side of the town. It does not reward players with better aiming techniques but give players with the most passive and least fun experience a first place. Maybe it is just "different" and I should not have so much "normalized" expectations based on so many other BR games. But this game is all the WORST aspects of all FPS games miraculously cooked into a massively famous BR game, which is why the devs don't feel the need to fundamentally change their game. Some would say that this game is simulating realistic experiences. Yes, they got the guns right on point... But why do I feel like that I am trying to play ARMA II with a character with Day-Z movements trying to locate others through a living hell BBQ Satan arsehole dressed with pre-cum hot pot of a in-game sound system? Have the developers listened to what their customers are hearing? Trying to get good at this game is like trying to become good at eating underpants that are used specifically by the People of NARNIA... This is out of this world... I need to uninstall just to get a grasp of this reality. This game and its insane popularity is making me question my existence and fundamentally shaking my beliefs and identity as a human being. I would recommend anyone who is too much joy and happiness in this life to try this game. That will do it.

review:
PUBG is a great game, but i think they should keep adding thing more often, for example like fortnite, i am not saying fortnite is good but it allways has new content etc

Plus u need to have something better than a 1060 ti or 1070 ti, if you dont have a good GPU, the game will be really slow and waccky, pretty much you wasted your money and you are screwd

I have two 1080 TI S and the game can only get 80 to 111 fps when i can get 165 fps

Overall the game has great graphics and it is kinda fun,though u have to be really good at battle royale on the pc or you will keep dying again and again AND AGAIN

review: The game is great the best battle royal I've played so far, it's worth taking full advantage especially if you can play with friends, the game has advantages and disadvantages, I will start with the advantages: The graphics are very good, everything is real, you can get skins without putting money in the game, has lots of maps, you even have servers in the community, you can change anything that goes through your mind, now let's start with the disadvantages: it is badly optimized, it is blocked on REGION LOCK CHINA, so much I found it.

review:
It's PUBG. It's the OG. What seemed like a lost hope as time went on and the explosion of the Battle Royale genre gave rise to the likes of Fortnite, Apex Legends, COD Blackout, etc. has now become a bastion of hope amidst a world filled with "sweaty try hards". I put a majority of my hours into this game when it was still in alpha and had moved on to aforementioned competitors by the time the game received its actual release, checking in every now and again to see what updates had come along, and to be honest I'm glad I waited until recently to pick this game back up. It is still the PUBG I know and love but it has expanded to multiple maps with a massive variety of weapons/equipment. It truly is the most balanced game in the genre if you ask me.

If you've become tired of other games in the genre and want something to reinvigorate your love for the game, then look no further...it's been here all along.

review:
I have been playing this game for a while. If you are from India, you need a good internet connection since there are a lot of ping spikes and packet loss while playing. It's disappointing that they don't have any servers in India.

But still, I like it despite of above cons. It was a unique experience when it came out, and it still is in many ways. It was the game that nailed battle-royale in 2018 and is still a pretty good contender in that genre of games!

review:
Still has it's bugs but it continues to be one of my favorite games. Movement is sluggish but it makes the game more challenging by having to be smart about the actions you make.

Desync and interpolation is still rampant but likely unavoidable with so many players in each game.

Nothing like being in the last phases of a round and having to clutch it out with adrenaline pumping through your veins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392276314', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 82548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1117, 'last_played': 1575797301}
review: Amazing game as a solo player and ESPECIALLY fun when playing with a group of friends. This is the game you would love to play when you're competing to victory or just casually messing around. My only complaint about this game doesn't have to do with the various bugs or FPS drops but how frequent hackers from China are coming into NA servers. Nothing is worse than spending 20 minutes of your time looting just to have some gaming cafe jackie chan looking kid, spray you FULL AUTO ACROSS the MAP with NO RECOIL. Other than that this game is worth your money. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198253939526', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 33, 'last_played': 1574736051}
review: I bought this game back in December, and played it for a few hours, but not too long because it was difficult for my computer to handle. Not unplayable, but definitely very low. A few days ago, I built a new PC and it runs amazing, and I can see myself playing much more of it. I bought this coming from playing a lot of Fortnite, and it is extremely different and much more difficult than Fortnite. Don't expect easy wins, even kills. In the 10 hours I've played to this point I have only reached top 10 once, and most of the time I lose in the mid 30s. If you want a game more challenging than Fortnite but still a battle royale, choose this.

review:
This game has brought me so much joy, but still anger. When it was released it was a poorly optimized game with outdated graphics.  
And to be quite honest it still is. 
But still it pulls me back.  I cant really stay away from it. 
There are few other games that gives that good rush of adrenaline when being engaged or engaging other players. And that is probably what makes it such a good game.

review: This game is great, but can be harsh to new comers. People who just buy the game don't really have a place to go besides the Aim Test Servers (or map or something) and the Servers that everyone else uses (including the people with over 5,000 hours). This can easily turn of new people, but can make them hope for the goal to play better and play more. That is this game's charm, it attracts new people, spits in their hand, and make them get better them selves. I atleast enjoyed my experience of doing that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052074749', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 93966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 354, 'last_played': 1575480727}
review:
Best BR and shooting game I have ever played. Addicted into and love this like I have done to Dota 2. 
Nothing can be more realistic than pubg. Guns, vehicles and movement mechanics are just so perfect. May experience some lags and random fps dropping, but what can you expect more when you play 100 players in a single lobby. 
I can feel the developers' effort on this game as every single thing is drawn detailed. Totally worth to pay for it.
Here is the only bad thing about pubg is charging too much for some ingame cosmetic items. $9.99 for a single pants or a gun skin is not the good business.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960272177', 'num_games_owned': 1345, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1566027520}
review:
So listen, technical problems aside (mostly, optimization could use a lot of work but it still runs decently), here's one reason I appreciate and play this game more than I probably should.

I don't ever have to play with a team to get the "full"/"real" experience. I can play solo queue against 98 other people and never have to talk to them or know anything about them beyond maybe that I've killed them or (more likely) they've killed me. Once I'm dead, I just hop back into the queue for another game. I'm not good at shooting or aiming really, and I will almost always run away when some random dude starts shooting at me first and I don't really know where they are. I treat the game as hide-and-seek a lot of the time, and that honestly isn't the worst tactic. There's all sorts of different play styles that end up being somewhat viable, so you don't HAVE to have perfect aim just to feel like you've done well.

If you feel like you're out of your depth with the skill-based crowds that plague modern FPS games, you may still be able to entertain yourself with this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385176086', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 47317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1565528159}
review:
In my opinion, PUBG, based on the Battle Royale film is one of the founding fathers of the Battle Royale genre as we have it today, this is something of which there is no doubt. 

It introduced quite simply the various aspects that make a good BR game, zoning, weapon variation, decent loot tables, good mid and late game however it isn't without its flaws. Since its release, PUBG has honestly seen so many changes and improvements that it is no longer the buggy and jittery game it used to be, but has flourished into a more polished and fulfilling game.

Bit late cos it got rekt by Fortnite omegaLUL

Although PUBG is janky at times, it's the jankiness of the game that we love, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198804777041', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570801523}
review:
3 years has passed since this game has launched, i thought this game would've been fixed for the performance issues, but nope, it still lags on minimum req hard ware and struggles to get over 30 fps and dips below 30 when a lot of activity is happening on the screen.

could've been a much better experience but pretty much the same as 2 years ago, matchmaking is fairly quick tho (SEA servers) and i love the northern light environment so thats cool.

overall except a few performance issues PUBG is still a really goood game and worth giving a try.

[Edit]: after the updates in july 2019 and after, this game has drastically improved (performance vise) and now you can finally get playable FPS an minimum specs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056621309', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1570337563}
review:
great game! fun with friends! i got it a couple months ago but its on sale today so buy it up if you haven't yet!!

lots of people like to blame cheaters but i dont think ive been killed my many if any.  sure there are cheaters in every game out there but in battle royals, your odds of winning a game are very low to begin with and people like to make excuses for why they dont win every game.  the common one in this game is to blame the chinese because they have a huge player base that plays in a server on the other side of the world(they also play mainly TPP so play FPP if you are worried).  ive been matched with very very few chinese players and its always on NA server so these people blaming the chinese are just making excuses for themselves.  just play the game and dont expect to win more than 1 in 100 games and just learn from every match and play with friends and you will have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138966941', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572289469}
review: PUBG is honestly one of the top 3 BR games right now. Most people are sheep and go on about how this game has performance problems, and has cheaters left and right. I am not trying to suggest that neither issue is non-existent, but both are overwhelmingly dramatized. I have not seen a single cheater since i started playing the game again about a week ago, and the game runs fairly consistant and decently high FPS (I wouldn't attempt to run this on a potato though). Most people who think people are cheating forget how fast the TTK (time to kill) in this game is, and that a lot of the remaining people are longtime fans that are pretty good. Given that you have fairly fast que times for 4/5ths of the day, it is safe to say that this game is far from dead. If you already have the game I would suggest giving it a go again, because I am glad I did; however, Unless you have other friends who play the game, I would have a hard time recomending someone to buy this at $30

author: {'steamid': '76561198165294197', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 32939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569004989}
review:
As you can see i have invested a few hours in this game.
-Graphics:
Very good. Nothing to say here.
-Gameplay:
This game is awesome. If you want to do stupid things with your friends, then go ahead. But if you want to play seriously, then you will be disappointed, because there are still a lot of hackers in this game and there are also a few bugs here and there. For example when a player is sitting in a corner and the opponent can see him, but the other player not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057041835', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 102633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 48, 'last_played': 1575419714}
review: One of my favorite games. You need to have a great PC to run it smoothly so I play on very low settings. But since its release it became much smoother. Cheaters are a problem, but I think a lot of the suspected cheaters are just good/lucky players and people get anry (me too) and it s much better having the excuse "oh it was a cheater". Nice graphism, good gameplay even though a bit slow sometimes, but you can just play the smaller map Sanhok. I dislike the current ranking system, since it doesn t really take into account how good you are, but you can get a high rank by playing a lot. Absolutely worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174207670', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 45858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 467, 'last_played': 1575420930}
review:
I've been playing this game ever since early to mid beta. I have been around for much of the good, bad, and ugly experiences that have occurred during the development cycle... and trust me... some of it was really bad. I have been waiting to post my review until the game was fully established, I was confident in my knowledge as a player, and was happy with what the direction the developers were going. 

So let me first start off what the game offers as far as play modes. There are two basic modes of play: Third Person Perspective (TPP) and First Person Perspective (FPP). The game originally started solely as a TPP shooter; however, they added the FPP camera mode in late beta. Each camera perspective offers 3 different max team sizes: Solo (1 person), duos (1-2), and squads (1-4). There are 4 maps all with unique sizes, buildings, and geography, and each map has a potential to have weather alterations to occur during the game (normal, rain/fog, sunset, night). Not all of these weather modes can occur on each map. For example, night mode only occurs on one map (it also has a day version). 

Throughout my entire time on PUBG I have played all the different modes on all the different maps in both camera perspectives. I mainly prefer FPP over TPP, and play duos and squads over playing solo. I despise playing TPP because you can just abuse the third person camera and look over edges without exposing your body... just feels kinda lame and unfair when people do this trick to you. It's less tactical and more camera abuse IMO. So I prefer playing FPP, and I will mainly only play duos or squads with my friends (I never play with randies). I don't play solo because it just feels too stressful and high stakes to the point where it is not fun for me. Plus, in most games, I have more fun playing with my pals anyway. One of my friends adores solo FPP though, it just isn't for me. I adore this game, because I only play the game modes / perspectives that I enjoy: FPP Duo, FPP Squads.

NOTE: There are statistics that say that TPP is a more popular mode than FPP. This doesn't mean that FPP servers are dead, not even close. But you will be more likely to see and recognize a name in the kill feed in FPP than in TPP since there are fewer players playing in it. 

NOTE: I have heard through the grape vine that there are a lot more cheaters in TPP than in FPP... but a lot. I have no evidence of this rather than personal experience. In all my time playing FPP, there has only been one instance where a dude was definitely cheating, and one time where I wasn't too sure (I've hit some pretty crazy shots through blind spots so I'm gonna give the person the benefit of the doubt). So in FPP, after hundreds of hours, only one cheater... seems like good odds to me. But apparently the mods work better in TPP or something like that and people claim there are a lot more cheaters in TPP. Like I said, this is all speculation and I have no proof, but it makes a little bit of sense since there is a bigger player pool. 

Anyway, moving on from that, lets talk about guns. The game has a bunch of guns and different types. Several ARs, SRs, SMGs, DMRs, shotguns, pistols, etc. 

1. I hate shotguns and melee items are useless (except the pan, the pan blocks bullets)
2. all the other guns are more or less well balanced, unique, and can be used in many scenarios (with a few exceptions like the G36C being a SCAR with more kick.
3. Basically, there are a lot of guns. I'm not going to go into much detail

One last thing I want to talk about is pacing. PUBG isn't necessarily slower or faster in pace when compared to APEX of Fortnite. I would say that on average, APEX and Fortnite games go way quicker and are way more aggressive in combat pacing. PUBG can be like this too; however, it doesn't have to be. I really like PUBG because the arenas are big enough to where I can either choose to have a hot drop or a chill drop. It all depends on how I feel and I get to mix it up a bunch. The larger maps allow for more variety in pacing. Sure you can get some pretty slow and boring games where nothing happens sometimes, but if you just drop hot or *lukewarm* that shouldn't be a problem. Basically, you can choose your own pacing based on where you drop, which I find pretty nice, especially compared to a game like APEX where you are basically always a click away from another team. 


Anyway, this review has basically been more of an explanation of the game and how it is setup so I hope it was helpful. I love this game, but only because I play in the specific modes that I enjoy. If you enjoy FPP and prefer playing with friends and want to have some shenanigans, I think you could justify at least trying PUBG out. Hope to see you on the battlefield :)

review:
it would be nice if they would remove the pregame wait time. There is no point in waiting 60 seconds for a game to start if 94+ players are all ready to go. If people need extra time to do things like grab a snack or use the restroom, then it is their problem and they shouldn't even queue. Don't waste time for players who are ready to play.  This is why this game is losing competition to other battle royales. Please and thank you.

update 7/30/19:
Could you not force map choice and randomization? Christ you guys make dumber choices every patch

author: {'steamid': '76561198171588237', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 187263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 999, 'last_played': 1575795833}
review:
Player Unkown's Is very immersive very addictive game - great fun to play with friends or strangers  make the game what you want..... camp or rambo style.....  THe game has many bugs and slowly is getting better - the main issues are hackers  who wreck the game ( Flying hacks, ghost hacks, aimbot hacks ) make sure you report them all watch death cam  eventually they will stop wasting there money on making new accounts ...... ( plz make sure u report them ))    cosmetics are fun and really make your toon bring to life..... ( avatar )  game needs more optimisation as still crashes often and im struggle to get past 80 - 100 fps on 4k......   ( this game looks amazing detailed....   ( good value game for its price hours and hours owr years of fun..... you wont regret......  ( intersting the diffrent regions style of game play......  IE   SEA, NA, EUA      Go have some fun

I feel sorry for the people who hanged on to or payed for the player unknown trench coat...... this was given to the people who bought game before the launch - they rose up to $2000 in value and today in end of April 2019 value is $43  years later.......... poor things

You earn BP points for  killing and winning rounds and you can spend on random item and cosmetics and emotes..., they constantly update seasons now with new passes and new cosmetics to keep its community playing and pumped.... game wait times are not too bad

These are ping results from Australia ( somewhere in the Sydney region )
AU- servers  10 -30 ping
SEA - 110- 250 ping
NA - 280 ping         ( It switches server if you play with mate in USA  )     which is real annoying cos the lag is frustrating........  there are ways to fix

author: {'steamid': '76561197969801185', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 30691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1561161976}
review:
Game isn't perfect, but it's a laugh to play with friends, how many other games can say that these days? Last greats to play with friends - L4D 1&2. Counterstrike even possible Dead Island. 
So it's a very small amount of games that you and your buddies can rinse and repeat the "stay alive simulator".

The crates and keys are a waste of time and investment, but like I say to anyone I play with, you don't have to buy cosmetics to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255762259', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'last_played': 1575728743}
review:
PUBG is the type of game where it starts off with not caring too much if you die in the first few minutes (approx 90 players alive), after a little while and some reasonable loot and gear has been found, you would prefer not to die at this point but still not too fussed if you die (approx 60-70 players alive). After the 3rd/4th blue circle, You start to believe that you can achieve the impossible...you could possibly win...you'll taste the sweet fruits of victory...(10 players remaining)...you've made it to top 10....but you still want more....no more mistakes or joking around now...you're close....(last 2 players)...you believe in this...you can win! But atlast...you make an idiotic mistake. You end as #2.....that moment will haunt you forever...

This is what will happen every game, you'll feel rage, anger and above all serenity when you die because you know that the game is over....until you start the next one. 

Welcome to the battleground.

In general, it is a very good game that requires both endurance and skill from the player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209812104', 'num_games_owned': 3, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 54280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1198, 'last_played': 1575794454}

author: {'steamid': '76561198830411835', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573681977}
review:
Pubg has made a huge improvement to gameplay and bugs these last few months and the new guns, maps and  updates such as changing the movement mechanic when parachuting really shows that they're making good changes.
The gun mechanics are the best i have seen in any game and make it feel really realistic and tactical although you can mess around and do stupid challenges if that's what you're into. 

I don't like how they made the vikendi loot prominantly smg's because it's such an open map and it would really benefit from taking lvl. 3 helmets out of world loot and increasing sniper spawn rate.

Sanhok is the best map in my opinion as it is only 4x4 km and as a result, has really fast paced gameplay in the early and mid game and has an exiting, close quarters end game.

duos and squads is also a really good experience if you cue up with your friends.

9/10 would recommend.

review:
I'm now playing this game for more than a year and, despite all the bugs and haters out there, I just love it. I bet most of the people giving negative reviews still play it.
To me it's not like you have a lot of bugs that stop you from playing, it's more like decent stuff that happens.
Playing PUBG with friends is the greatest evening activity in gaming I can imagine, you flame each other and noone is ever the one who's doing something wrong.

I would recomment this game to everyone who likes more realistic gunplay than Apex or Fortnite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408359598', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 71953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1572052322}
review: This is my PUBG review after roughly 800 hours of PUBG and multiple battle royale experiences since. PUB was my first BR, like many of you people out there, it hit a spot and got us hungry for more BR. Since then we've seen a spike in BR growth and its started a wave so we've seen games like Fortnite, Spellbreak, BF5 and now Apex Legends; There are more BR titles that are on the way too so stay tuned. I still think that PUBG has a unique feel and will always have place in my BR heart. I played with my friends and i never had a blast like i did on PUBG, it built a foreground for my stream. For a while i stopped playing PUBG and i felt a disconnect and kind o flost about what games to play competitively. I just got back most recently to the community and I've been loving the lean shots, weapon skins, china and just all the gritty plays people make in PUBG (cough "shroud" lol).  Since the The update is looking beautiful, no doubt the UI settings will take some time to get used to, but overall the smg/pistol attatchments idea was cool and makes a faster loot system along with some other cool quirks here and there; Such as the M16 being able to hold its own at range now (range increase M16). The UMP takes 45Ammo now, which is cool I guess, it caught me off guard but because the UMP (now UMP45) is such a strong smg along with the vector, it now has a good regulation point to compare weapons (UMP45 Has Only 25 in Starting Clip)....but..uuhh....oooo vector i love u so much haha :steamfacepalm...anyway.. they added a stock to the M16 and it says it reduces sway and kickback along with something else (I Forgot check patch notes :) ). PUBG has improved its FPS when getting shot on flinch, which is helpful because it can be a problem at times but the list goes on of fixes and bugs so have a peek. I really like the update overall and I hope you guys get a chance to try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045924408', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1553990684}
review:
My expectations was not huge to this game. Didn't really care about it becasue I tend to like more sim and realistic games.
But since many of my friends played it I had to give it a shot, not to miss out.

Must say I was very positivly surprised! It's an intense experience when the game evolves and suddenly you realize only 10 other is  remaning. The tenseness is addictive! Chasing the circle, fleeing the toxic gas, and encoutering enemies while at it.

The shooting experience and weapons feels very realistic, and the great number of attachements is lovely.

The downsides: Player can jump really high for some reason!? It takes allot of bullets in order to kill someone (unless strait up headshot with a 7.62.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299754745', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 63, 'last_played': 1574604050}
review:
This game is NOT noob friendly. This game is NOT similar to Apex Legends or Fortnite. Sure, they are all Battle Royale games. But this game offers a completely different gameplay experience. Do NOT buy this game thinking it will be similar to either of these games. It isn't. 

Most of the players that are still playing pubg are veteran players that have been playing since release or for at least a year. These people have 1000-5000 hours in this game. Most of the casual playerbase has moved on. Most new players that buy the game, get frustrated and move on too. This creates a deep learning curve as a result since most players are really good at the game. If you want to stand a chance then you need to invest many, many hours into this game. Only then will you see improvement. You need to play the training mode and learn all the guns, vehicles and attachments. Even when you do all this, you will still die a lot. What I'm saying is, this game requires a considerable amount of your time in order for you to win most of your engagements with other players. If your only going to be playing this game for 5 hours a week then I would recommend you NOT to buy this game. If your going to be playing every day for at least 3 hours, then, sure, give this game a shot. 
I'm not sure how this can be resolved. Maybe the devs can implement a competitive mode similar to rocket league. 

Moving on to the community. Playing with randos will be hit or miss. You will encounter people who don't have a mic or do, but don't talk for some reason. You will encounter quite a lot of toxic players. These toxic scum will curse you for dying or for letting them die. Even though they engaged the enemy alone. You will encounter people who queue for squad but, instead of dropping as a team, will drop solo half-way across the map from where you and your two other teammates landed. You will encounter a duo that ques for squad but, instead of dropping as a team, will land half-way across the map from where you and your other teammate landed. You will encounter team killers. You will encounter people who love to down you. Revive you. And then down you again. You will encounter players that take all the good loot and leave you with a pistol and a crowbar. This can't be avoided if you solo queue. Just keep this in mind.

Optimization is ok for the most part. I have a GTX 1070, a Ryzen 5 1600 OC to 3.8 ghz and I have 8gb of 1465 mhz ram. I played on the max settings and here's what I encountered: Loot sometimes doesn't spawn until two secs after you land. Textures can look ugly. Draw distance is an issue as buildings look awful from far away. Your fps will drop randomly. It depends on the map and the servers. I can play a game where it's buttery smooth but the next game I play can be a stutter fest. PUBG is a game of inconsistency. 
On a side note: when I go inside smoke, generated from smoke grenades, my fps always gets cut in half for some reason. 

If you can tolerate all this and can invest a serious amount of your time then by all means buy this game. This game is fun... When your getting kills and have decent teammates. It offers something no other battle royale can. A realistic combat experience.

review:
First time played this Game, I just wandred around and BAng KaBooom! I Was dead.. No Ide where i was shot from,. And i thought. Hmm mabye a super skilled player. But you know what? He might be skilled but so are so many in this game. As a casual gamer (Mostly Xbox and Ps4, sometimes pc) I did not stand a chance! 

Its a good game. Lots of bugs, but still vey cool to play this game with friends. I downloaded on xbox one X and started the war there. Not that hardcore as on pc. I have nothing to do in this game on pc. But mabye you do!?

Recommed this game if you have people to play with, and are used to play pc shooters. Go get em Soldier!

review: This game has started and made the battle royale game mode to be an absolute and very likeable game. Almost all BR games were created in the likeness of PUBG, Realm Royale, Call of Duty: Black ops 4, Apex Legends, and many more. I still do recommend this game because I almost played it for a thousand hours, but the fact that this game is good, it is also a game that only thinks about profits. The developer does not care about how to make the game better thus they jusy kept on adding new maps and new skins. Hope they fix the game for good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170392657', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 26600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 43, 'last_played': 1574864914}
review:
If your looking for an intense shooter game like BO4, this game is not for you, it@s more like rainbow six siege on a large scale. And I don't get why all the people are so mad at some of the points like:
The optimasation hase improved with every update and I feel like at this point I am confident enought to say they did a verry good job.
The DLC that everyone disliked is not really a DLC but a seasion pass.
The bugs hase in my opinion disepeared after the snowmap.
I feel like this game is a combination of arma and bo4 - tactics are needed to play this correctly early game, but if your in the last circle pure skill and bo4 like stratigys happen. I feel this game hase a lot to offer.

review: Overall enjoyable and addictive game. Took me long enough to learn how to shoot properly since i wasnt really playing shooting games before PUBG. Yet after 1k hours i still enjoy the game especially while im playing squad or duo with friends. The only thing im worried about is that the amount of cheaters is too damn high. Being crouch behind a rock and getting headshoted from 1km away by an iron sight m24 along with my duo was the worst experience i had in this game. Yet even after that im still playing and i enjoy meeting people who share the same passion. Only downside is playing in EU and playing squads with random people sometimes gets frustrating especially when you are forced to play with 2 arabs who are just speaking elfish and they dont even care about the rest of us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282042814', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 20972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1571559897}
review:
Gunplay is best of all BR, pretty realistic. The satisfaction of successfully landing a K9 shot from over 200m away or a perfect spray of a 4x M4 is unequaled. A good win is always satisfactory. And outplaying an enemy always cracks me up. 

But, you need a beefy PC to play this game with good framerates. If you keep fps aside, this game is fun. 

There are some bugs, cheaters, some core mechanics are not balanced. But every update fixes them one by one. And not to mention, introduces some new bugs. 

Whatever people say, PUBG redefined the BR genre. And right now, PUBG is better than ever. Now is the time for anyone new to pick this up. 

Recommended 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961041851', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 36965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573369146}

-There are no individual characters

Ring of Elysium is FREEEEE and way better.

review: From what i have played PUBG is a very competitive Battle Royale and i think it is very fun from my experience. With the recent 'fix PUBG' campaign i believe that this game could run on more systems and play better. I would recommend PUBG for anyone with experience on either fps or tps. Keep in mind the game is still not fully optimised so some PCs will struggle unless if you have the right specs.

review: I honestly don't get where all the hate is coming from for this game. It is honestly a very fun game and is a very immersive experience when you play. I only run into a hacker once, maybe twice a month; You don't have to worry about that problem. The only thing that I have trouble with is my frames in hot drops. Normally, i can get about 50-80 FPS in a regular compound; But if i land in Bootcamp or Pai-Nan, i get 20 - 30 FPS. If this problem was fixed, this game would be perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047374717', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 37330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'last_played': 1575282309}
review:
it's a really fun game, even more so with friends and vocal ! Actually, I strongly, strongly advise to play with friends or friendly people you find and in vocal. 
(but if you don't have lot of friend into these kind of game like me just join a gaming community there is a ton. I'm in TAW and everyone is super duper nice there :3 )

I'm recommending it if you love some tension and strong learning curve (learning to handle distances with scopes, spray...different with each weapon, different if modded or not...)(it's cute because after a while people will have their preference on different weapon, when usually in shooter people just all take the same gun all the time because it's the strongest, here there is other thing to consider like yes maybe it's strong but can you control it well too stuff like that), but arn't a rager/flamer. don't play the game if you rage easily it's probably not for you. 

the games makes you work on long term strategies (when you have time, planning your route, when you track someone., making trap..) but also short term (when you are blocked in a building, and a team is rushing you, when you need to run for your life to get in the zone but there are fight everywhere...), reaction time, staying calm when situation all of a 
 sudden is going wild it's really nice ! Got a lot of jumpscare moment, and lot of laughing out loud moment. 

there is still performance issue but I'm not too bothered by that, it's a lot better than in the beginning, only Vikendi seem a bit more taxing but it's still playable by a lot. (and Vikendi is my favorite map so) 
maybe people that downvote only play alone or are super competitive...idk...games run fine...I see a lot of pro player running the game fine too... I don't mean there is no performance issue problem but its not as bad as people are trying to tell you... (not anymore lol) 

the only thing I regret is the weather being disabled, I loved the constant weather there was in the beginning, now we have it a bit too but it's random and less powerful and not all the time. (I seriously loved the rainy map) I understand competitive were angry but still.... 
the biggest problem is cheater, it's a lot better than before but still...and the feeling reports doens't count... my team reported a whole 8 chinese players teaming together that we encountered (that was wild) and we didn't get the banning message...that's a bit discouraging...even more so that I don't report very often. 

also another small complaint, the mission...they are...really bad....I agree with Ibiza when he said on stream that with these kind of mission they make it looks like the dev arn't playing the game themself because 80% of them makes no sense and are no fun to do. I hope than for the new pass mission will be better, maybe then will I buy it... but not this time (too bad because some cosmetci are really, really nice looking, but I'm not grinding annoying as heck mission for a cosmetic with a pass that I paid for (when I paid for the game already lol).  but it's really a small complaint, at the end of the day, it's just cosmetic, and as cloth goes and weapon skins, you can take the one on your dead ennemies, so I just steal for the game cool stuff that I find lol.
