author: {'steamid': '76561198829542051', 'num_games_owned': 1, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1549584078}
review: Best Battle Royal ever!!! And the most original, Really has unique and realistic things in the game which makes it amazing, like the new Canted Sight and the Moonlight thing in Vikendi, very amazing!! Really appreciated dev.... but the game needs to develop more, as in, make it more and more interesting, plus matchmaking takes ages and quick join primarily puts you in Sanhok and Vikendi only while Erangel and Miramar doesn't appear often. Do something to make this game worth buying and amazing again, so that more players will be interested to play the game. Add more cool stuff like skins, guns, emotes, movement motions, etc. Fix a lot of stuff like audio, rendering, crashes, bugs, hackers, and more because those are one of the MAIN reasons why a lot of people hate this game so much. This game has so much potential in it to be the best, its just you dev team to make the move. But after all of those problems, I still think that PUBG is still the best game! Love the game so much <3

author: {'steamid': '76561197964636724', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 107985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 79, 'last_played': 1575611577}
review:
I can't stop playing this game. It has a lot to offer: intense fights, randomness, exploration, mastery, satisfying driving and shooting mechanics. I've heard it compared to poker and that's not incorrect, no matter how good you are you don't win them all, but mindgames help. It's best played with friends, but solo play is a heart-pounding experience for anyone but the most collected l33t gamer.

There are a lot of ways to play this game. You can be cautious, moving slowly and quietly with suppressed weapons. You can be aggressive and make use of vehicles and smoke grenades for repositioning, flashbangs, grenades, and molotovs for assault. You can be a sniper, you can be a cavalier shotgun or smg CQB fighter. You have a variety of tools at your disposal.

As a simulacrum of battle royale, lulls in the action occur. Especially on the larger maps (there are 4 total so far, ranging from 16 km^2 to 64 km^2). This can cause an uneasy tension but also implores you to explore the huge sandbox on foot or in a vehicle. If you're bored you can go looking for fights at airdrop crates. You can search for rarer guns or you can find big jumps and do an informal rally race. Learning the map and how the terrain and buildings offer tactical opportunities is satisfying.

Quieter parts of the games (which last 0-33 minutes depending on which map as well as your personal luck/skill) are a great opportunity to goof around and chat with your buds. If you need to have a minute, just hide in a corner and have your buddies keep watch. It's half-hour outdoor airsoft games with your buddies on Discord, from the comfort of your home, and only a $30 one-time fee.

Flaws: The game is sometimes buggy, they have been slow but steady with fixes. Netcode now feels like in an acceptable place. Performance can be rough for lower-powered PCs. I recommend an Intel i3 or AMD Ryzen 3 CPU at a minimum, 8 or more GB of RAM, and at least 2GB of VRAM on a decently powerful GPU from the last few years. The game has ~weekly downtime of 2% that usually occurs on Tuesday night in the Americas, especially impacting CT/ET (UTC-6/-5) time zones. There is a lot of cosmetic loot crate type stuff but it's just cosmetics. Every game everyone gets access to the same guns and equipment. I am happy that people more wasteful with their money than me are allowed to fund new maps for me, I hope they can afford it.       

My recommendation: If you have an ok PC, know someone who plays it, and are remotely interested, try it out. Ask people who already play to teach you basics. Try some solo rounds.  Make dumb strategy plans with your team and attempt them ingame. Try doing motorcycle backflips. Set up a roadblock. Shoot at people up close. Shoot at them far away. Explore. Crazy stuff will happen and often you will die. Have fun chasing the Chicken Dinner!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982788898', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1569662371}
review: Much more enjoyable for me than Fortnite. I appreciate the semi-realistic gunplay as opposed to bouncing around a cartoon world. People crying about daily missions and skins are complete morons. You can reroll your missions, or, hey, here's an idea, JUST PLAY THE GAME! You can be a spaz and grind XP to get another silly emote that you will rarely use, or actually play a game for the fun of it. This game is much more enjoyable with friends but is fun solo on occasion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273760568', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1562702229}
review:
A very refreshing title as it feels somewhat original even though some concepts are borrowed. 

Pros: Has amazing in-game graphics. Customization is a welcome addition in this game. Matchmaking is fast. Very low latency in medium internet settings in some regions and the ability to form squads even with less than 4 people is a welcome addition and feels like going up against some intense firefight. Has diverse maps and is very refreshing to play in TPP or FPP and each view mode has dedicated servers which would make sure no one has an advantagein a game like this.

Cons: Needs some tweaking in the hitbox and hit indicator such as displaying crosshairs when your bullets hit the other player and also needs stable aim controls as it kinda throws off balance at some instances. Needs few improvements in categories such as regional matchmaking as it usually matches with people from countries who don't have the same language and hence is difficult when trying to play in 4 man squad with strangers. Is almost unplayable in Solo as the loot placement on the map is not efficiently randomized and needs improvements. 

But the cons is probably being fixed as we speak as they did improve the plane drop and parachute gliding mechanics and has improved in stability in the last couple days.

Would give this a 7/10. Hoping to see what's next in this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037044572', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 2675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1547309272}
review:
Battle Royale winners are decided a great part by blind luck with skills such reaction time, positioning or accuracy being a small part. In PvP free-for-all gamemodes in games like CoD or Battlefield, no matter how good the best player is, he is still going to die a time or two to anyone else and with that in mind, consider a free-for-all mode with 100 players, on a gigantic map. You can't possibly plan or predict anything except to camp until the safe zone forces you out into the danger again. If you have fun knowing that you most likely will not win from the get-go, good for you, I envy that you can find fun where I simply cannot.

That said, if not for the inconsistent shot registration and relaticely unsatisfying shot hit animations, this game would have the best third person gunplay yet with fantastic sound design (mostly for the weapons).

author: {'steamid': '76561197979912688', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1568148767}
review: I've been playing this game on and off since about 4 months after it's first semi-release. I've seen it get worse and better, but ultimately, the trend in toward greatness. The additions to the game have not felt over bearing and they've really reduced the amount of hackers online - they are probably still there but I haven't seen one in ages. The physics feel correct, though the cars are still a bit strange, the weapons and combat feel very refind to me... idk to say, I like it, and I look forward to what they are doing in the future. I couldn't care less about the monetization or the store, everyone has one now. I once opened a crate an found a yellow skirt that sold for $98+ real dollars and I was able to get Far Cry 5 when it came out. I see no downsides.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198115537035', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1553956095}
review:
Very Addictive and by nature frustrating at times.
You just have to get used to doing a lot of progress then suddenly dying, sometimes in an unfair way, thats why its always better to play with a team, friends or randoms, to laugh at your mysery. yet very rewarding at other times. the open world concept make it feel endless, you can almost never encounter people in the same situation.  the design just hits the rights spot, and gameplay feel very realistic at times.

is it a good game, Yes, definately, especially recently it started feeling solid, not perfect, but good enough, comparing to all other titles, this is a worth it game. I look back at all the good times I have had with the game, thats why it deserves a recommend.

the fact that this game started with a simplistic team, with limited resources and could beat AAA title games in sales was amazing, I was always supportive of PUBG devs back in the days. 

BUT, after getting the huge success, and endless bag of shiny gold, they should have revolutionized the game, they could have added so much to it, they could have made it 500% better than it is, and could have kept their 1# spot, but I believe their own greed failed them. comparing to something like fortnite where they keep adding content, keep their fans hooked and game runs solid from start, PUBG makes you feel let down, very slow development, and huge hiccups at times with updates and bugs. I feel sad only because it could have been better. 

but overall, I love this game, playing FPP definately made it my cs go replacement, very addictive game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990474597', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 76016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1474, 'last_played': 1575630967}
review:
Dropped on a compound loaded with weapons,
Packed up and ready to roll
Drive to a god building, out by the highway,
A place where nobody goes

The sound of gunfire, off in the distance,
We're getting used to it now
Died in El Pozo, died in San Martin,
We've died all over this town

This ain't no Minecraft, this ain't no Fortnite,
We're only fooling around
It's time for drinking, and shootin' dummies,
We got some time for that now

Hop in the Bronco, rotate real slowly,
Hope for a circle that's kind
I got three first aids, a couple of mollies,
We don't what we might find

High on a hillside, those guys reloading,
Let's get ready to roll
We work in the daytime, we drink up on Thriday,
Beer with delicious foam

This ain't no Minecraft, this ain't no Fortnite,
This ain't no fooling around
This ain't no Quake Live, or Super Meat Boy,
We got no time for that now

Rotate to prison? Or up to Mili?
Rotate to El Azahar?
You oughta know not to stand by the window
Somebody see you up there

I got some boosters, I got a med kit,
Get us back on our feet
But I ain't got no ammo, ain't got no gas tanks,
Ain't got no optics to see

Why play the slow edge? Why crash in central?
Gonna be different this time
Can't find a target, can't hear no footsteps,
Time for a vodka shot now

Trouble in transit, got through the roadblock,
We blasted right through the crowd
We got good armor, fuck you Mr Sparkles,
You know that that ain't allowed

Skin up like students, skin up like housewives,
I like a suit and a tie
I changed my gun skins, so many times now,
I don't know what they look like!

It's time for murder, never surrender,
We make a pretty good team
Don't get too sober, I'll do some driving,
You ought to get you a drink

Dropped all my flashbangs, what good are flashbangs?
They won't help me survive
Vodka shot burning, burns like a furnace,
The burning keeps me alive

author: {'steamid': '76561198049296060', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1563654428}
review:
In this time where battle royal is one of the biggest genres of video games right now it is hard to pick witch ones do you play or just try out especialy whern they all cost money. So the only battle royal games i have played are PUBG Fortnite and some indie one with i own for like 3 or 4 years now and it is nothing more than a buggy mess. From these three i like PUBG the most, BUT that does not mean that it is perfect.In fact this game is far from perfect gameplay wise and techical too.
PUBG is out for over a year and still has issues that it had in the begining for example : Server lag, random deaths from falling very short distance ,seeing through stuff , framerate drops etc... But when it works as it is intended to work its pretty fun. At the time of writing this review i have around 100hours And i have to say i have enjoyed them. For the 30 euros <20 when it is on sale > it is good expirience when played with friends and for some when alone too. Would recomend when it goes on sale : )

review: Very fun battle royale game.  It is a bit more realistic than something like Fortnite in both presentation and physics (though, the physics engine does go off the rails occasionally).  The dev has done a piss poor job of optimizing/supporting the game with the massive amounts of money that they've earned....which is a true shame.  But that doesn't change the fact that the game itself is a great deal of fun to play, especially with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110669208', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1571833845}
review:
PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is an online multiplayer battle royale game that you can play alone or with friends. You can play on multiple maps and choose between first person or third person perspective. 99 players parachute down from a plane on to the map and try to survive by going through buildings and searching for loot. And staying alive and not letting the deadly blue zone or player kill you.
 The game is fun and somewhat addicting. You have the option to customize your character and guns. The game is somewhat playable thanks to the recent bug fixes and apparently it is E-sports read. Finding a game is somewhat fast but encountering your first battle or finding your fist loot takes time do to waiting till everybody joins and waiting till you parachute down.
 The game is full of microtransactions but thankfully the game is not play-to-win, you can only buy cosmetics and cases. The game has a problem with cheaters especially in the Asian region.
 Inconclusion I recommend this game and the developers are actively fixing bugs. I personally haven’t encountered any game braking bugs...

review:
[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*] Realism
[*] Character customization
[*] Modern graphics
[*] Constant developer support
[*] No microtransactions required
[*] Custom game modes
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*] Optimization issues
[*] Netcode issues
[*] Mediocre anti-cheat system
[/list]
[b]Verdict[/b]
[list]
[*]7/10
[/list]
PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS - the Battle Royale game that took the Steam charts by storm. From the Early Access up to the 1.0 release in 2017 and until now, PUBG Corp. has been hard at work in developing the game; bringing in new contents and improvements. However, almost every update brings about bugs and errors, along with the occasional invasion of cheaters.

The game is straightforward, drop on the map and be the last player standing. The learning curve is quite steep but upon every match, you will grasp the essence of how PUBG is played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369975960', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1574409343}
review:
The game has had its ups and downs. There is no denying that. After the "FIX PUBG" Project, I feel that the game has gotten x100 better. I have no had any issues since returning. The servers seem a ton better, input lag isn't there, bullets actually hitting and going where you are placing them. 

I am just not having issues that others are seeming to have. I have enjoyed the game since coming back a little bit ago. The most recent update seems to have done some wonders too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037736874', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1542705725}
review:
At this stage, it is hard to recommend this game. The "Fix PUBG" campaign was a staggeringly catastophic failure. The game's future promises to be murky and uncertain, not only for the game itself, but for a genre absolutely watered down by uninspiring clones with no real competition that proves to be its killer. People seem to be geniuinely worn out by Battle Royale's. However, there seems to be a sadomasochist enjoyment to joining a few mates, cracking open a few cold ones, talking absolute shit over Discord and seeing how the game's desync issues, mind-boggling physics, and guns that don't seem to react as they should can either turn you into winners, or sabotage your chances completely.

It is still the King of the Genre, but in the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is King.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304035924', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 98848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1179, 'last_played': 1575764481}
review: As EU player, I can recommend this game. It had a lot of problems, but recent patches have solved most of them. After 600 hours this game is still fun if you play with friends, it offers 3 different maps and new snow map is coming soon. I hope devs will keep up the good work. Anyway, this game is worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976764257', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 38559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 788, 'last_played': 1575761716}
review:
I have no idea why people are so hateful. Sure, there's a few bugs, but not nearly as many as people complain about. I've only experienced network connectivity issues one time during the past two months, despite playing every day. The developers are actively working on improving the game, and a lot of new improvements have been made.

I wish I could buy non-key loot boxes on demand though, rather than having 15 boxes in my inventory that requires a key.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161879557', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 22114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1573585054}
review:
The game is great, a few bugs with the vehicles but most have been patched, the few ones that excist are  compensated for with very nice weapon physics and variated combat senarios.

Most negative reviews comes from people who drop on school and cant handle the heat. This game goes deeper then just shooting everyone you see. You have to be patient, pick your fights, do rotations to get the environmental advantage, i have been in many situations aiming at my opponents head but deciding to not fire because of my position being bad. The game is even better with friends, however since the game has gotten forgotten, i suggest not playing the squad game-mode. you will only hear chinese words and you will just want to kill everyone in your team. Its just like playing solo, but while being able to hear some chinese dudes wanting to get revived in the background.

One of the best games i have every played (Duo with friends). 9/10        (solo 7/10) (Squad 4/10)

+ Very decent graphics.
+ Every game is different.
+ Alot of costumization.
+ Adrenaline pumping action.

- C h i n g  c h o n g
- Servers can have low player counts at night
- the crate system could use a change.

With all this said, should you buy it? If you have a friend who also is interested, then YES. If youre going in all alone, then it depends, i would suggest NO, but you might get some friends on the way if u decide to play and as i have mentioned, the game is best played with friends.

review: This game is hard to review. It changes so often that I don't know what it will be like soon and so many people are toxic about every little step they pull that it drives many away. BUT, I have to admit that, from all the time I have played, it is indeed a fun game with friends. I like playing it with friends in this moment and maybe not in the next year or so, but it is a great game for me in this moment and I recommend that you at least take a look at it if interested.

review: Well, in the past season I've faced multiple cheaters, problems with ping (probs even my wifi) and others things. Well there was a glitch that you could shoot thru the wall, finally fixed it, I went like few matches today and it felt good. I've also encounterd multiple problems with hardware while playing this game, few fps drops.etc.. It's fixed now, game feels smooth and looks nice on max graphics, genra isn't dead as many people say. If you wanted the game, wait for summer sale/christmas sale and pick up the game at 15-20 euros, mby even less and enjoy it with a friend or two. Winner winner, chicken dinner! G'luck and have fun!

review:

-reported a hacker said he got banned for 2 days
-1/5 times u get on, server will be busy and wont be able to connect to the game
-many glitches in the game (inventory, model, lobby, etc)
-for some reason 1/2 times i go random squad my team is all chinese 

pros:
-high learning curve but fun gameplay
-game feels pretty balanced (my opinion)
-has right amount of difficulty to make the game fun 

overall if the devs punished hackers harder and fixed server and the glitches i say it be the best game to play atm

review:
Man i never knew PacMan Battle royal is so competitive, never sweated soo hard to win, those dam ghost close in fast, also i can't believe i wasted $500 on this master piece. helpful tip get the cherry as they give you AC130 support, the ghost/zone is a one hit kill so you need to move fast, don't bother getting the pellets as they only give you .45 apc bullets. there only 2 power pellets upgrade your shitty glock 18 to a one shot kill deagle from 1m - 100000m +. i can say this PacMan battle royal is great    

and ice cream / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198276113819', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 69709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567022709}
review:
This game is much better than it seems. Its the best game I have played ever. Pubg has some bugs but they dont occure that much and arent really a thing. Most times its just one small annoying thing that doesnt matter alot(died once to a bug in 1k hours of pubg and me and my friend thought its actually pretty funny). The lags are as bad as pictured. It runs slower than a dog with 2 and a haf legs. The game gave me and my friends alot of good time and will always be memorized as on of the best or the best game I ever played. I love playing the game for what it is. Its a semi realistic game and I love that style. Im certainly too bad for Arma but I dont really like CS:GO´s realism but PUBG just hits the sweet spot. I would recommend this game to anyone who wants to get into some more realistic stuff than CSGO or just Battle Royale itself. (I came here from CSGO and learning the game is hard but awesome) The graphics are pretty good and I like them

All in all this game is very awesome with bad perfomance, a few but not really important bugs, good graphics and a great gameplay.
9/10 would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198330686426', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1536234568}
review:
Honestly, this game does not need any reviewing. PUBG is a name that is very common among the gamers today. I bought this game a while back when its popularity was on rise. The gameplay is fine and the graphics are amazing. It has managed to receive an overall mixed review, but that is all because of its early access period.
Although, the dust has now settled and plenty of people play this game today. There is a lot that can be done in PUBG (neglecting the bugs, that the creators are working hard to fix). It has been my very first Battle Royale game and the gameplay impresses me. Although, I am not a big fan of the genre, but the game definitely has a lot of potential.
Recommended for those of you who want to try a new type of online multiplayer game.

review:
Full of bugs? - Yes.
Desync? - Yes.
Hitting an enemy on the chest point blank with a shotgun and watching them survive and kill you with a pistol? - Every game.
One more round? - Yes.

To me, despite all of its flaws, this game is really fun to play. Especially if you are a group of 4. It is actually then this game shines.

Don´t buy the game if you are looking for a smooth experience. You will be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129482585', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 53597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1568082767}
review:
So.... for me this game is pretty good. 
I rarely play FPS games so this was a good way for me to ease into it.
From my experiance I would say it is much more fun to play with friends, 
that way it's not always about the CHICKEN DINNER but about the fun moments this game has to offer. 
I personally have not seen many "hackers" in the game but my friends always seem to find one in every game.
For me, the best part of this game is the new custom matches.
A group of 10 friends playing cars only normal matches is hilarious and war mode vss is super fun with a .3 circle. 

Here are the negitives (in my opinion)

It can be a running simulator at times,
Getting popped in the head as soon as you get an awesome load-out (without even firing one bullet.)
The in-game loby chat is a full on autism fest.
Everyone is better than me (AKA "HACKERS")


Anyway long story short, I recomend trying this game if you havnt yet, 
but find some folks to play it with (shouldnt be hard)

Feel free to join us if you want...

https://discord.gg/RCawWyY

author: {'steamid': '76561198248788188', 'num_games_owned': 5, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1559359278}
review:
In my opinion this is a great game, I've spent over 400 hours on this game with friends and myself. I reccomend this game to anyone who wants to have a great time in PUBG. If you are debating wether to buy pubg or have bought it but you don't like it because "you're bad" then get better lol, You need to atleast play 100 hours on this game to be decent in my opinion. If you're just starting off I'd reccomend that you play a few solo games practice looting quickly and testing guns you like and fit your playstyle, then play some squads make friends and enjoy yourself. If you don't fancy playing squads just stick to going solos and blasting Russian hardbass in the aeroplane Omegalul. I've noticed that alot of people say there's too many hackers in pubg and people shoot through walls, It's buIlshit I've never expericed anything like this people are probably getting high ping and lagging which causes them to stay in one place for a certain amount of time until your ping is reduced. I've spent quite a bit of money on this game especially on shroud Skins and keys, I reccomend you just buy the skins of the community market and the keys as well much cheaper. Anyway so my overall opinion on this game is that i't's extremely fun and a great game overall.


This is my personal opinion please refrain from any negative comments or flame.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968046898', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 35503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1571269112}
review:
I bought this game as recomended by a friend recently in a sale. It fits nicely into the simulation/survival niche, it ticks my boxes between fast arcade gameplay and brutal simulation......and manages this very well. Short fast games, with barely time to think.....at the very least it's teaching me some good map reading skills.

Too add some context i'm a long suffering DayZ fan that got tired of waiting. I uninstalled that game recently after 6-7(?) years of waiting patiently for a release. PUBG fits the gap perfectly, spookyily almost, i still pinch myself to remind me that its an Unreal engine port of DayZ, which is a standalone version of a Mod, that ran on ArmA2, which is a renamed release of the classic Operation Flashpoint.

My only request would be more vehicles, a light chopper would be nice. Hell lets just try teams, 50v50, limited vehicles, with 2 Team zones to be captured. Wouldnt take much effort and would match its rivals for more content.

Overall the sound of this game stands out above all else, the time delay on distant sniper fire, the delay of Thunder after a lightning bolt, I would give it 10/10 for sound quality.

But overall it needs work on various things, stability, graphics quality, and just a bit more content please!

Overall 7/10 (needs some work but has great potential)

review:
This is game is fun, and is certainly worth the price.
But the anti-cheat system is brutal.
I was banned for having macros setup in Razer Synapse, even though they had 0 effect in PUBG.
This violates their use terms and conditions so you can be banned for this and they will not lift the ban.

This is a warning for those who don't know that they NEED to be careful.

review: Playing it for a year now since Early Access, was really irritating in beginning due to server and performance issues. As of now, it seems to be doing quite well after they came with FixPUBG campaign, things are working nice but it lost more than half the player base that used to be around 6 months ago. Maybe they woke up too late but still the game will remain alive for a long time. The game itself is resources hungry but still Recommended if you have a PC with good hardware!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060919993', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1563475247}
review:
4:3 and 5:4 resolutions

why am i not able to see my inventory in 4:3 and 5:4 aspect ratio resolutions. it makes me very sad, that you guys dont seem to care about players that prefer to play on these resolutions.

As a game that wants to be an esports title, i think this should be at high priority.

This discussion also came up just after release, but no result. (it even got worse after the latest patch)

​Only way to play pubg on these resolutions is by setting your desktop resolution to a 5:4 or 4:3 aspect ratio and running the game in windowed borderless. I would like to see those resolution in exclusive fullscreen.
